We were out late and wanted breakfast so we came here, the food is basic diner food, the portions were huge, the wait was kind of long but it was super super busy, and it was painfully cold inside.  I was so sad I forgot my sweater, but wasn't expecting to need it when it's triple digits outside during the day.

Classic and vintage dining in Vegas. Their menu looks like a catalog because there's so many choices. Our favorite is ending the meal with a hot fudge sundae. This is a place we found thanks to so many locals suggesting it.

I have ALWAYS had a great experience here and being that it's open 24 hours a day AND it's Kid friendly, makes it really convenient for us. The decor is fun and electric (literally ELECTRIC)! It's great late night comfort food, especially when you've been drinking and partying all night...er.. when you DON'T have the kids, of course!
Okay so my review is for May 2010 when we visited here. It was our first night in Las Vegas and a first time bringing a child and...me being 7 months pregnant (so no partying for me this time! I was craving steak and was VERY skeptical about ordering it at a place like this. I ordered the New York ! New York ! 27.95 (yes, the price is quite high) ***PEPPERMILL DESCRIPTION: 12oz. hand-cut and trimmed, flame-broiled to perfection and served with sautéed mushrooms.*** Let me tell you that for someone that actually does NOT consider herself a red meat lover and eats it only on rare occassions (even though all my reviews seem to be centered on steak houses and burger joints LOL!), THIS WAS EXCELLANT EXCELLANT EXCELLANT! The kitchen staff really know their steaks! I thought there was a bone in it and kept eating around it...it was all cut with no bone! And being pregnant I had to order it more cooked than I would usually so I believe I got it Medium-Well...still amazing! Flavorful AND tender! So 5 stars there!
On another night (with our little one), we went just for dessert and ordered the Strawberry Shortcake 6.95
***PEPPERMILL DESCRIPTION: Moist slices of pound cake, a generous helping of strawberries and creamy French vanilla ice cream, all topped with real whipping cream.*** WHAT A TREAT! Fantastic! LOVED IT! We were all so tired and our little boy started getting cranky and fighting over bites and finally it ended up toppeling all over the table! Haha, it was a fun night. We love the Peppermill! ***Don't forget to wave to the kitchen staff on your way out. They REALLY appreciate that. :)
FIRESIDE LOUNGE: When my man and I go to Las Vegas as adults, we LOVE the Fireside Lounge in all it's glowing ambiance! The drinks are fun, the hostesses are beautiful and elegant and they are always nice about taking our picture by the molten fire pit, hehe. The only thing I am sad about are the TV's they put in. They are  really distracting. If anyone knows the owners there, PLEASE tell them to take them out!

I have been here twice (1 amazing and 1 horrible) I am scared to go a 3rd time. 

the first time I came the food was amazing, the servers were pleasant and I enjoyed my time. The theme here is very retro and bright. I enjoy it! 

The portions are huge (omelettes have 10 eggs, why not just make it a dozen lol) 

The 2nd time I went to the fire lounge had a bloody mary, and was seated with the same server again who was just as amazing as the 1st time. However the food was not as good. We ordered cheese sticks which were good and the nachos. I have heard the legend of these nachos and I will NEVER order them again. I got them and the beans that came on the side tasted and smelled rotten. I almost threw up! It took me 25 minutes to waive down the server when she finally came and we told her the beans were bad she took it to the kitchen, came back and said there was a problem with the beans. WELL maybe she should have checked on other tables to make sure they dont eat rotten beans. 

I am nervous to go back because I dont know if it is going to be good or bad the 3rd time I go.
Food is excellent, service is excellent, I love the decor and theme! Bar lounge is very cool.. Music is cool, I highly recommend the pepper mill ...

Though we have been going to The Peppermill Restaurant for more than 30 years, this is the first time I have checked in and reviewed on Yelp.

The Peppermill has been a 'must go' and honestly excellent choice for dining any time of day for us.

The restaurant has beautiful Tiffany lamps over each table that were made for the Peppermill specifically.  I wanted to buy one, but sadly, they are originals and made for the restaurant only. I LOVE the lamps!  They add to the ambience, along with the other lighting that reminds me of the beautiful past of Las Vegas. 

The menu is amazing, offering a multitude of choices for breakfast, lunch, brunch, dinner and all day dining.

We usually show up right after the lunch rush, when it is a little less busy.  It's a little less busy, but less likely to have to wait for a table.

The meals we chose this time were different than the usual eggs Benedict and Lorraine Omelet, or Cobb salad.  We went off the normal grid and went for sandwiches.  The menu has SO MANY things to offer, it takes a few minutes [or more] to decide.

I chose the Philly Cheese Steak sandwich on sourdough bread, sans onions and with cottage cheese instead of fries and it was delicious!  The sandwiches are HUGE and more than enough to share.  The meat was perfectly seasoned and cooked to perfection, and exactly as I ordered.  

Hubby chose the Peppermill Club sandwich, which is served with huge crispy onion rings.  Again, delicious and enough to share. It was absolutely EXCELLENT!

We were lucky enough to be in Vegas longer so on our second visit, our friend went along and ordered the pancakes. They are, like everything at the Peppermill, huge and enough to share.  Served with multiple choices of toppings, a side of eggs and choice of meat, it's a meal that will take you through the day, and again, enough to share.

I branched out on that second visit and went for the French Dip sandwich on sourdough bread, which is served with Au Jus and I chose the sweet potato fries to go with the meal. It was absolutely amazing!  Again, enough to share and more than I could possibly eat in one seating.

Hubby ordered the Peppermill Bloody Mary and said it was also wonderful.

The service is impeccable.  From the minute people are seated, they are greeted with a refreshing glass of water and offered drinks while guests have the time to peruse the menu, which genuinely does take some time to decide; so many choices!  All cooked to order and FRESH!

Honestly, we have literally been there at least 100 times since The Peppermill opened.  Collage French Toast is delicious, and my kids favorite. There are so many different things we've enjoyed over the years, and have always had a great time.

The Fireside Bar is set away from the main dining area and features an awesome fire pit lounge seating area for enjoying quite conversations, and a main bar seating area.  It's calming and beautiful.

Going to Vegas?  The Peppermill is something to make sure is on your 'must go,' list.  Hands down, one of the very best places to dine.

Wife and I needed a decent food spot that wouldn't bankrupt us, so we tried here and were pleasantly surprised. Walking in the restaurant scared me abit because I thought we entered a strip club on accident.

We were seated promptly and given our drinks. The waitress was friendly and aided us in finding good choices on the menu. I ordered a sandwich called the conquest, and it was good. Loaded with various meats and toppings, you won't be leaving hungry. The portion sizes of the food are more than adequate for the cost.

The only downside I had was they were out of bud light, even though they had a giant banner advertising a special on the front of the building. I was happy with the experience though and will return.

This is the place to go if you want 24 hour diner food in Vegas. I have been here on two separate trips now and the food was great. For as many staff members as they have, the service seems to be a little bit behind, but not lacking to the point that you are annoyed. They have full bar service 24 hours a day as well with cocktail waitress service. You can get breakfast, lunch, or even just drinks. It is located toward the end of the strip near the stratosphere so it is a cab ride away if you are staying anywhere else on the strip.

The food was good but the service was not very good. First off I had to ask for my server to come to our table. I got a kids meal for my baby which was the pasta. I asked for the meat sauce and the spaghetti sauce was spicy, I'm sure most kids don't want spicy food. The manager came and said yeah the sauce is kinda spicy so it was barely even eaten and I looked confuse because what restaurant feed kids spicy food. I told them to take the food cause my baby didn't want to eat it but I will still pay for it but they insisted that I don't have to pay for it. Then they came back rushing us out asking if we want a to go box, when we were still eating and drinking, how rude is that !! Our server was talking to her boyfriend a table just right in front of us and I have to try to get her attention every time we needed something. But the manager at that time was kind of pushing us to leave which was rude.

Went there for the first time on a Monday night. Got in right away wasn't very crowded at all. Well my wife decided she was not that hungry so we shared the Fish and Chips out of all things. Caesar salad was good and so was the fish. Came with a ton of curly fries. Thought it was worth the price. I would definitely come back again and at least try for breakfast. The night we went they only accepted cash and our waitress took forever to take our order and then get me the check. She was busy hanging out with friends at another table, very irritating as we needed the check to get to go to a show.
I used to go here fairly often when I worked nights. It's a great place to grab a late/early meal with friends. Large portions, reasonably priced, cool retro lighting.

I was introduced to the Peppermill by a good friend who is a Vegas local. He brought me here for the first time in May 2016. Now on my 6th Vegas trip of 2016, I've made it a point to come in and have breakfast at least one of the mornings I am here. I've come to Vegas with different people on most of my trips this year and have always brought them here and they enjoy it too. Love the casual, fun ambiance and culture of the restaurant. Can definitely say my favorite meal is the French Toast Collage and a nice big Mimosa from the bar.

Yeah, yeah, yeah it's Vegas & I get it's gonna be pricey, but $30 for two vodka red bulls in the lounge while we waited for our table is a bit pricey for a restaurant. 

When we were seated, we were greeted by the complimentary photographer right away. It took a little longer for the server but they were busy so no big deal. We were on vacation anyway, who's in a hurry? 

Bloody mary & corned beef hash and eggs for me. 

Both were delicious & the plate of food was HUGE! 

Not a bad spot.

I mean, it's the PEPPERMILL! If you haven't been here before this is the quintessential Vegas greasy spoon. I have been here several times to satisfy my LATE night drunkin' hankerings for the best breakfast in Vegas. This was the first time that I actually came during normal business hours for a 10am Saturday breakfast. The food didn't disappoint. However, there were huge crowds that I'm not used to seeing (although it will be almost full at 3am on a Wednesday). There was almost an hour wait for a party of two. The secret here is to look for openings at the kitchen bar. It is first come first served. We put our names on the list and then I immediately noticed that there were two seats open at the bar. We sat down and were able to immediately order. We enjoyed our food and paid our bill while people that were on the list before us were still waiting to be seated. They don't take reservations so if you're coming with a large group on a weekend be prepared for a decent wait.

We saw they had a happy hour so we decided to check it out, as the night before when we walked by it was jammin.  We had the happy hour specials.  They give you alot of food.   It was my husband, my 2 kids (9/11)  We had ordered 2 chicken strips and fries, sliders, buffalo wings, bruchessetta, and cheese sticks!  and the kids had drinks, and we had the Bicardi dreamsicle (Definitely recommend).  We had leftover food.  The chicken strips are the size of a hand.  My son and I could of shared a plate!   My daughter loved her wings.  It was a great value for all the food!  Our bill was $85 with tip!   the staff is friendly and fast.  The ambience was great as well!!

Ate here for lunch. Free parking in lot. Wait time was zero as we got seated immediately. Service was good . Water tasted a little chlorine aroma. Breakfast foods or sandwiches were menu picks. Food items tasted good and nice presentation. Food seems to be a good value.
Really good food and a great selection.  Love their hash browns.  I really enjoy the service as well.  I appreciate that they take drink orders right away.  This is a place I frequent when in Vegas.
Busting at the seams!!  I highly advise that you share a plate.  All of the plates are HUGE portions.  I'm a repeat offender and have never been disappointed.

If you ever wondered why people are sooo fat go to this restaurant. Slap my thigh but damn are the portions huge. That aside, looks like a 70's night club, great service, alcohol 24/7 of course. Funny though going to breakfast feeling like shit and being served a cocktail with your pancakes by a girl in a evening dress.  

Yes its on the strip but further up by circus circus on your right. Lots of parking,
Ham steak is the best I've ever eaten!  Won't even bother ordering anything else.

Best Southern Country fried steak ever! they give a good amount of gravy too not shady on it :) mine came with fresh blueberry muffin! it tasted like it came fresh out the oven! :)
My BF got  the biscuits and gravy is it was amazing too.
Their Cream of mushroom soup is one of the best I've had.
One of my favorite breakfast diners in vegas :)
Burgers and garlic fries are the best. Huge food portions. Fun atmosphere. Great place a lot of locals go to. As a bar in the back. Service is mediocre at bests.
Food was amazing, HUGE, HUGE, HUGE portions...share, share, share.  Decor is well......strange. Great food, a must experience. Just strange setup.
I had breakfast this morning, it was one of the best breakfast I've had in a long time. The prices seem expensive but the portions are huge, and everything is cooked to perfection
A crazy retro dinner with great ambiance. The portions are huge and very good. The 24 hour breakfast menu is highly recommended.

When in Vegas and you are really hungry the Peppermill is your place. Tons of great food options and the portions are huge. We eat there all the time and never disappointed.  Open 24hours and the service is great.

Yeah this place is still Crazy Sexy Vegasy Cool! 40 years now! It's one of the very few free standing restaurants on LVBLVD.  

Crazy: Faux plants and cherry blossom trees everywhere. They got Tiffany lamps with pink flamingos...what's even crazier that it's still shiny new. The place does not look dated. AT ALL. Oh and not one speck of dust or dirt. The whole place is pristine. They've got someone assigned to sweep the carpet even.

Sexy: Waitresses still don the cute mini dress uniforms and the cocktail waitresses still wear long dresses with the high leg slits. Cozy circular purple velour booths. It all still looks like what I remember when I used to frequent the Peppermill lounges back in the day with my hot date aka Mr. B. 

Vegasy Cool: Disco day glo colors of purple, pink and teal. Just the whole late 70's early 80's era theme still preserved. Fun, showy and flashy. I love it!
 
Oh yeah the food: Everything on the menu, served 24/7! Darn it, they didnt preserve the 70's prices but at least the prices not as high like they charge at strip resorts.But not Denny's cheap either. Our meal came out to pretty much what we pay for two lunches,drinks and dessert $40 something  ..not bad at all.  Along with breakfast, they also have sandwiches, burgers, salads and pasta.

My tradition was always ordering breakfast and a banana split late night! I still do. The serving portions are still ginormous.  2 scoops each of Vanilla, Chocolate and Strawberry ice cream. That's enough to share w/3 more people according to our server.
 
Service: Great! Especially since it was fairly busy.
 
We had a real pleasant time here and will most likely be back.
The food is average, but the portions are large. The French toast was decent and the sausages are huge and pretty delicious. Some cocktails were fairly to poorly made.

Good food great drinks!! .. The wait can be long sometimes but it's very well worth it! Try a Bloody Mary for an hangover ;) or a coronarita! Great and interesting decor! The front hostess was rude.. And our friend got a beer spilled on him.. Other than that it was great lol...

The first brunch place we have found out in Vegas and we both loved it. The Turkish sausage with three eggs and hashed potatoes as well as the halfed banana were what we have ordered. The size was so huge that eventually we end up with sharing and could not finish the icecream. Waitress was very attentive.

Fun atmosphere and pimp Vegas decor!

Let's begin this review by saying - if you haven't been here, you're missing out!

This place is open 24/7. Located on the strip, near Encore & Wynn. Fireplace lounge (don't miss this part) perfect for cold Vegas nights. Great early & late happy hour specials. Crazy colors & lights everywhere. Extensive cocktail menu. Breakfast served all day & night. HUGE desserts perfect for sharing. Great diner food with something for everyone.

In a nutshell this is a Vegas classic and just a fun spot. Be prepared to be dazzled...

Okay, the decor is awful and cheesy (but I guess that is part of the fun as well as a statement that the times may change, but Peppermill doesn't out of some sense of righteousness, laziness, and/or lack of funds).  They make the waitresses wear these awful, ugly uniforms (it reminds me of the flair Jennifer Aniston had to put up with in Office Space).

We went here for breakfast, and it wasn't actually okay.  The omelettes and pancakes were both good.  And for breakfast, it is a little different food and atmosphere than you get in the buffets on the mostly Disney-fied Las Vegas strip.

This review is for the Fireside Lounge only as we didn't eat in the restaurant portion.  Loved the intimate couches and fireplaces.  The couches are done in swanky pink/purple velvet.  Total throwback to the 70s.  Our waitress was friendly and gave us some good drink recommendations.  It's a great place for an after dinner drink and intimate conversation.  They give you complimentary honey roasted nuts and aren't quick to rush you out or bother you too much.

I'll start by saying the server, Nellie, was wonderful. The food was very well made as well. Unfortunately, due to the unprofessional and extremely rude attitude of the manager on duty at the time, Peggy, I have to give this establishment 1 star.

While in the restroom, a male employee opened the door and said "Lady, I have to clean"  and added something along the lines of telling me to hurry up. 

I went up to the host podium and politely asked to speak with a manager. Peggy said that she was the manager, so I told her that I appreciate the fact that they keep their restroom cleans for their guests. However, having a male employee open the door and ask you to hurry up is unsettling and was an unpleasant experience. 

Peggy then proceeded to tell me that he couldn't have said that to me because, "he doesn't even speak English". I responded by stating he knew enough to stay that. I can excuse the way he said that, knowing that there was in fact a language barrier. That's fine, I am not saying anything poor in regards to his work ethic. It's hard to work somewhere where the predominant language is not your own. 

However, to be told he didn't say that to me, is condescending, unprofessional and rude. A manager should never speak that way to a guest and they definitely should not end the conversation, which was civil (I wasn't yelling or making a scene, I was simply telling her it was an off putting encounter), by then walking away without another word. 

It wasn't busy. At that time, there was only one couple waiting to be seated. If I was the owner, this woman would never be representing their establishment. Such an unfortunate situation because everything else from the food to the decor was lovely.

I loved the atmosphere and the good food. If you are very hungry they ll feed you like a wolf. I just didn't give 5 stars cuz there was a lady taking photos and selling them to you but first she introduced herself as being part of the restaurant deal but she ended up being an outside vendor. After offering me a free deal she presented a set of photos to be purchased. I think the manager at Peppermill should have prevented to warn customers from this kind of unwanted visits while you are eating at the table.
Great old Vegas favorite.  Big menu, large portions,tasty food, attentive service, retro surroundings equals five stars
Ordered the French Dip and it was okay.  The biscuts and gravy were mediocre and the French Toast was good.  Very large portions.

Wow what a find! My wife and I took a walk up "The Strip" from Wynn and we stumbled across this place for breakfast. The portions are great and the food was outstanding! It is diner type food, but a bit higher style and quality.

Very nice change of pace as far as price/service goes from the options in the hotels! We felt very welcomed by the staff. 

We would recommend this to anyone staying on the North or Mid points on "The Strip"; It's an easy walk and on the east side of the road.

Love this place! Excited I finally found where I will bring all my friends and family for breakfast or late night treat. Large portions / cooked precisely / we had 3 servers, one didn't speak English. The seating is great you don't feel crowded and you feel like you are in your own private place. The servers need to tell the guests "you pay at the front". The bathrooms were discussting, over flooded toilet and stalls out of toilet paper / clearly this area needs more attention, it's dive bar gross.

What a cool place!  The Peppermill, particularly the Fireside lounge portion, is like being transported back to 70s Vegas.  Lots of neon lights and plush seating.  They have a cool water based fire pit.  Hard to describe but very cool. Its a nice lounge to order drinks while you wait to be seated to eat.  The restaurant portion is also very unique with fake plants making it feel like your eating in some odd cross between the jungle and a Dennys. For food, you get a ton of food for your buck.  So its awesome by any measure. The food itself wont blow you away but its solid fare. I ordered biscuits and gravy and its a TON of biscuits and gravy.  I got sides of eggs and hashbrowns (if you want it crispy I recommend you ask for that as mine were kinda soft) and I couldn't finish half.  While we were there we tried both the mimosas and the bloody marys (if you get an extra shot, then its def a stout drink!) and we enjoyed both.  Our service at both the lounge and the restaurant was excellent. Our waitress was particularly good and on top of her game.  The peppermill is def a gem that will recommend to others looking for good food after a hard night, or morning, of drinking and gambling.

A new favorite hotspot in Vegas! Their food is decent, but their real claim to fame is that fabulous firepit with waitress service. Sipping a mai tai or bloody mary sitting fireside was a wonderful experience with a great group of friends. I could have sat there all day. Check it out after grabbing a bite, since the lounge doesn't have a full menu like inside.

Everyone was super friendly. It took our waiter forever to come though. It was fine, they were packed so we were understanding. My daughter ordered a kids meal and I ordered an adult entree. My entree came with a chicken noodle soup. It was good. So good, that my daughter ate that and was full by the time her own food came out (which was a ridiculously huge portion by the way). I had the New york steak dinner with mashed potatoes and mushrooms. My mashed potatoes were awful. My mushrooms were too garlicky, unedibley garlicky and my steak was plain. Lucky for them that is how i like my steak because it has no flavor, none. my aunt had some kind of fusilli pasta with pancetta and tomatoes, which was very good. the best thing anyone at the table ordered actually. and it was way overpriced for what we got. I know the portions are huge, but i would have gladly had a smaller meal with a smaller price tag. half of our meal got tossed because we couldn't finish it anyway. live and learn.
A way out there neighborhood spot with a HUGE menu and HUGE portions. Food was ok, could have been a bit warmer. Service was friendly.

Ok ok ok.  I know.  But this place has my heart.  It's a Vegas staple.  It's like the best late night eats.  Everything you could want or need on the menu, fancy cocktail waitresses in long gowns delivering crazy drinks,  and the adjacent fireside lounge where old people go to make out. Who wouldn't give 5 stars?

I come here often,  as it's in between my work,  my gym,  my drinking spots,  and my house lol. I've been disappointed a few times by eggs not done right,  but hey,  they put up with a TON of drunk and disorderly tourists on a nightly basis.  

 My recommendations on the menu include almost anything breakfast,  the chicken wings,  the French dressing that you can get in the side salad, the cottage cheese and...omg... the Sin City BLT. Dude,  this thingis so delish.  It's a BLT made on extra yummy Texas toast,  with thick cut bacon,  lettuce,  tomato,  and...a fried egg with pesto aoli....damn! That sandwich is so good! Hits all the spots.  Breakfast,  lunch,  and dinner cravings all in one meal.
Always one of my favorite places to go ANYTIME in Las Vegas

I have been here before, but this was the first time for my parents. They and we absolutely love the food here. Good price and huge portion sizes. This is a great place for family and friends and the staff is also excellent. If you are in the city and need a place to eat that kind if takes you back to old Vegas, this is your stop.

Have seen the place over the years of working in, or just visiting Las Vegas.  Finally decided to try it after reading all the reviews.  I enjoyed the look of the place, and the lounge is small, but kind of cool.

Don't know what all the 5 stars are for, perhaps for the look of the establishment, couldn't have been for the food.  The food was just okay.  I ordered eggs, sausage links and hash browns (they don't serve home fried potatoes - what a shame).  I was disappointed that the sausage links are turkey.  They also tasted like nasty.  My hash brown potatoes were cold.

Our service was terrible.  Our waitress seemed to prefer spending more time at other tables than ours.  I never got that second cup of coffee I asked for during the meal, only when I asked for the check did she ask if I still wanted more coffee.  Really?  We also asked for extra napkins and condiments, and towards the very end of our meal they came.  

One last thing.  I ordered a Bloody Mary at the lounge while waiting to eat breakfast.  For the price, you'd think it would be fantastic.  Not.  Plain tomato juice and a splash of booze.  It tasted like I was drinking plain tomato juice.  I was very, very disappointed, sitting in those very, very uncomfortable chairs at the bar.

My overall opinion is to stay away from the place, as it serves up food just a notch below Denny's.  It's bloody Mary's are terrible.  Both the food and the drinks are overpriced for what you're receiving, especially compared to other restaurants.  The service was for me terrible, especially when noticing that how they treat you like shit, then dote on others around you.      If you're going to cook and serve food, at least cook and serve it the same for each customer.  Not specific ones.

They seem to pat themselves on the back for having a restaurant with a lounge that has survived there for awhile (just an observation from the menu).  All I have to say is people are idiots if they keep coming back.  Over priced food and drinks.  Underwhelming flavor.  Terrible service.  Trust me, you'd be better off at McDonald's.

I really don't remember everything about this experience. It was early morning after partying in Vegas! I do remember how yummy the food was though.. I always love a good eggs Benedict when I can barely walk. Fun times. When I came out of the restaurant the sun was rising. The next thing I remember was waking up in my tight room at Aria!

One of my favorite spots in Vegas for breakfast or lunch. Tasty chicken fried steak, poached eggs and waffles. My favorite is the walnut creek salad with Bartlett pears, Mandarin oranges, cranberries, fresh greens, walnuts and chicken breast. Always fresh and delicious. If you go on the weekend, be prepared to wait. Excellent service every time.

The only real reason that someone could give this classic eatery any rating other than 5 Stars, is that it stays so busy there may be a wait for a seat.  In my opinion this is the best restaurant in town and is where the locals go daily.  Menu is huge and the service friendly and fast.  Where else can you get traditional Corned Beef Hash with 3 poached eggs on top, a huge side of potatoes and a muffin for under $10.00.  And I promise you will be taking half of the order home with you.  A Classic in every sense and a sure stop for me when in town.
Awesome breakfast! Make sure you are hungry, the portions are huge, 8 eggs omelet!!! Great service too!

Since we had a evening flight, we decided a decent meal and rest for a long next day was best. I had not been to Peppermill since 2009. So I checked the Yelp Las Vegas and Instagram reviews and it got a green light. We spied on the table close to the door and the "Nachos, Nachos, Nachos" with Ground Beef looked amazing! So of course we checked reviews and ordered the "Nachos, Nachos, Nachos" as well. Now let me tell you were it went wrong: Our server insisted that the Ground Beef was way too greasy and we should get it with Chicken. That my IG friends was a HUGE mistake! The chicken was flavorful, but it was a mountain of cheese, chicken, and some of the strongest white onions I have encountered in a couple months. We had to ask for the refried beans and got no Sour Cream or Guacamole. We regretted not ordering the Greasy Ground Beef!  The Burgers were very good: Pastrami Burger and PepperMill Burger...burgers were seasoned well, not overcooked, and bread was fresh. I will good back next year, but for breakfast. ____
____
#foodieontheroad #stlmetrofoodie

The waitress was not friendly 
The food is ginormous portions .
I was told I could not order a junior menu which was the only option on the menu with 1 egg and bacon 
The rude waitress said it was not her rule 
But because I was not a junior I was turned away .
How crazy is that ? A restaurant denies you food because they do not have a smaller option
Would not recommend this service .

Was there for breakfast, the food wasnt that good actually so I was a bit dissapointed, had very high hopes for this place.
The decor is super 80's and fun. The prices are on the + side but so are the portions.
Maybe next time I visit I will only go to the lounge area, skip the rest.

Late-night eats, retro Vegas style! The massive multi-page menu of diner-style food has something for everyone- but portions are so large you can easily share. If you want to get your drink on, the Lounge menu has cocktails.

Leave your diet at home and get a bunch of apps to share- the nachos are huge and the wings are meaty. If you want to be somewhat healthy, they have tons of salads. The side spinach salad has bacon and hard-boiled egg with a zesty French dressing. The fish and chips are huge and juicy, served with a mountain of curly fries. In the winter, get their hot chocolate with whipped cream for a sweet treat.

Service is friendly, they also have an in-house photographer who walks around. Interior is super fun, with neon lights, built-in trees, and large, cushy booths. Food comes out fast despite the crowds, but you're best off coming on a weeknight to avoid the drunk tourists.

I practically grew up in New Jersey diners, so to see a diner laced with Las Vegas DNA was quite a sight. The Peppermill is precisely what it ought to be as a classic diner - giant menu, stainless steel exterior, breakfast all day. But it also has a full bar, a photographer and a clientele that is clearly a mix of locals, people starting their day, and people ending their day.

I tried the gyro (excellent), the onion rings (excellent) and an omelette (also excellent). They play the favorites and do them well. I strongly recommend a visit. You will have more fun there than any buffet on the Strip.

Its been 10 years since I'd come here and this joint did not dissapoint! My in-laws were so impressed we cancelled Hells Kitchen reservations so we could eat there another night. Love the Sin City BLT. Pancakes are amazing. Be sure to check out the lounge. Really cool Vegas mainstay.
Ordered a BLT, waited nearly an hour, no word from the waiter, finally left. I get when it can get busy. The waiter did not care, which is a problem.
this place is amazing the best bloody mary's in town. and my french toast was deelish. Gotta check out the bar lounge, it has a really cool fireplace to sit around and snuggle
Was there a few years ago. Word of mouth. That was a smart mouth! Super cool place. Great food. Will not ever go to Vegas without going there.

This is the first time we ate at the Peppermill. From the outside it looks like a 1950s diner. Once you get inside other reviews called it a Denny's wannabe while others compare the decorating to a cruise ship. I think both of those descriptions are appropriate, only in a very positive way. Our server came to the table right away. She took our drink orders and answered questions about the menu. The couple we went with had there before. They warned us about the size of the portions and so we decided to share a salad. Boy that was enough. We had the steak salad. They prepared the steak perfectly. Volume of food was huge. We certainly did not leave hungry. I would recommend this restaurant for an informal meal at a very reasonable price. Don't expect anything fancy. But the food is good and I will plan to go back again.

AWESOME, AMAZING, DELICIOUS, A LOT! We visited this place three times because it was so yummy. We had the largest pancakes I've ever seen. The best omelet called the Marzarti which the highlight is the spaghetti sauce and the sour dough toast. I can say I'm not a late person but I ate almost the whole 8 egg omelet with the SAUCE. Also, their sampler is delic which we sub the shrimp out for curly fries. The wings are great, even the next day. WE WILL BE BACK!!!
One of the best local late night hangouts in Vegas! Whenever friends or family come to town I make sure to take them to the fire pit room.
Great Food!!  Kooky Atmosphere!!  A must-try when you're in Sin City!
This place is terrible. I don't care that it's a landmark. Everything is expensive and tastes mediocre at best.
You can't complete the Vegas trip if you don't visit this restaurant! . Foods are always amazing. The best chicken wings and French toast !!!!!

We stopped for breakfast on our way out of town this morning. I was pleasantly surprised to find ample parking for a full sized pickup even though they were busy. After a 10 min wait, we were treated with a huge breakfast. Yes, it's traditional fare, but the food was great and the service exceptional.
Are here everyday for a week and found something amazing every time. The menu has everything. And those hot muffins are ooey gooey greatness.
The Maserati omelet was to die for! The "hot" blueberry muffin as my wife said was "hot, hot, hot!!"
I love this restaurant! I'm vegan and they accommodate me :) me and friends always come here for a late nice snack our waitress was really pretty and nice her name was Krystal

After a very long wait we were pleased to see generous portions. Had a burger and gyro, overall pretty good. Service was a little lacking but they were slammed so understood. Breakfasts are definitely big enough to share!

Meh. A little on the greasy side. Went for breakfast and the portions were ginormous. The food was decent, on par with Denny's or Coco's, aside of the huge portions. I'm a fan of the large coffee mugs though.

If I could give this place 10 stars I would. It's amazing!!! If u go for breakfast, there's almost always a line but who cares when u can wait in there bar lounge. It's decor is so 80's and it's cool. It's definitely different. The bagels with jam is unbelievably delicious as well as their Bloody Mary's!
Love this place food big portions and not over priced staff super nice. Love the atmosphere the neon light remind me of the 80's

This place is so strange! A fireside lounge on one side and a diner-style restaurant on the other?! This review is for the restaurant only.

The fake trees and flowers and colorful lights are a bit cheesy, but I really like it! Makes for beautiful pictures! There's also a guy coming around to the tables taking pictures trying to get you to buy them. They're super cute, but does anyone actually buy those?!

The portions are HUGE HUGE HUGE. The two of us couldn't finish an omlette, a bowl of clam chowder, and a milkshake! Hell, we only finished half of it! We're big eaters too x_x I don' remember which omlette we ordered, but it had a lot of meat and it was okay at first but pretty sickening after a while. The vanilla shake was good. It's the thick kind, which usually isn't my thing. Clam chowder was way too salty and just not good. I think a can of Campbell's Chunky clam chowder is 100x better! 

I think the Peppermill would be a perfect late night filler, but I don't think I'd come here again unless I was seeking out drunk food.
Great "diner". Huge portions. Usually service is good. Perfect hangover food. I love this place.

Legit!  This place is super cool. I really felt like I had a genuine Vegas experience coming to this restaurant. The portions are huge! I know, don't complain and it's what I should expect. I couldn't finish everything and it's hard for me to waste food. 
Loved it

A Vegas Classic. This place is like a mullet, business up front, party in the back.  The front restaurant is pretty much a "Denny's" but the back has late night bar food, sunken booths with a fire pit and old school decor with neon lights and probably the original lights from 1980.  So fun!

The food is exactly what you would expect, bar food.  Good quality but bar food nonetheless.

I was looking forward to the Peppermill tonight. I was highly disappointed. After waiting 40-45 minutes for 2 BLTs we walked out. The waiter disappears and could not care about our order. Other tables near us complained of slow service.

24 hour diner with classic 70's -80's? theme. Portions are large and shareable for 2 people.

Chicken quesadilla: 6 pieces that comes with sour cream and salsa sauce. Good! Taste just like a chicken quesadilla. No complaints.

Hash Browns: Not as crispy as I wanted it to be. I wouldn't order it as a side next time.

I wouldn't mind coming back here again to try some more dishes. The omelettes look really good.

We made it a point to beat the breakfast crowd n hit the road earlier in fear of Vegas hostage-style traffic on the desert stretch. Much better this time but still spotty service... our server was there and then she couldn't be found. Depending on where they tuck you, coffee guys may not circulate often either.

Anyway, still had a good time n received yet another complimentary souvenir pic. If you're not too hungry, consider sharing cuz portions are huge. I got the Joe's SF Scramble and hubs ordered the Maserati Omelette. Both were good, but I felt like we could've shared one and still had leftovers. No joke, they're serious about feeding you.

I've been to Vegas many times. It was my very first time. Reminds me of vintage Vegas. I suggest when waiting for your table head out to the fireside lounge. At first I was thrown off by the decor. It's like neon Vegas meets outdoor indoor look. They couldn't  decide what Look they wanted I guess. 
Food: Portions are huge. I had a pina colada and a turkey sausage, hash brown potatoes, scramble eggs with bread. I wish my colada was bigger lol 
My sister had a Belgian waffle with syrup. They give a lot of syrup. 
It's like Denny's with reasonable prices but tastier and better.

My wife and I went to Peppermill Las Vegas for our 11th Wedding Anniversary celebration. Our plan was to spend a couple of hours for our dining experience. We were promptly greeted by several people who were trying to make our dining experience amazing. We were promptly brought bread and menus. My wife ordered Chicken and Red Pepper Pasta which was amazing. I ordered the Ribeye steak, medium. It was brought to me cooked medium well or more done. My server asked to take it back. When she brought it back, it was cooked properly but was about 20% gristle and fat. The menu price listed for the steak was $32.95 but I was charged $36.95. Our out price was almost $90 and the main course of my meal was not only aweful, but by the time I finally received my properly cooked steak, I only had time to cut the fat and gristle off of it but not enough time to eat it because of an event that we had planned. The server was awesome and very apologetic. A nice lady came by and took our picture and gave us one with a very sweet note on the back.  Although all of the people were very nice and the restaurant was very welcoming, the overpricing from the listed menu price and the terrible and very expensive grisly and fat steak will keep us away.  Thank you, but NO THANKS!

This place has become a go-to for my family ever since we have bee coming to Vegas! I did not know the reason why growing up, but I know now. 

We recently came here during our Christmas break and dang! Their food is sure tasty, and comes in big portions! So for the price you pay, you definitely get your money's worth. They give you so much food that you can share it with 3 people and STILL be full! Dang. Money's. worth. 

I got their Marco Polo omelet, which was so tasty! Their sauce on top just made it so good, and the omelet is really huge! It comes with hash browns and your choice of bread. We also got their bagels, and woah. The bread was so fresh, that it was easy and smooth to pull apart. It made eating bagels a lot more pleasing. 

Service wise, they are really great at getting to you! We never usually have trouble with service, and that's with saying being an occasional customer for the past 10+ years! It does get crowded, but they usually seat you quickly enough so you don't have to wait long. 

The restaurant is very interesting to look at. Definitely reflects the busy like of Vegas, expect they have trees inside the restaurant. Very weird, but I can deal with it. 

They have their own parking lot, which is great because there is always parking. Woo! 

Come on by here for a great brunch after a night out of turning up at the clubs, or before you start venturing out into Vegas with a full stomach!

It's always crowded but worth the wait!  The food is big portions so make sure u are hungry!  Waitress on first visit very nice, attentive and prompt service!  Came back 2 days later and the wait was 15-20 min so we waited in the lounge.  Got seated but waited at least 15 minutes for our order to be taken then 15 min later the waitress came and us repeat our order so I guess we waiting longer..  not very happy today.  You can order alcohol but that is a separate tab.  They are known for their bloody Mary's.

Really disappointed after reading rec in USA Today and having locals endorse it. Read others' reviews about juicy burgers; ours were dry but still a bit cold in middle.  I had the pesto burger; everything but the meat was good. My husband's mushroom burger was also dry. Our fries and rings were unremarkable, and it wasn't as inexpensive as I expected. Cool to see inside.

Quintessential Las Vegas! For food the Diner part is open 24/7 to service all your diners cravings food on the most is pretty good. But for a lil more edgy fun come here to the Lounge, grab a few friends sit down by the fire pits order a Scorpian sit back chat and ppl watch! You'll enjoy the low lighting with neon LV strip lights and if you come after the clubbing/show hours maybe seeing your fav Dj's or local performers.

Went to the Peppermill at 11 a.m. on a Sunday while visiting Vegas with the family. There was a 30 minute wait and the place was packed! My husband ordered the beef kabobs, son ordered turkey burger w/sweet potato fries, sister ordered fettuccine with side of fruit, and I ordered eggs, hash browns and biscuits with gravy. Everyone said that the food they ordered was really good and my eggs were cooked perfectly. The service was exceptional! They went above and beyond to accommodate me with a knee scooter (ankle surgery). We visit Vegas for an annual race and will definitely go back! Great food, service and cool decor!

Portions were huge and the food was really good.  We were actually headed to a different restaurant when our cab driver recommended this one for us to try.  The only off thing was the service.  We only saw our waitress 3 times the entire time we were there and it took her 20 minutes before she came to our table the first time.  Once she came she wanted to take our order and we didn't see her again till she dropped off the food.  After that the only time we saw her again was to bring the check.  We needed more butter and syrup and we couldn't ever find her to get anymore.

Classic. Old School Vegas Gem.

Great food and service.  The Lounge by the fire is one of the best places to hang out and drink with your friends.  We spent "Super Bowl Saturday" here.  We relaxed in a big booth by the fire and enjoyed specialty cocktails way into the night.  Then went and rested up for the Big Game in 2004.  Fun times with good friends are where memories are made. 10 years later and I still remember the time....

 Love this place~

Got to try this old school diner while I was in Vegas over the weekend. It's near Stratosphere so towards the end of the strip. On the outside, it doesn't look like much but when you enter you at first think you are at a strip club! Their neon lights threw me off. They also have fake cherry blossom trees inside. Very eclectic decor. We sat in a booth. 

I had the Pastrami Cheeseburger. A burger with pastrami added. It had the word "YUM" at the end of its description and I was sold. You have a choice of a side so I had the onion rings. The burger was definitely good. Very filling to say the least. I couldn't finish my yummy onion rings. They were so crispy just how I like it! I also had their Kiss My Cucumber drink with Hendrick's Gin. A refreshing drink. 

Service was good. Lots of parking.

I ordered the munches breakfast meal and it contained Portuguese sausage, green/red peppers, onions, has browns, and topped with a layer of egg. Side of wheat toast.

It was so DELICIOUS! The hostess and the waitress was very generous and setting is very clean. Despite how busy it was on a Sunday, we was seated very quickly.

The next time I come here I'm trying the country fried steak!

:):):):)

I love that you have to walk through the diner to get to the bar.
Make yourself comfy on the red naugahyde next to the firepit and get yerself a great big 'ol drink.
Another Vegas favorite of mine. Can't say I've ever actually eaten at the Peppermill though. However, I've had plenty to drink at the Fireside and can definitely say it's tops.

Super busy place on Saturday mornings for breakfast.  Very friendly wait staff.  A bit pricey but normal for the Strip.  Fortunately, the portions are large!  My corned beef hash tasted like it came out of a can and not from a fresh corned beef - which is preferable by my standards!  

A guy comes around and very nicely takes a group photo of your table and prints it on to a free postcard of the Peppermill and then tries to sell you a larger photo for your coffee table.  What the heck - we bought two.  

No casino here.  But just as much old Vegas flash.

I have never eaten at the restaurant which looks like a diner but I have been to the lounge a few times. The lounge is a hidden gem in Vegas. Relaxing couches to enjoy a cocktail on and designed to provide you with enough privacy to make it romantic if you choose. Cocktails are priced fairly so if your in Vegas stop by and enjoy an unexpected treat in the desert...

Service is AMAZING, food is incredible. My husband had the joes San Francisco favorite, and I had the tostado omelet.  The chili in my omelet was soooooo good and the portion sizes are incredibly large. I also ordered a Hawaiian sunset drink that I finished before I even got my food.  SO GOOD!!!

The Peppermill never fails. It's likely the best 24/7 on the strip, and probably in all of Vegas. The restaurant has the ambience of Charlie Murphy's Hollywood stories with Prince and Rick James. The fireside lounge is a more intimate setting. It has a fire pit surrounded by lounge seating, it's own bar and food menu. Every trip to Vegas deserves a trip to the Peppermill.

We started coming to this restaurant 30 yrs ago when we lived in CA and we've been coming here ever since. It's now a TRADITION for my children and their families as well.  
We've since moved to LV and now bring all our Out-of-Town guest here for their send off breakfast.

This is always my first stop when I get to Vegas.  The atmosphere reminds me of Pulp Fiction.  The food comes in large portions, enough to share, and will leave you filled for the day.  The price is pretty great considering it's vegas.  This place is swanky and my fave.
Ambience leaves much to be desired, and food was basic and bland. Not sure what the draw is unless you're still out at 4AM and need a hangover meal. Definitely wouldn't make an effort to go back.
Grrrrrrrreat breakfast. It was our first time, ever, there and the service and food was fantastic.

This place is always packed, but more so in the mornings. Be it people stopping there during their walk of shame back to their hotels, locals or out of towners trying to beat those who slept in and opted for the late hotel check out. 
The portions are big and the menu is diverse.  
One thing i would probably stay away from ordering again is the hot chocolate. It was just ok.

Growing up in Marin Co. in Northern CA, there was a Peppermill in the next town.  As a teenager, we'd go in late night for coffee and french fries to gather and gossip.  Lots of good memories for me.  That Peppermill is long gone, but I always indulge when I'm in Vegas.  They are open 24/7.  Want breakfast after an all night bender playing cards in the casinos or a Sundae dessert to drown your sorrows after a March Madness loss?  Go to Peppermill.

Peppermill is a throwback time machine trip to the 70s, and I mean that in the best way possible.  The restaurant decor is plush, comfy booths with neon lighting and the waitresses serve in Playboy bunny-like outfits.  The cocktail waitresses wear polyester evening gowns and serve drinks inside the Fireside lounge with a firepit made of lavarock.  Definitely a "boom chica wow wow" vibe.  They are popular at all hours of the day, so don't be surprised if you'll wait a few minutes to be seated.   The secret is out.

Service is excellent.  Coffee is always hot, fresh and bottomless and you'll never go without a refill.  Inclusive of the rainbow sugar dispenser on the table. I indulge in their iced tea.  I learned the serve Teva brand and I am a big fan.  Food is Americana fanfare and you can't go wrong with diner style comfort food.  Burgers are huge and a satisfying portion.   I enjoyed the 3-tier Club Sandwich. Freshly sliced real turkey (not processed lunch meat)  crisp bacon, lettuce and tomatoes served on lightly toasted choice of bread.  So big, you'll most likely take a doggie bag home.  

Peppermill never disappoints  I get good, decently priced mega-quantity food and a time warp visit back to my teenage years, all rolled into one place.   Be sure to visit and get the throwback experience......you'll be glad you did.

I really wanted to love this place after seeing all of the glowing reviews, but what I found on a Saturday morning was a generic middle American coffee shop.  Certainly not a bad breakfast option, but not worth a long walk from your hotel, either (if you are at Riviera or Circus Circus, though, check it out). Omelets are huge but filled with too much cheap American cheese, hash browns were rather hard and unappetizing. Maybe I caught them on a bad day...

I liked the blue and purple lighting and the 70's-style round booths. Waitresses wore "Hawaiian truck stop" floral print dresses and were exceptionally nice and attentive. Much better service than the average 24-hour hotel restaurant.

Can't comment on the dinner menu or late night experience - I'll have to go back and try it.  Overall I liked the place, and would be more likely to return soon if it weren't a little out of my way.

THE Vegas diner experience. When it's 3am and looking for a Vegas-style late night dinner, this is the spot to go.

Neon? Check! Mirrors everywhere? Check! Free souvenir photo? Check!

Portions are huge and the menu is very extensive, and really, when you end up here at 3am, all the food will taste like Bobby Flay was in the kitchen.

Loved it!

Amazing place. Sucks I don't live in Vegas to go whenever I please. 

This is a must visit destination of your there on business or vacation. Food was amazing.

Old school charm, that's why you go here. The food is meh, it's a diner after all, and best at 3 am after a lot of drinks elsewhere. Speaking of drinks, they have quite a few to choose from, lots of cocktails but unfortunately a rather poor beer selection, only Stella on tap, but they poor it well, so hard to complain. It's got two sides, diner with the full menu, then the "lounge" with the water/fire pit. I think your best bet is to go at the end of your night, when you're a little munchy, get a few appetizers and a nightcap then cab it home as the sun comes up.

First I want to say the food during my visit was phenomenal! Great taste and huge portions for a reasonable enough price. I had the chicken fried steak which was juicy on the inside and crispy on the outside. The sausage gravy made it that much better. The mashed potatoes were real potatoes. The veggies were lacking a bit, but still good. 

My only complaint and the reason I give my experience a 4 instead of a 5 was the service. The cocktail waitress were very friendly and courteous, but our waitress seemed to be having the worst day of her life. 

Upon being seated a server brought us our drinks but he wasn't the server. We waited on our server another 10 minutes before I decided to say something. I ask a random server for help and eventually they track down our server, Elisha. I don't want to pile on her as the worst, because she brought out our food fairly quickly. What I didn't like was her attitude. From her "I guess you're ready to order" when I asked to for a server to her slamming my change on the table after I paid for our meal. 

In sum, great food but the service is shaped by the server.

In my fam, The Peppermill is a Las Vegas tradition. Growing up my grandparents always stayed at the Sahara (now SLS) and the "Mill" was very convenient down the street.  The food was always consistent, the staff friendly and efficient and the place spotless. Even today it does not disappoint. 

On this night the Peppermill, although not busy (weeknight early) hit again on all cylinders.  My tasty club sandwich, fries and a coke were awesomely simple and thoughtfully prepared, as signaled to one of the chefs via a two thumbs and nod from me to which he winked back. 

I was transported to childhood memories with the neon and fake tree decor - and signature colored sugar container on the table - I've never seen that done anywhere else. My Nana actually "borrowed" (her words) one of those back in the day via her big fat purse. One of these days I'll buy one since I still feel a twinge of guilt for her actions and I can't find the one she "borrowed".

As the North strip continues to evolve I hope the Peppermill will continue its quest to just do what it has always done and do well. Awesome food, campy decor and Las Vegas personality. It knows who it is.

Oh... my.... goodness....

These pancakes are HUGE!!! My fiance and I shared a plate of 3, and still couldn't finish them. Might I add, they are DELICIOUS! I hope to come back to Vegas soon to have more. We also ordered eggs and such, which were great. The portions are huge, so make sure to come hungry. Prices are very reasonable, I think we paid less for our meal here than a similar meal at Ihop!

We'll be back soon!!!

Great spot, great food, great value. Had a couple of smooth Manhattans and the corned beef hash. Long wait...so plan for it, but there might not be a better value in the strip area. Can't recommend it enough.

Was introduced to this place by a friend and we all decided to check it out as a group for brunch. 

Upon stepping into the entrance, slot machines on the left are one of your first sights, very Vegas indeed. The entire environment seemed to emit Vegas-style retroness with fake indoor palm trees, colorful sugar, and a disco-like vibe.

Since I knew the portions would be huge, my boyfriend and I decided to share a meal. We decided to order the CHICKEN FRIED STEAK AND EGGS (that comes with hash browns). In addition, since it was the morning and it looked like every other table ordered some, my boyfriend decided to order a BLOODY MARY to go along with the CHICKEN FRIED STEAK AND EGGS. The cocktail waitress was very nice in explaining it to him since he didn't know how it worked. You actually get to choose the type of Vodka you would like in it and they use their own secret list of spices to be included. As for it being brunch time, in Vegas, you would have to be drinking every time of the day. 

My cousin decided to order the PEPPERMILL SAMPLER (golden fried shrimp, breaded chicken fingers, mozzarella sticks, bruschetta and batter dipped onion rings) for all of us to share. And that was the first thing that came out and man, did we have to share. The entire thing was huge. Sadly, I was only able to try the mozzarella sticks (which were very warm and gooey inside with cheese after being dipped into marinara sauce--yummy!) and an onion ring (I've had better elsewhere). The rest I left to the others in my group to try. 

My boyfriend's BLOODY MARY came out next. Being his first time, it wasn't bad. I tasted it as well and it did taste like V8 with a little bit of Vodka with seasoning in it for better flavor. He actually finished the whole thing and was glad his first time was at Peppermill. 

Finally, our main entree came out, the CHICKEN FRIED STEAK AND EGGS (with hashbrowns). It was super crunchy on the outside and moist on the inside and with that gravy on top made it even that much savory. The hashbrowns also had a nice top crunch to it which I love. 

Overall, we came out very stuffed. Luckily, since we shared, we were able to eat all of the CHICKEN FRIED STEAK AND EGGS. I wouldn't have been able to if I went into this as a lone person. 

Great first time experience. I can't wait to see what else Vegas has left for me.

Went to a late dinner here on a Saturday night after a long day on the strip. I was pleasantly surprised about this place. Food is actually really good better than Denny's or any other 24 hour restaurants I've been to recently. Staff are friendly and the atmosphere is really fun, decorated like out of the 50s or 60s. Food portions are very generous and there's a wide variety of things to order from on the menu. This is a great alternative to going back in ordering room service at your hotel.  Price is fair compared to eating at a restaurant in one of the casinos.  Check this place out breakfast lunch or dinner.

I always come here super late night when I'm in Vegas and i love it!! The food is SO good all of it! I have never had anything i was unhappy with. The menu is large there are so many options. I love the vibe of the place as well and the bar in the back is my favorite. The little seating areas are SO cool totally 80's and I love it! The fire pit in the water is a Nice place to sit at and snack after a long night of partying or working. Defiantly a locals spot and worth going to.

Very busy but they do take reservations. Food came out in a decent amount of time and was very yummy. I'm a big breakfast fan so I had breakfast for dinner.  The rest of the table had burgers and it was good reviews all around. The one cocktail my brother ordered was $14 which is very overpriced but not a reason to skip out on this place.

Great place for brunch! Old school Vegas. I always bring my out of town friends when they visit Vegas. Funky décor, and delicious food! Awesome for those famous Vegas hangovers. LOL! Be prepared to wait for a table, but it's worth it!

A vegas staple. Old school feel with classic, large portions of food and good service. Great place to eat and drink on the strip. Are there more luxurious places to eat in LV? Of course, but when you wanna eat good food to soak up the alcohol you're gonna drink there are few spots at this price point that would be options. Not shy to recommend anyone to this place and no one has ever been disappointed.

This is a really fun, retro-themed restaurant. I remember the experience more than the food, but I do remember liking everything I ate. I especially liked the giant cocktail that my friend and I ordered to share during our breakfast. They had a photographer come around to each table to take pictures, so I thought that was a nice touch as I'm sure most customers were tourists.

If you are looking for the place that you need to know in Vegas, you just found it. 

The people that know where to go for good food and a fun time come here. This place has been around for a long time and for good reason.

When you step into The Peppermill it is like stepping back into time. The eclectic decor reminds you of the good old days of Vegas and if you have a good thing, you don't change it!

This place has two sides so make sure you go to the right side to get what you are looking for. The right side is the restaurant  and the left side is the (Fireside) lounge.

The Restaurant has just about anything you are looking for no matter what time of day. Don't see what you want on the menu, just ask because they may be able to make it for you. 

The Fireside Lounge is where you go to relax and enjoy reasonably priced drinks on the strip. This is where you go when you don't want the crazy crowds of the big casinos. You can also order food to enjoy the night.

Just the ambience alone makes this place,  comfortable seating in the lounge 70's. Love, love this place. The bloody Mary was a smooth delight. The peppermill platter ...yum. fireplace   I always wanted to come here and I was not disappointed

Ate in the lounge where you can only order appetizers. All I can say is that if the abundance of an appetizer is that large that I can imagine eating a full meal. Took some friends from out of town and sat by the fireside and orders sliders- didn't care for the cole slaw, wings were wonderful and good size and small nachos. The nachos had that cheese that doesn't melt and was the only reason why I couldn't give 5 stars. The atmosphere is very relaxing and the servers were very knowledgable.
I can't say enough good things so I'll say this, if your ever in Las Vegas this is a MUST!
The food is awesome, portions are big you definitely can split a meal. I will be back

This place is a must do when in Vegas. Be prepared to wait to be seated, especially if you're going for breakfast but it's soooo worth it. The atmosphere is phenomenal. The neon lights fake trees make for a worthwhile experience. I had the Sun City BLT which was amazing!! I was craving a bit of lunch and breakfast and this item hit the spot. Krystal, our server, was the best! Hope and pray you get her to serve you and if possible request to sit at one of her tables.

when you think of real vegas, you think of this place. i dont mean the nice upscale vegas, i mean the dark, neon light, smells like smoke, diner with slot machines vegas. and that's this place.

we went here because the guy at the wynn said this place had good burgers for cheap, and girls walking around in mini skirts.

he was 2 for 2.

the only problem with it was it was just a tad too ghetto for my taste. im not an elitist, hell im not even yelp elite, but still it was just a bit down in the dumps. although i will give it credit, the girls working there were very hot, and the milkshakes were bomb.

we thought our waitress was really cute and wanted to hit on her a bit, so we thought it would be a good idea if we asked about milkshakes. my first friend was in love with this girl and wanted to talk to her, so when she walked up it went like this.

friend 1 (who was in love with her): silence
friend 2: um so we wanted to ask you about the milkshakes
me: uh yeah what flavors do you have?
waitress: strawberry vanila and chocolate
friend 1: silence
friend 2: ok so we have a question. we want to split a milkshake, but we dont want to seem, how do we say this, um, uh, homosexual per say. so which would you think is hotter, one milkshake with 3 straws, or 3 separate glasses
waitress (laughing): whatever you want babe
me: well after that we are def. not getting the pink strawberry


it was only after that we noticed a ring on her finger (she was still young like 24). my first friend said he called an audible, but either way it was a solid swing and a miss.

so if you want a cheap meal with some hilarious surroundings, hit this place up. classy wise it is def. not up there, but it is a great place none the less.

My friend took me here for the 1st time after a night of drinking and Peppermill didn't disappoint.  Food was delicious with very generous portions, at least for what you pay if say. Customer service was good, and the seafood omelette I had was excellent...

Now for the interesting. A couple next to us came in soon after we did & immediately the guy began badgering his girlfriend from an argument/disagreement they had earlier n the evening. Now arguing is 1 thing but this fool made the woman cry, she ran into the bathroom, he chased her in there and the continued to argue and berate her back at the table.
So to the pretty lol blonde with the person of unknown color boyfriend with the Trump misogynist complex, I am truly sorry I didn't speak up and stop his foolishness earlier, I try and stay out of people's affairs but your crying, the berating and disrespect had become enough. He obviously seemed comfortable doing that and probably wasn't the 1st time but I hope you realize your worth and never allow it to happen from him or anyone again, but I hope my interference didn't instigate any further verbal or physical altercation once you had left the restaurant.

So yea good times and interesting hour at the Peppermill lol

Seating was very fast. Parking lot was full and we watched four groups enter as we approached the door.  Hostess told us to wait 5 to 10 minutes but seated us in 2 minutes.  Service was just as fast.

Portions are very large.  We had the Fish & Chips, Pancake Special, Hot Wings (20 pieces) and Tropical Fruit Waffle.  Fish was thick and crispy.  All of us ended-up getting a take-out box.  They also gave us some coffee to go.  

Very nice wait staff and good food!

First time trying the place and it definitely will not be the last. Huge portions of food. Got a half order of Nachos Nachos Nachos and it was enough to feed me and my g/f for a few days. I ordered the Gyros and my g/f ordered the philly both were good and better as leftovers. Will be coming back to check out breakfast.

This place has the coolest ambiance and the biggest portions I have ever seen in regards to their breakfast selections. 
Make sure to share with a friend unless you think you can handle all the breakfasty goodness they can dish up!
This place is super cool. The ambience and food are  AWESOME & the kids ate everything... we all did

Came her with a group of friends for a late breakfast after we checked out of our hotel.  I had always seen this place at the end of the strip, but never stopped in.  It was a Sunday morning and we had a large group, so we had to wait a while.  We sat in the Fireside lounge while we waited.  They have the best Bloody Mary's I have ever had!  They serve them in a large hurricane glass, with a huge stalk of celery.  It had the right amount of spices and alcohol.  

I honestly don't remember the food too much, it was good and the portions are huge.  It is a little pricey, don't let the location fool you, so if you lost your a$$ at the casino you might want to eat and drink somewhere else.  

I definitely make it a point to come here when I am with a group of friends though.  The Bloody Mary's alone are worth it for me.

Food - 1 star
Service - 3 stars 

After all the years in coming to Vegas, we had never eaten at Peppermill.  Stopped here today before our flight and had the worst (seriously the worst) Bloody Mary I've ever had, plus a very overpriced plate of corned beef hash that was lacking in flavour, texture, etc.  

There are SO many other good places to eat in Vegas... this may be iconic, but it's certainly not delicious!

We have been coming here since our college days of weekend trips to Vegas,  a good stop before your long road back to LA on the 15.  Came back last week for some breakfast before our flight back to San Diego...Great variety on the menu still, huge portions as usual and good fast food with good friendly service. Had the blueberry pancakes, too much to finish, hubby had eggs and turkey sausage....good job, how about smaller portions with appropriate costs next time....we had no room for doggy bags on this trip.

Best old-style Vegas cocktail lounge in town.  Romantic and yes, a bit cheesey, but sexy too.  Faux trees at every turn and little twinkling lights (or maybe that was just the effect of the cocktails) and comfy sofa's to plop down on and enjoy your drinks. They also serve a selection of appetizers in the lounge, so it is one of the few places left in town where one can enjoy decent cocktails, good appetizers and a smoke all at the same time.  The food served in the front of the house is always excellent (for a coffee shop) and generous portions.  I have always found the service to be friendly and prompt, although sometimes slow in the lounge.  

Everyone should visit this place before they die!!!

Service was a little slow. Food was awesome. I have been coming here since the early 90s. I love the vibe and old Vegas feel. I remember when getting a job doing cocktails here was like hitting the lottery. Everyone working there now is Like 22 and has no idea of what Vegas really is. When I asked any questions I got the head tilt. I did tell them many times we were there for my sons birthday. No one even acknowledged it. Of all the places he could have gone..he wanted to go there. Overall it seemed like a great generic place to eat.

Passed by this place many times but never bothered to stop by.. Until, we did a "nearby" search on my Yelp App... Mann, have I been missin' out for the last few years!! 

First off, the atmosphere/decor is definitely out of the ordinary and most likely inspired from a nightclub/strip club.. Disco ball glass, Cherry Blossom Trees and Neon Lights.. Interesting and totally Vegas!

What will make me come back again and again:

Southern Fried Steak: This was the Best Chicken Fried Steak I've ever had! Crispy, Crispy Chicken Breading, Good Thickness, Tender and So Flavorful!! The gravy was Great and just made it even better! It came with Some of the Best Hash Browns I've ever had!! Yes, this plate was a Double Whammy!! The Hash had the typical string/shredded potatoes but wider cuts and an amplified potato flavor!! The eggs, I tried their scrambled eggs and they were tastier than average and fluffier than normal. Plus, I opted with a side of White Toast. The Toast was ordinary but it came with a delicious strawberry jam. To Top it off, this entree could easily feed two starving people!!! 

French Toast: Another Generous Dish that came with 6 Fat 1/2Slices of Texas Toast that were Frenched up Correctly! Nice soft butter and maple syrup (not too thick) just brought it home! Traditional and Executed Right! 

Marinated Pork Chops: Came with 2 bone-in cuts, grilled with the nice evident checker marks and lightly seasoned with herbs and spices. Not bad but Nothing compared to the Southern/Chicken Fried Steak. This also came with a small slices of apples and sauce. The side of Hash Browns.. You know how I feel about those! This time, I went with egg whites and a bagel with cream cheese for the included choice of sides. Egg whites were Great (similar to the scrambled eggs) and the Bagel was massive and Satisfying (No, Einstein Bagel but it did the job).

Dined here twice now, within a week and this place isn't around the block.. Hint, Hint.. Service both times were Flawless.. Veteran Servers: know what to say, how to say it and when to say it.. Fast service, follow-ups.. I like the Feel and Atmosphere, much different the norm. Prices are alright, they pile on the food and quality is there. I'm hooked on their Southern Fried Steak and Eggs!!! and  Hash Browns!

I've been to the Peppermill a few times, both the lounge and the diner sides. This last time was just bad. Initially we wanted to sit in the Lounge by the fire pit, but after 15 minutes of sitting at a dirty table and getting no service we had to get up and ask someone for menus. When we received the menus we decided to go to the diner side as there couldn't have been more than 10 choices that you are able to order in the lounge side. Okay, fine. We get to the diner side, the guy who seats us is a complete...I had to ask him to seat us! We table hopped to finally find one that wasn't a) by a bunch of loud obnoxious drunk kids or b) underneath a full blast AC going in October. After finding a table getting a waiter was our next struggle. A man walked by and asked if we had ordered, we said no and he just walked off. We were pretty confused as I thought no was a pretty universal word. When we finally got him to come back we waited quite a while for the less than mediocre food we were served (again, I ordered a burger). I get that this is a cool place to go if you're absolutely trashed and hungry in Vegas late at night, but NEVER EVER go here sober. Trust me, the food and the irritation isn't worth it. Ugh.

A must to do for visitors very retro and original Vegas. The fireside bar is beautiful and very cozy. They come around each booth and take a free complementary Photo of everyone at the table. My favorite thing to order here is the fruit platter it has to be the entire fridge of fruit on a Fred Flintstone size platter. I have yet to have a bad meal and some of my favorites also are huge pancake breakfast and their soups

We went to this location because it was right by our hotel and the front desk recommended it.  The food was good, although they were busy so it took a little while to get to us.  I had the pesto chicken sandwich which needed more pesto to be honest.  It was kind of dry.  My friend had the caprese style ciabatta and said it was really yummy.  I don't remember the name of the drink I ordered but it had champagne and was looked really nice but was sooooooo expensive!  Overall I would go again, their breakfast looked amazing.

Ok first off I have been waiting almost 10 years to get the chance to come try this ultra cool classic dinner/lounge of Las Vegas. When I finally did I think the hype was just way too high. 

The Peppermill is a dinner slash lounge and when I first moved here in my hey days friends and family always suggested The Peppermill as a late night hang out or a cool place to grab food and more drinks after a long night out. They might have been a bit on the drunk side every time they were there though lol. Anyhow fast forward about 10 years later a wife and 2 kids later life was totally different and friends too now have families of their own.

After numerous try's to eat here for breakfast with families from out of town has been unsuccessful I finally got that break. A friend and his wife and kid was visiting and after a night of taking our kids to the Nostalgic Circus Circus we ran out of options places to eat and then  I remember THE PEPPERMILL so there we headed. We get there and the parking lot was quit bare and I am celebrating at this point. 

Walking in we were all excited for this experience and couldn't wait to see what was in store. Like another fellow Yelper said inside of the Peppermill totally gives off a Strip club vibe which was a bit funny because we had our 1 to 3 year olds with us. Note that even though it is a lounge on one side it is a totally kid friendly place with a kids menu at that. We were seat fairly quickly and food came out at a reasonable time. Though it was not that busy. Service was friendly and food came out in big portions. All the food options on the menu sounded super good and they came out pretty good but nothing over-the-top. It is a diner and I'm sure if I was out all night drinking and partying the food portion and flavor would be on point, but I wasn't so I am a little bit more critical. The food sizes were amazing and I can completely appreciate that but the taste was only a couple steps up from your typical Dennys. 

Never the less we had a good time Anderson enjoyed our food. I will totally be back but if there is a wait what so ever I won't be waiting in that line. Next time I'm leave the kids at home and joining the other adults in the lounge so I can finally have my drunken late night experience I never got to have. Stay tune for that review update LOL!

I immediately fell in love with this spot because I'm a huge fan o the movie Swingers. This dinner is featured in the movie.

The food is great. Nothing like some late night comfort food after hitting the strip hard. I love walking in here while wearing any vintage attire. It completes the Vintage Vegas experience especially during Viva Las Vegas weekend or after hitting downtown (old Las Vegas) or anytime for that matter.

Your Vegas experience is not complete until you hit this place.

Been here a few times now. Tried the Happy Hour Chicken Quesadilla and it wasn't that impressive. Green peppers were located inside the tortilla, along with way too much chicken that wasn't that tasty at all. The salsa also had no flavor. Not too bad on drink prices as it was about $5 for a can of Guiness and $7 for a Mixed Drink.
