GREAT place to go for drinks,romantic conversation (in the bar) or bring the whole family kids and all! 

HUGE plates of food for NON strip prices! I love this place! Great drinks,great service and you may just get to see Miss Holly Madison! 

I will ALWAYS be bringing visitors here when they come to Vegas, its a staple!

4 stars is not for the food but for the service. Waitress was unpleasant during the first trip and we sat for 20 minutes before she took our order. And that didn't change much during the second visit which we had the same waitress.

But although the service is on the slow side, the food is fantastic. 

We Ate there twice so far first time I had the Marco Polo Omelet and YUM is about all that needs to be said. 10 egg omelet was way more than I could eat, but every bit was delicious. My boyfriend and his brother in law had the corn beef has with the braised egg just as it was on the menu. They both said it was alright and could have been cooked just a little more to make it crispy rather than mushy, but again the portions were huge.

 The second visit it was just me and my boyfriend and we got pancakes and biscuits and gravy to share. We should have just stuck with the pancakes, not that the biscuits and gravy was bad they were very good. It was just way to much. We couldn't even eat half of the pancakes as there was three of them as big as a dinner plate, and some of the best pancakes I have had. 

We still have another 5 days in Vegas and we will be back again before we leave.

My husband and I renewed our vows at a Vegas chapel (by Elvis of course) so it seemed only appropriate to go to one of Vegas's oldest restaurants.

This place is cool inside. SO old Vegas, neon lights, cheescake, large. I loved it! 

The food was decent for this type of place. I wasn't expecting Mastro's quality food. My mom and I got the Southwestern beef kabobs. They were ok. A bit overdone for my tastes. My husband got the swiss and mushroom burger, which I tried, and it was better than what I got. My dad liked his clam chowder.

Service was ok. Server messed up the order and had to be reminded to bring out a side dish. Maybe she was having an off day.

All in all, it was a fun experience. I'd probably go back to bring a friend who wanted to see old Vegas, and wasn't a food snob.
First time visiting this restaurant & I gotta say it is good!  Had chorizo & eggs plate & my bf had  eggs over easy dish, they were both good, will definitely go back.

Come here for the food and come here for the people watching! You will not be disappointed.  If you're looking for a piece of old Vegas, this is your place. 
The decor is loud and over the top. The food is yummy.  The service is good.  A pretty good place to get your drink on with your breakfast.

Pepperdine cafe
A little pricy, portion size are pretty large, you can easily share with friends, Get an omelet they kill like a whole carton for that shit!

Ordered

Buffalo Wings 8.95?
Chicken Soup 4:95:
Steak and Eggs 17.99?

Fed 4 people

Should have ordered omelets lots of food haha 

They took a picture, it was hecka small.

Could have been better. 

This place is popular cause of the decorations

If you like diner food and large portions, this is your spot, the food is good, no nonsense, fresh, straight-up what you are craving. The portions are crazy gigantic and the service was surprisingly good considering how busy and hectic this place is. 

Kudos to the management for putting out consistently good food with a smile!

Love thissssss place!! Huge portioned meals so one could feed two people. The food is so good and the atmosphere is awesome. The only thing I had a small issue with is I had probably 4 different servers and didn't really know who to ask for help. However the place is so busy maybe that's how they keep up with the crowd. My fiancé and I made the mistake of ordering two separate plates for breakfast and shared both but it was good and next time we'll know better than to order two plates!

Goodness the portions are large here. We all made the mistake of ordering our own entrees and that was the biggest mistake, especially because we weren't staying at a hotel with a fridge. I had the marco pollo omelet and that was 3 portions for me. I only ate a third of it, took my leftovers to the hotel room, and basically threw it out because I didn't trust the makeshift ice chest my friends made lol. The flavor was alright, pretty standard diner breakfast food. I really liked the crispy hashbrowns though. I enjoyed the atmosphere and decor (really kitchsy) and service was good.

It's time for a nightcap before parting ways. Fireside is suggested. Indoor firepit?? Check. Cozy lounge? Check. Food and dranks! Check and check! 
Seriously, I've always heard of the Peppermill but I had no idea what it was exactly. This spot. the Fireside lounge is located within the Peppermill and it is SAWEEEEEEET!! I think it's my new favorite spot! I LOVED the little love seats surrounding the firepit and how CHILL it was. It's 24 hours so I hear it gets crazy later on but it was a Monday night when I was there, about 11pmish. We ordered ribs and a quesadilla, I had a Dreamcicle too which was DELICIOUS! i'm not a rib fan but HE is and he LOVED the ribs. I thought the quesadilla was pretty tastey even though it had issues staying together. Whatever. 
This spot is super cooooooooooooool. Can't wait to go back! 


P.S. They have regular and reverse HH daily.

I loved this place. I loved the fact that there are glammed out cocktail waitresses taking drink orders at 9AM on Sundays. I loved the pink and purple neon and the half moon booths.  I loved the biscuts and gravy, and my three scrambled eggs... extra cheese.  For the health concious, my friend ordered a yogurt and fruit nut thing that looked like it might be good for you. 

If you are in Vegas you have to check this place out.
LOVE, LOVE, LOVE the Peppermill....food is off the chain!...can't wait till August for my annual ten day stay...my first stop from the airport is the Peppermill for breakfast!
Always great breakfast options. lots of food for the value and the waitstaff is usually on point as well. all in all a great 24 hour diner that hasnt disapointed in early am...

The Peppermill has a wonderful atmosphere reminiscent of the glitz and glamour of old school Las Vegas. The food is tasty and sized to epic proportions. It's a shame the service is slow and our waitress was grouchy.

this is probably my favorite diner type restaurant in the entire world. It is so much fun, the food is fantastic, and it is open 24 hours.  it is also retro in a really good way.  The Cobb salad and breakfast food are my favorite.

The drinks were good and the food was your simple America cuisine. I wouldnt say it was average but it could have been better. In all I cant complain filled me up service was great and it was busy but what do you expect on a weekend in Vegas.

This was a bit more than we wanted to pay but well worth it. Honestly I would buy one omelet and split it next time .... Plenty for 2. Muffins were fluffy. Everything was elicits with HUGE PORTIONS. We waited 20 minutes but once in service was fast and friendly. Only Pepsi products. Maserati and Mediterranean omelets excellent.  Free picture nix but they get you with the bigger one (optional)

This is our first time at this restaurant, and right from the beginning the staff was unfriendly. The manager was really rude to us, it was our friend's birthday and they did not try to give any accommodation or even just good service.  The worst part was that our friend accidentally spilled the pepper grinds in her pasta. The manager seemed irritated and said he can replaced the pasta. As we get back to our hotel we noticed that they left a side of pepper, but it was the pepper grinds. This place is very disrespectful and rude and it wasn't like we didn't pay for our food. I will not be coming back.
Great food and ambiance. Service was average, bartender lady was rude.

I first found out about the Peppermill in Las Vegas when a friend took me there late at night for a snack.  I knew from the minute I walked in the door that I liked this place!  Funky decor, neon lighting, big fake trees throughout the restaurant, and the wonderful Fireside Lounge.  This has got to be the best diner in Las Vegas, and the setting is unforgettable.

In the lounge, the video poker machines at the bar are fun, but the seats around the water feature and fire are the best!  Last time I was in, I saw Brooke (Punkin) from Charm School.  She was having fun with some guys and kept getting approached by fans.  We left her alone.

The food is very good, as far as fried stuff and diner food is concerned.  Don't expect a healthy meal here.  The service is quick and friendly and the price is fair.  If you like the Peppermill in Vegas, the good news is that they have an entire casino and resort in Reno under the same name that takes the crazy design to a completely different level.
Many hotel cafe's either close early or food is poor quaity. Peppermill prices are on par with most cafes in the area and they give you a load of food! For late night dining this place fits the bill.

The Riviera next door, alas, is now a part of fading Old Vegas history. You mostly have to go to Fremont Street to get that kind of vibe.  But the good news is that the Peppermill is still here, still standing and still going strong as it has been since (GASP!) the Seventies! From our first visit there to our most recent, THIS is where we bring out-of-town friends and family, who want to experience some of that "back-in-the-day Vegas kitsch."

Best explanation I've heard given to describe this place is that "it's like having dinner inside of a giant disco glitter ball", and for the most part, that is fairly accurate. The purple-and-pink neon, the shimmery walls, and the over-the-top bar/lounge is one place you've got to see to believe!

The food isn't terrible, but not as great as the ambiance.  And the menu is HUUUUGE, much like many of the portions. I'd be shocked if anyone could go through that WAR AND PEACE-sized list and declare, "I can't find anything I like." Be prepared NOT to hear that, but know that if you're not into Texas-sized servings, you WILL be taking home a doggie bag. 

When you ride The Deuce, the city bus that carries everyone back and forth around the Strip, Peppermill is considered to be one of the main stops.  One visit, and you'll know why.  Here's to another dozen decades or so for this one-of-a-kind eatery.

This place.... Was super annoyed by the 1 hour wait to get in . Turns out it was worth every minute . I had the Sin city BLT, By far the best BLT iv ever had. Loaded with bacon and Buttery toast.! Even my boyfriend was hangry and left very happy . The fries are perfection! I would recommend this place to everyone

I have been to the restaurant twice.  Once for late night dessert and once for late night breakfast.  Portions are ridiculously huge, and the prices reflect that somewhat.  The food is decent, but nothing really special.  I recall my spinach and cheese omlette being pretty good though I could barely make it though half of it due to it's enormousness.

And as is the usual story in Las Vegas, there isn't much here by way of vegetarian options.  They offer a veggie burger and a salad or two and of course breakfast food.

This trip I was determined to check out the Fireside Lounge.  And I'm glad we did.  We took a seat on the cooshy couches surrounding the fire and ordered some appetizers.  It was a Sunday night and kind of quiet which was fine by us.  The neon, the decor, the fire.  So wonderfully cheesy.  I loved it.  

They have a few small flat screen TVs affixed above the fire pit and they play music videos and live concerts which can provide some laughs, depending on your taste in music.

I am glad I finally checked out the lounge as I read rumors that the Peppermill may be closing with no plan to relocate.  Which would be a total bummer.  But perhaps they should move it downtown.  It would fit in well there.

Props to my man Paul J... his review says it all:

"Absolute magic. 

The Fireside Lounge transforms a person. Sitting there drinking Jack Daniels while eating plate after plate of ribs served by beautiful women in long evening/nightgowns all the while surrounded by fire and water and live concert videos, this is why America is, and will continue to be, the greatest country on earth!

There is simply nothing wrong with this place and everything right about it. if I could give it 10 stars I would, in fact, fuck it, I am. 10 stars."

***This review is for the Fireside lounge only.

Sorry, but this just wasn't our thing.  Came here on our last night in Vegas for drinks early in the evening.  A couple other tables of people in the lounge, but the place was mostly empty.  I get the novelty of the place but we just weren't feeling it and it almost put us to sleep sitting on the big comfy couches in a quiet place.  Had one drink which was OK and then headed for the exit.

Stars for decor, good food, reasonable prices, nice waitresses.. 
I had a pretty nice experience - it was our New Year's choice :)
I've heard salutes from all hotels all over Vegas - came out to see and shout with everybody for a while. Later came back and continued our party :) 
Appreciated food and alcohol beverages. First was fresh, professionally made, big portions, delicious! Second - lil bit overpriced, but it's New Year's night - who's not trying to make money, right? :)

Decent food. You can't really screw up eggs. Ever since DuParr's closed it's been hard to find anything remotely close to that experience. The only recommendation I'd give you based on numerous mistakes I've made...share a plate. If you get your own you'll be sorry. The dishes are so huge it's really partially revolting.
Portion sizes are massive! The two of us shared a rack of ribs for $22 with fries and salad. The meat fell off the bone and was really tender.

Loved this place who doesn't want to have breakfast in a place that looks like this?

Had too much the night before? This is the place to go just put your shades on you'll feel like your back at the nightclub!

I got the french toast noone can mess up french toast!

I'll be back here just to look at it again!

Definitely worth trying. There is nothing exceptional about this place, but I don't have any cons. 

The prices were what you'd expect for something on the strip. The portion size is worth what you pay, though. 

The atmosphere is typical Las Vegas. A lot of neon lighting and mirrors. Very "glamorous" motif as you would expect for Vegas. 

The waitress was very friendly and attentive.

Overall, it was a good experience! I enjoyed my night out!

I have not been to the Peppermill since before yelp was on the internet and every time I did go it was after a long night partying or out drinking where to be honest anything tastes good.
Not so now, I had buddies of mine coming into town Friday morning and of course they could not check in to the hotel because it was too early and they were both starving for some food.
I wanted to stay on the strip and suddenly the Peppermill came into my mind, I know they are open 24/7 and they serve breakfast.
So upon arrival (it was around 10am) we rolled up to the Pepermill and were greeted with a 30 min wait time and the reception area was packed with people waiting.  
Then I remembered the lounge out back that serves some of the best Bloody Mary's I can remember having, so off we went to spend our wait time in the lounge.  man I'm glad I did, it was exactly like I remembered it pink and purple neon everywhere and the small water fire pit in the middle....Classic.
Our waitress came and took out orders quickly and then returned with them just as fast, the Bloody Mary was exactly like I remembered them and you get at plethora of choices for your vodka, anyway we had two drinks each while we waited and was then called to our table.
Our waitress gave us ample time to look and order from the menu which I was surprised at seeing as the place was packed, I was  expecting her to rush us and get us out of there.
the portions are HUGE! and can easily be shared, I ordered the corned beef hash with eggs, there must have been a pound of corned beef with a crispy crust and three, yes three fried eggs on top.   
Mmmmm The corned beef was crispy on the outside but once you cut into it, it was moist and creamy then once you cut open one of the eggs and the yolk mixes into the corned beef I was in heaven.
I wish it was closer to my house so I could go more often but for anyone on the strip and bear in mind the Peppermill is located quite far down the north of the strip across from Circus Circus and the old Riviera it is still a must go to for a great meal ANYTIME of the day or night.

The Peppermill rocked!! I went there in December for my birthday after watching a new Frank Sinatra show at the Encore. It was only a few blocks walk through the back streets of Vegas. (By that I mean off the strip, for all us tourist folk)  I have been wanting to go there for a while now, and it did not disappoint.
The decor was dark with neon light accents everywhere. Mostly of the blue and pink variety. The bartenders were up there in age, so they knew how to entertain and keep conversation going. I forget the bartenders name that was serving my girlfriend and I, but he was a good time. 
My girl and I ended up finding an open spot at the indoor fire pit so we lounged there for a while. It was interesting... Great for people watching and you get one eclectic crowd walking in and out of there. All sort of race, creed, gender and class. It is now a must go to every time I head to Vegas.
If you are the clubbing/ bar hopping type, its the perfect place to sit with the guys and plan your strategy over some good food and a few drinks. On the other hand, its a great place to just sit after a long night/ morning and well, lounge.
Always solid good old school Vegas.milkshakes are some of the best in town

I stop by this restaurant every time I am in Las Vegas, it would ruin my trip not to take a meal @ the Peppermill. The portions are huge and the service is great. The atmosphere is great as well, down to earth, very old-school kitschy Vegas type atmosphere, which I thought was fun.  It's the perfect place to hang out with friends after you're done doing whatever it is you do in Vegas, shopping, clubbing, walking the strip and touring casinos, whatever, this is a place to go to wind down. I personally have not been at night, although I would love to do so, this review is based on my experience going in for breakfast. (based on trip taken August 2008)

Pros: atmoshere, service, food portions and price
Cons: waitress uniforms

I liked this place a lot. Ate here late one night with my mom while we were visiting Vegas for her birthday. I had chicken soup and a BLT and I wish I had been hungrier because the sandwich was awesome. The soup was only okay, but the service was fine and the prices are good.

I also tried a drink called the Ultimate Mudslide and it was fantastic. Highly recommended. It was like an alcoholic milkshake.

Any place that been in biz 45 years and going strong is good in my book! Thats a feat by itself in the resto biz! Its 24 hours as well so better yet! Huge menu of options, with breakfast available all day! Kudos! Portions are huge, quality is good and prices are reasonable. Service is fantastic even in a busy and fast paced place as this is around dinner time. Unique and positive vibe at this place. Part diner, club, speakeasy and lounge all in one is how I put it. Love the nostalgic feel it has with counter seating and retro lighting. Even the server girls all decked out in blue skirt aprons. These girls can hustle let me say that! Always on the move!

Club sando I got was amazing. Added ham, avocado and extra bacon. Came on toasted sourdough by request. Huge, delicious and filling! Sweet fry upgrade for a buck and worth it! Sweet fries rule! 

Carrot cake is my one and only top cake of choice. Im a nazi with judging carrot cake quality! Theirs is good yes. Not $7 good but its a nice sweet ending to a good meal.

Eating at the Peppermill has become a tradition for us every time we're in town. Open 24/7, it exemplifies the glitz and glamour of the old Vegas--garish and all. With everything from the neon lights to the boldly colorful booths and the fluorescent table sugar, this place will make you feel like you've arrived in the city and gone back in time.

Not to mention, it's also one of the best deals on the Strip. For $13.50 you get a lot of food. I'm partial to the omelets, which are huge and come with a hefty portion of hash browns and toast/muffins. My two favorites are the Maserati and the Marco Pollo. 

The hash browns are thicker than any I've ever had. It actually feels like I'm eating pure potatoes--not overly buttered ones.

This place has the classic diner feel, but better food and heartier portions. It's pretty packed, even in the graveyard hours. And every once in awhile you'll catch a famous face sitting at one of the booths.

I definitely recommend the Peppermill for anyone who wants to get that iconic Vegas feel when coming into town.

We've been told "You have to eat at the Peppermill!" So we finally did. Seemed pretty legendary and who doesn't love diner food?

During our 30min wait we hung out at the Fireside Lounge. Man that place is awesome - I felt like I was signed up for a lapdance w/all that fluorescent lighting, fake plants, plush seating and scantily clad waitresses.

We were finally seated amongst all the hungover frat guys and huge families who took over the place. Our waitress was very nice but the overall service was sloooooow. Our food finally came and we devoured our bacon, sausage, eggs, toast, english muffin and hashbrowns. I was almost angry at how good it was and how it was going to end soon if I kept eating. We got out of the place after about 2hrs - an amount of time unheard of from us, again I'm blaming how busy the place was and slow service.

Anyway, the Peppermill was a great place for taking your time, eating yummy diner food, people-watching and chilling - all without having to inhale cigarette smoke.

Good for comfort food and drinks.. mud slides late night are a tradition for visiting guests. I tried to go healthy and have salmon, it was ok. I'd recommend ordering breakfast food, i've always been happy with omelets.

This place is awesome just for the decor. Sure, it's cheesy and dated but honestly, after all the ostentatious marble and gilt-covered surfaces of places like the Bellagio and Caesar's, it's a nice change. It's dark and funky and relatively quiet after being in noisy casinos all day. We came here for a late night snack so I can't comment on the full dinner experience but what I had was good (not great, but good) and hit the spot. Our waitress was attentive but not overly so and kept the refills coming in a timely fashion.

It wasn't too busy the night we stopped in and we almost had the place to ourselves which makes me think we may have missed out on the full Peppermill experience. Ah well, there are plenty of other opportunities to run into crazy people while in Vegas.

Tickety Tacky in only the best way possible.  I actually really like this place.  The neon lights reminds me of my mothers make up in the 90's.

Nick the waiter was a sweetheart.  I am ridiculous in my requests sometimes, but he managed to cater to all of them.

The portions are huge!   My steak and spinach salad was delicious!  The steak was tender and medium rare just as I requested.  I asked for candied walnuts in it and Nick brought me a bowl of them!  That's what I call service.

Late night eats in Vegas!  I'll definitely be back!
This place is awesome huge portions fair prices and everything we had tasted great not to mention the cocktail waitresses are smoking hot

We were hanging out at the Artsian after hours club and the bouncer recommended we eat at the Peppermill. We step in and the decor is wild! Purple neon lights wrapping around the diner with fake cherry blossom trees in the middle. Another great thing is the portions are huuuuuuge. If you've been drinking all night and are famished come to the Peppermill. It will give you the energy to go out again and get drunk all over again. Hopefully you don't throw up though. I ordered the steak and eggs and it was great! Highly recommend you come at least once when you visit Vegas.

First time at Peppermill it was fun and delicious. Please be aware, Food portions are huge. We went for dinner around 9ish wasn't busy.  Our server was nice but seem overwhelmed. As we got to her know her more, we found out that she was switched from graveyard tonight. Which meant it was busier than normal. 

Overall our experience was great and will Definitely visit peppermill again next time in Vegas

This is a great spot. It's worth the wait and if you have a large group, expect to wait. If you have a large appetite, this is the place for you. 

Now, although this was a breakfast place, how do they have a bar right inside? Of course, this is where I wanted to go, but we had kids with us...can I just move to Vegas? Pancakes and cocktails hasn't really ever been anything I'd thought of (outside of mimosas), but they offered, I bit...that's all she wrote. 

The pancakes are ridiculously huge if you order the pancake platter. Luckily, I ordered a meal and got smaller pancakes that would still take a greedy girl like me two sittings. This will definitely be my go to breakfast spot whenever I go to Vegas.

This visit to The Peppermill was about a year in the making as an out of town friend had given it 2 thumbs up & suggested we meet there. So I had alot of time to review the extensive menu which covers pretty much the full gamet of what you'd find at a Dennys (Breakfast, Sandwhiches, steaks, fish, burgers, deserts & Full Bar) but more Upscale.

I had also viewed several Youtube videos, one which featured the Mammoth "SCORPION" Cocktail ($20) & that pretty much sealed the deal on what I was going to have to drink. The Scorpion came just as it was shown on the vid and was very good wt no hint of any liquor at all which was strange because if you look up the recipe its loaded with alcohol. I am a vodka drinker and I'm guessing it was the 151 in the mix that had me done drinking anything else & sweating bullets towards the end of the visit. It packs a punch.

The Bartender in the Fireside Lounge was very freindly & had a good sense of humor especially when I pretended to have poked my eye out on the long straw that came with the drink and demanded someone call Personal Injury Attorney Glenn Lerner. The Bartender immediatly offered up some scissors to cut the straws to a shorter more manageable length.My accomplice had a glass of White wine ($9.50).

After conversation over our drinks and very hungry, we went into the main dining room and were immediatly seated in a nice out of the way booth in the back that was big enough for a group of 4 so we had pleanty of room to spread out and make ourselves comfortable.

I ordered the 1/2 order of Nachos wt Chicken ($16) and my Partner in Crime had a salad, Shrimp, and steamed green beans ($20) which looked very good and she had no complaints. The Nachos on the other hand were somewhat of a dissappointment. I have definatly had better. The quantity was overwhelming & in fact wt my huge cocktail, could not finish them. My complaint was they had been covered wt white cheese & baked in the oven and the end result was a concrete textured layer covering them. Also there was very little sign of any chicken whatsoever, though we did find a few small pcs upon a close inspection.

 The Nacho's were served wt 2 small cups of sour cream, a chedder cheese sauce & salsa all on the side and was pretty sparse on the other ingredients advertised - tomatoes, blk olives, jalepenos & onions. My expectations were more of a zesty, loose array of all advertised ingredients as I am accustomed  Sort of like a Taco Salad, where one can build each chip as an individual h'orderve. The concrete texture, as well as the limited ingredients, prevented this. Still it was good, but I wouldnt order it again.

The waitress, overall atmospere & company was very nice and based on my experience I would have no problem going back, or reccommending it to others. Go to youtube and see the various vids there. The breakfast dishes look very good as do the burgers. 3 out of 5.

If this place doesn't make you think of the swank, bygone days of Vegas where the Rat Pack and the Mob ran the town, nothing will. The interior is romantically dark, but with low, florescent lighting spanning throughout. The mirrors on the walls and ceiling really make you want to rent a kinky hotel room and get it on. The foliage that envelopes the interior adds a lovely exotic touch. The "tables" are actually large, low to the ground coffee tables, surrounded by big, squishy couches pushed back against a wall, so everyone gets their own, private grotto. Shall I even begin to talk about the bubbling blue flame pool that you can sit around? Awesome!! 

And let us not forget the drink menu. Typical bars and lounges in Vegas will serve up trendy, funny named drinks where, you have no idea what's in it, but with a name like "Mouthfuck", you just HAVE to drink it. Not so at the Fireside. Not only are the cocktails reasonably priced and STRONG, but they're the CLASSIC drinks that you would expect in Vegas. Not only did I recognize all of the drinks on the menu, but there were some drinks that are so classic and vintage that no one my age (25) has ever had them, so they're sort of trendy again. I had my very first Old Fashioned, and then followed that up with my first (of many) Champagne Cocktail. Honestly, Champagne Cocktail is where it's at!!

Then of course is the music. True to old Vegas style, they play Dean, Frank, Sammy, Bing, etc. And then, to appease their younger generation, they play Beyonce, Justin, and whoever else is popular these days. However, the song selection and sound level is hardly offensive; indeed, it's quite mellow and chill, thereby allowing you to suckle upon your champagne cocktail, or other drink of choice, and engage in verbal and social intercourse which might then, if you are lucky, lead to other kinds of intercourse. Really.. this place is friggin awesome.

BTW: The pic above is NOT the lounge... it's the adjacent restaurant

The vibe is cool and retro and the food is consistently good.  If you wander into the lounge make certain to get a seat by the fire,  Just don't try to walk 360 degrees around the fire pit....it has a mirror half way around :) Cheers!

Some friends and I had a late night craving for steak and we have heard good things about this place so we decided to come. We ordered to steaks and sadly they were not the best ones I've had in my life. Find even finish. The pairings were a bit off as well. I wanted mashed potatoes but the server said they were out so I decided to get fries instead. They were alright. The steak was also paired with mushrooms which were just alright nothing special. The portions are huge. I give them that. But besides that I was left sad and unsatisfied. Maybe this place is better for diner type food. If we do come next time I'll make sure to order breakfast style type of food. However as far as the steaks go I would save my money (because prices for Steaks here aren't cheap either) and go to another restaurant that has better tasking meat. 
In the plus side the staff is friendly and the device is pretty quick.

You walk in expecting strippers but there aren't any! Food was okay, nothing to really brag about. LARGE LARGE portions, couldn't finish it. Everyone was happy, and loved the different color sugar shaker. Was this place once a strip club? Remove the tables and you can have private booth dancers...?

You've seen the Peppermill in countless films courtesy of its outrageous throwback decor, most notably Scorsese's Casino starring Robert De Niro and Sharon Stone, and apparently De Niro kept coming back here long after filming wrapped. It is a Vegas must, open 24 hours and known for its large kitschy drinks and breakfast items. I lived in Las Vegas in 1998 when they were still building the Bellagio, and the Strip looked very different. I remember well coming out of the lounge side of the Peppermill, having eaten their Ambrosia French Toast or their pancakes, and seeing the retired strippers in their therapeutic tennis shoes and their car wash skirts with suspenders running pots of coffee around the restaurant side while the counter was lined with pilots in their uniforms. The restaurant gets busy now, but it has always been popular, and I visit when I can.

Now you're in Vegas, having a great time, partying, taken in the sights, and shows etc... This place is to chill when you want to get away from the craziness of the Strip... This is also a place to take your date and chill with a drink after doing the shopping at the mall... The fireside lounge was quite nice... Drinks were resonable (hell you're in Vegas) 

We went back there the next morning for breakfast, even though there was a waiting time to eat, the food was not bad at all.. In fact, when you order a mimosa... You get a giant glass of mimosa!! :)

And again, the intimate atmosphere in the fireside lounge was absolutly perfect.. I mean you can actually have a real one on one date, share your favorite drink togehter, and actually tell yourself "thank god I got away to Vegas"  :)

I can HIGHLY recommend this place... A place to chill and relax from the craziness Vegas has to offer... Which is not a bad thing, but we all do need to recharge the batteries before going back onto the Strip!!  :)

The husband and I were prepared to have a long wait due to us going on a Saturday and it  being New Years Eve weekend. We arrived a little after 6pm and were seated immediately. 

Upon being seated, we were immediately asked what our drink order would be. We decided on the Scorpion (64 ounces of their specialty drink which includes Grenadine, Rum, and Brandy). We were quite buzzed once our food arrived *insert thumbs up emoji*

The portion sizes are surprisingly large. Between the two of us, we had the Marco Pollo omelet (chicken, spinach, lots of garlic and cheese) with potatoes and a blueberry muffin on the side, and the chicken nachos. We tackled as much as we could but both ended up with full to go boxes. We had prompt service and our food was prepared and served with lightning speed. 

After dinner, we wandered over to the Fireside lounge. There were a few people scattered about, but we still snagged a prime seating area next to the indoor fire. We finished out Scorpion drink there (yeah, we kinda nursed that luscious 64 ounces), hung out and people watched. This place attracts crowds of all types, and feels retro glam Vegas-slash-old strip club lounge-slash-breakfast dinner. My kinda place.
This is a pretty cosy lounge.  The food was really good.  I had the Hot pastrami deli-style which was very lean. My lady had the Philly Cheese steak and we shared a Creme Brulee.

The only thing holding me back from a 5 star rating is they don't make their own cornbeef hash! I don't care for it but all of my friends and family do, and they had to ask ahead of time. In fact it does come out of a can! Now me personally I think its gross either way, so I don't care!!

First off....know that this place will be packed pretty much anytime from 9am to 11am so if you're going for breakfast be prepared to wait! While you are waiting you can go sit in the lounge and have one of their signature cocktails or appetizers. These might just fill you up so don't indulge too much because you will still want to have the breakfast as well.

I know they serve lunch and dinner, but this is a breakfast only kind of place to me so I am basing my review as such! 

Hits: waffles, steak and eggs, chicken fried steak, eggs benedict 

Misses: corned beef and hash, fried selections (appetizer stuff), mixed fruit 

I hate sharing this place because I know it will just become more popular and in turn busier, but I can't help it!! This place is awesome and I hope they are around for another 40 years!!

Heard the great reviews so had to check out for myself. Interesting neon lights, stripper club theme my fav! No but in all seriousness, this place has amazing burgers and fries. My husband ordered sliders and curly fries. We shared some apps (caprese and shrimp cocktail). The cheese on the caprese is not great quality, would skip if I were you. The shrimp cocktail was good. Service was somewhat confusing, 3 different servers.. other than that a cool spot to get some diner food. I would come back.

This restaurant has a very appealing atmosphere, and a pretty decent menu. It's open all night which was very convenient for us tourists looking to eat something late at night. It did seem they could use some help with having more waitresses. Ours seemed to be waiting to many tables

This review is about Fireside Lounge, NOT the Peppermill restaurant.

The staff: Our waitress was friendly.  It seemed like we bothered her a bit at first because we kept moving around, but she warmed up to us in the end.  One of my friends knew the manager so she came by and helped us out too.  We didn't wait too long for anything, and we had an endless supply of beer nuts.  Everyone seemed pretty chill.  No need to impress or go above and beyond; just very casual and relaxed.  All the waitresses wore long "gowns-could-be-a-homecoming-dress".  I thought it was a nice touch.  I mean, why not right?

The goods:  I'm not a heavy drinker, I just had a couple beers.  There was a complaint that the beers weren't cold so the manager put some on ice for us before she brought them out.  I had a sip of my friend's margarita on the rocks and that was pretty tasty.  Another friend ordered nachos.  They weren't bad.  It was really dark, but I'm almost positive there was mozzarella cheese on them.  Different, but not bad.  I don't think many people come for the food, and if you do, you'll  probably be disappointed.  

The atmosphere: This is why Fireside has a reputation.  Firepit surrounded by water, bubbled by jets.  It's like Satan's jacuzzi.  We sat in the pit for a little bit, but there were quite a few of us so we ended up moving to a different booth.  The booths are comfortable, squishy, and I liked the throw pillows.  Lots of "greenery", helps make some of the booths more private.  I requested that we stay in a booth that was somewhat well lit and very public, Lord knows what happens in those private booths.  This is a pretty cool place, not pretentious at all.  We ended up swapping stories of previous visits to Fireside.  If you're skittish or conservative, I would recommend coming early in the evening or not at all.  This place gets pretty diverting in the late hours.  The pimps and their girls will come in and have their cocktails, and if you're lucky, there'll be a mild drug exchange going on in a booth next to you.  A lot of the transvestites frequent this joint too...I think because the lighting is almost nonexistent (jk).  They're really friendly, so be prepared to converse with strangers.  Every now and again some famous someone or other will drop in too.  Again, probably because of the lack of lighting, so they can enjoy some privacy.  There are TVs everywhere and we enjoyed the old-school to not so old-school music they played.  The Beach Boys are getting ollllllllllld, but still so lovable.  I think this is a place for an older crowd, but a fresh pup with an open mind could probably really enjoy it.

We went for my going away party and I'm not disappointed.  We had a good time and we didn't bother anyone with our volume.  I would recommend this place for a casual get-together, but not if you're looking for a sit down dinner.  If you just want a place to chill, relax and shoot the shit, Fireside Lounge is a good spot.  Just be aware of your location and understand that anything can happen.  I mean seriously, it's Vegas.

I absolutely love this place. it was First suggested by my cousin to my family 2 years ago and I suggested it to my boyfriends family this past weekend while we attended EDC. We ate breakfast here every morning and they loved it. Huge servings and great tasting food. 

Tip: Mammoth pancakes are actually mammoth. HUGE

I first tried this place after leaving the club drunk and hungry I asked my cab driver what was a really good place for us to go and eat and based on his recommendation we ended up here. 

 I had seen this place many times before when in vegas and I decided to give it a try. The ambiance of this restaurant is actually pretty cool the neon lights late at night make it seem really cool inside and out. The staff was very friendly and suggestive as to what type of burger I should get let's just say I wasn't disappointed all the food was really good. Moderate price range. Cab service right outside when you need it. In short, I enjoyed my experience here!

Yes, another review for the Peppermill!  Aren't we excited!  

I love this place, in actuality, especially as a last stop on a night that's gone on a little too long when the weather's a little too chilly.  At about 2 AM on such a night, warming oneself at the fire pit with a gigantic plate full of nachos is pretty much an unparalleled delight.

The blue and pink neon is a little too bright, but it gives the Lounge a character no other place has.  I could do without the flat screens playing Phish and the like, but you can't win 'em all.  The drinks are a little pricey, ($7 for a well drink, $9 and up for specialties) but you ARE on the Strip and you're paying for that awesome fire pit too.  (That gas bill must be outrageous.)  The waitresses are always very polite and prompt, and their dresses make me giggle just a little bit.  (Long, black cocktail dresses look somehow out of place and perfectly comfortable there at the same time.)  The Peppermill is really the only place worth lounging at for a local on the Strip anymore, so let's keep it on the downlow and keep the tourists away, shall we?  Shhhhh!

Environment: This is like an amped up diner. Complete with neon running lights lining the molding and ceilings, indoor plants, lighting and 50s inspired uniformed servers!

Food: We went for breakfast after a long night of dancing as my friends and I were starving. The breakfasts we ordered were HUGE to say the least. Really I want to review one item we particularly enjoyed. The nachos. The nachos. The nachos! Comes on 2 plates. 1: plate of chips, melted cheese, onions, jalapenos, diced tomatoes and olives. 2: tasty ground turkey, sour cream, cheesy refried beans and hot sauce! What a smart way to serve these! Every bit can have EVERYTHING! I was extremely happy and full. No one was able to finish their food.

Service: Very attentive, service with a smile, didn't come by too often (which I dislike), but noticed when we needed refills, etc... 

I would recommend this place, and I will likely return!

I am a creature of habit at times. For some reason every time I come here I always get the reuben sandwich and curly fries. It just hits the spot when you want to divulge in a greasy mess. I've picked off of friends plates as well lol. Everything is pretty good. Straight up diner food but good. Next time I'll live on the edge and try something different. Maybe breakfast for dinner. OOHH WILD!

If you are in Vegas, you need to visit this place just because it's quirky. One foot in the door you flashback to the 70's. Neon lighting, faux vines hanging from the ceiling and Tiffany lamps at each booth. Who came up with this concept? Entertaining. The food portions are huge and you could easily split the order. The staff is very friendly and attentive. Visit the bar once you're done with your meal. It's worth a visit. Sit by fireplace. You'll be glad you did. I had a Bloody Mary. It was damn good! The great thing about the Peppermill...it's open 24 hours.
One of the best diners in Vegas. Never had a bad drink or meal here. Plus the atmosphere is really inviting.
Waitress was extremely rude, her attitude ruined my appetite. Asked for a small cesaer salad and she brought out a Large. The Waitress needs to listen to her consumers and not assume.
Great food at good prices. Excellent decor, it's definitely unique. Awesome coffee for you java lovers.

My boyfriend and I are waiting for our food right now, and I couldn't wait to write this review. 

I was SO excited to visit Peppermill. It's everything I love: over the top uniforms, kitschy decor, bad music and diner food. We walked in and I was in love. We put our names in, and it was about an hour wait. That's fine, we knew it was popular. We went to the bar and had several Bloody Marys each while we waited. Thankfully our bartender was great and the Marys were alsp excellent, which was the ONLY saving grace in this entire experience. After nearly an hour and 45 minutes of waiting, I went to the podium and asked how long it would be for our party. My exact words were "I'm sorry, I don't mean to be that person or obnoxious, but could I check on the wait for my table?" The girls asked my name snd initially couldn't find it, but then I pointed it out at almost the top of the page; it was very easy to see because almost all the other names (a good 20) below mine were scratched out, but mine wasn't. The girls asked me what time I put my name in, I told them right after 1:15. The two hostesses looked at me horrified amd said "it's almost 3:00!" I told them yes, I knew, and I was very upset. Then the two girls started arguing "well, you were putting names in," "but you were the one calling!" and then turning to me and cooing about the time and telling me it sucked how long we waited. I don't CARE. Fix. The. Problem. 

We were promptly seated at that point, but I asked to speak to a manager. At first, she was very empathetic, but then seemed to lie to my face about what the problem was. I told her what had happened and that I'd wished the girls up front had handled the situation differently (I told her I'd wished they'd just have apologized), and she said she's going to talk to them. Fine. Upon returning, she told me she was the one calling names, remembered calling us, and that she didn't know what happened because the system was messing up. Um, no? For one, the girls told me they were calling the names. Two, my name wasn't scratched off. If you'd even called it, you'd scratch it out if we hadn't come and you cancelled our party. Three, what system? It's handwritten names in a book and a speaker, and we could hear it fine in the bar. Bartender didn't hear our name called, either. So sorry, not buying that bull. She offered us apps but I was over it, I wanted to eat breakfast and leave. 

They expedited our order, and the food was fine. I wasn't expecting spectacular, since I came for the atmosphere. My boyfriend loved his omelette, though. Everyone was nice and all, and the manager comped us and apologized, even going as far as to walk out of the restaurant and wish us a good day. That (along with FINALLY eating) really helped, but still have a bit of a sore spot. We'll see what happens next time in Vegas.

Great old Vegas atmosphere.  Service was attentive.  We explored only the breakfast menu.  Large portions of food.  Marco Polo Omelette was more than I could handle in in one sitting... but tasty!  I will definitely return to try out lunch and dinner options.

Pretty good food! The prices were a little more than I'd like but when I saw the amount of food you get, it's pretty much 2 meals! Great scenery, awesome service. Nothing to complain about. I'd definitely recommend to friends!

I don't see what the hype is about this place. Yes, their portions are huge and the decoration is very unique, but so is every other restaurant in Las Vegas.

I think I just ordered the wrong dish though. I ate the french toast collage because I wanted a combination of sweet and savery. The french toast was just okay and I did not like the sausages at all. The bacon and eggs were perfect, though. I also tasted my mom's crab egg's benedict. They were really fishy, but the holondaise sauce was delicious. Next time I will try the corned beef hash. They come highly recommended by my father.

The peppermill was very busy on a Friday morning so we waited in the bar until our name was called. I had a great Bloody Mary while waiting. We were then sat and the manager quickly got us our drinks. We ordered and received our breakfast my husband got a peppermill omelette I received the Joes special both delicious my only complaint is that our waitress seemed to be in a bad mood not very friendly but she was quick and assisted us quickly we will definitely be back!

WHY WE WENT HERE:
- my friend's bachelorette weekend in Vegas; this place was suggested to us by one of the cab drivers 
- because we were told this is a classic, the bride had everyone dress pin-up for our meal here

THE LOOK (FROM THE OUTSIDE):
- in Old Vegas I believe, so farther down the popular area that people frequent on the strip

THE LOOK (FROM THE INSIDE):
- very old school diner throughout the main area; the lounge/bar area with the indoor bonfire was legit though and brought upon a different atmosphere

THE MENU:
- traditional club breakfasts
- Peppermill breakfast favorites
- breakfast sides
- Peppermill omelets
- pancakes and waffles
- appetizers
- soups and salads
- sandwiches
- burgers
- steaks
- entrees
- desserts
- beverages, fruits & cereals
- wine
- beer

WHAT I ORDERED (I can't speak for everyone because I don't recall):
- savory ribeye steak

THE TASTE:
- for the last portion of our trip I was craving steak, so the one I ordered was more than satisfactory

CUSTOMER SERVICE:
- prompt, professional
Love this place!  Lots of character! Great food , big portions, excellent service. We loved Chelsea. Will go back every visit!
This is your basic diner. They had a great  variety of food and good portion sure. This is one of those places you go after a long night and need something to eat.The food is average.

Ordered breakfast and thought it was just ok. Eggs Benedict were good, not great and the biscuits and gravy were underwhelming. Not sure it's worth the wait.  Atmosphere and cocktails in the bar/lounge were really good and that's the only reason I'm giving it 3-stars.

Full disclosure - I have never eaten here.  But if you want to come for a good old fashioned cocktail lounge, then this is hard to beat.  Hasn't changed in 20+ years since I was last here except the old TV's are now flat screens.  The TV's are located above the bubbling water fire pit (yep, still there after all this time) but small enough to be private screens showing old music video clips.  Think MTV before it become a TV Channel.  Sorry about the lack of 5th star but they really do need to know how to make an espresso martini and not try and fudge it.  Other than that a great late night stop off for after dinner drinks.

An absolute Las Vegas icon...can't believe this was my first time visiting!  On the weekends the wait is long, but definitely worth it.  Put your name on the list, head to the lounge, snag a seat at the firepit and order up a Hawaiian sunrise mimosa...you can't go wrong!  After an hour plus long wait, we were seated at the old school booths (great for conversation) and I ordered the eggs benedict...with a bonus egg, nice touch!  Throwback decor, great service and hearty food to prepare for a day/night of drinking in Vegas!

Great service! Huge portions .. The vegetable omelette is delicious.
This place is a definitely a staple in Vegas and should be on your "to do" list when you come to town.

Frankly, I'm surprised I beat my wife to reviewing this place.

Anyway, for what it is, it's great.

What is it?  Denny's on steroids was my first thought...but it's much more than that.  It's a Vegas institution...

And it was our first stop on our trip this time out.

We were not disappointed.  The place will not leave you hungry...and the prices won't leave you broke!

I had the Philly Cheese Steak...I fully expected it to come with the thinly shaved variety of "meat" that adorns most Phillys...but was surprised to find big, meaty hunks of honest-to-god STEAK on this sammy...

Cooked with Peppers and Onions, and not just completely drowning in Provolone...this was actually one of the best Philly Cheese steak sandwiches I've ever had.

It may not have been even remotely authentic, but DAMN was it good.

The Onion Rings were righteous too.  A little on the greasy side...but who cares?  3 days of eating like a 5 year old were in store for us...

What's a greasy onion ring gonna do to me?

It's really a tasty, cheesy treat, that makes you want to start quoting Swingers lines.

Please, refrain from doing that...ever...again.

But it makes you WANT to.  Real bad.

Enjoy!
Very good pancakes. Everything was great. Food, service and clean. Everyone was very nice and personable. The decor is a bit out dated but clean. Highly recommend for all times of the day.

I have been to the restaurant and the lounge side of this place. For breakfast, I'm not a huge fan. Basic breakfast food in grease and bacon that is not crispy enough for me. The restaurant side I'd actually give 3 stars because the hash browns come in a huge size but other than that a 2.

The lounge side is cooler. There's the famous fire pit that you see in pictures but there's only one with about 6 2-person sofas. The fire pit has TVs all around it that play sports and awesome 90s music videos. There are honey roasted peanuts, matches, an a clean ashtray at every sofa.Their happy hour has decent drink and appetizer deals. My friend and I got the cheese plate for $8 during happy hour. The plate came with a ton of swiss and cheddar cheese, grapes, pears, strawberries, candied walnuts, and crackers; really filling. The margaritas were $6 and the Jack and cokes were $5 during happy hour.
i go here often when I go to Vegas haha I dont know why but i do. Food isnt that bad and service is nice. I usually always get the same which is the bacon cheese burger.

You know those places you always imagine in your head, swanky, slightly tacky, and reeking of all that is the spirit of Vegas....but you can never find. Well, the Peppermill is the stuff Vegas dreams are made of. This IS Vegas. 

The decor is bright and dramatic with a blatant disregard for subtly, and yet is perfectly muted so that even the worst hang-over would be welcomed by it's glowing neon. 

We had breakfast. The omelets were huge and fluffy with plenty of toppings. The Oatmeal was well prepared with a nice helping of raisins and banana. 

My chicken fried steak, which is my go-to dining out breakfast, was absolutely spot on. One of the best I've ever had. 

All in all, I would highly recommend skipping the buffets and going to the Peppermill instead.

Our favorite spot here in Vegas for breakfast.. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner. They have a great selection and the service is really good. The theme of the restaurant is very old school. The portions of food is large and very good.. when you're in Vegas you gotta try this spot at least once

This place has the worst customer service!  We walked in 7 deep ready to eat and the young hostess says ok 45 min wait, so we reply ok, than a second hosted looks at our party and states um no that will be 1 hour to 1.5 hours at least after looking us up and down. Our party is quite colorful and diverse with a few small children. I said so you don't want us here and looks at me like no and replies well if your party wasn't so big, WOW!! That is not ok.
I came here because of the reviews but honestly I wouldn't come again. Just wasn't my type of environment but overall the food was OK.

The place looks pretty cool inside. We were really excited to celebrate our occasion here because the food and drinks had such high praise. I ordered a Kiss my cucumber that, as advertised, was a bit short of a mojito. Yes please! When it arrived it was actually really gross. Gin, water, and cucumber doesn't sound like anyone's choice. Not wanting to dampen our night out I thought maybe if I add some sugar and lemon it would help but no. Brought it up and the Manager was so snotty. Read your menu, know your product before you argue with a customer. At least offer to take it off the bill.
Accepting that it's just a drink and moving on I ask for a box to take my food, which was pretty decent, the server gave me a warped to go box. 

Gotta laugh at their consistently to not give a shit about you, the customer.

Lol; high-five! You guys suck!!

I am a fan of The Peppermill. A big fan. I love the 50's diner look from the outside, the massive portions of virtually anything you can chow down either at a table or at the counter in the restaurant. Nachos are great, huge and perfect for that: "it's 4am and I need food, stat" moment; best shared with a friend or 12. Breakfast foods are equally large portions: pancake lovers rave over their stacks; many of my burger loving friends have raved about the burgers. I usually have a gynormous salad, while iceberg isn't my favorite, it is more than adequate here (I never leave without a to-go box) Love that they are open 24/7 and the kitschy decor in the diner. There can be relatively long waits during breakfast hours and at seemingly random times. Worth the wait. Also, it is easy walking distance from many spots on the Strip, so you can walk off some of those drinks/nachos. Recently walked from TI & Bellagio. 

Just the diner side would make this great to this NYer who misses a diner. But then...you walk into the Fireside Lounge and are transported into the 1970's (overheard a man telling his wife "it looks like a den of iniquity")  Velvet couches in the round with flat screens playing old school videos, plus the famous floating fireplace add to the unique ambience; there are even matchbooks at your tables. There are gaming spots at bar, if that's your thing. 

Drinks follow the throwback theme along with Mai Tais, Scorpions & other "Girl Drink Drunk" offerings (check out classic Kids in the Hall skit on You Tube, riff on Days of Wine and Roses but very Vegas) and unique dessert themed libations. There's frequently a roving photographer to present a memento of what always turns out to be a good time for local and tourists alike. 

The waitresses wear long black cocktail dresses, and do the classic "Bunny dip" to place coasters and serve -- reminiscent of the old Playboy Clubs -- there's a decent array of  bar food and appetizers. On my last trip in April we had Caprese Salad (very good) Shrimp Cocktail (a ok) Chicken Quesadillas (really good, very flaky but took forever to come out) and something else I didn't eat but my friend enjoyed it. Drinks are potent, service can be a tad slow, but friendly. Our water glasses were always filled, drinks refreshed and waitress did keep in touch regarding wayward item. 

The people watching alone is worth a visit. Depending on what time you are there, you'll start to see hungry clubbers, hungry/thirsty "dancers " and just your variety of only-in-Vegas sightings. From about 3AM on it gets really shall we say, eclectic?' 

So, I'm a fan. Always have been, always will be. It is a cool spot to chow down, get your drink on or snuggle up to your honey. Long live The Peppermill!

This place has a vintage-70s-retro feel to it on the inside. It is not run down by any means. It is in tip top shape and proud of it. I visited in April 2009 during my first trip to Vegas. This was a nice place with a similar feel to the large neighborhood bar & grill chains, but more unique.
 
The menu was huge... like a bible. I think this would be a safe place for most folks... there should be something on the menu to please anyone. It just so happens I wasn't particularly pleased with my meal, but only because I took a risk on a entree I wasn't sure about. If I'm in town again, I'll definitely go back to try something else. The menu consist of 24-hr breakfast, burgers, steaks, chicken, etc.

It's like a Dennys on mega steroids with much better food and happier servers. It is a must go to every time I go to Vegas, no matter what time it is you can always get a great meal at a very reasonable price, yes there are some hefty wait times but well worth the wait. 
Very retro, neon and dark and thats a great thing. The lounge is a perfect place to unwind with a few tasty beverages.

Get the MUFFINS! They are amazing. The free picture is nice. The service could've been a little better but the food came fast and it was more than enough. I had the peppermill pancake combo and it defeated me easily. Wife got the chicken tenders and loved them too!

It's all about the Fireside Lounge...you have to atleast make a stop here if you've been out until the wee hours of the morning!!! I had my 21st birthday at the Peppermill eons ago when they used to have them in the Bay Area- and this place just brought back so many memories! The food is great and the drinks are alphabetized! it's crazy! you can't go wrong- you just gotta check it out!!!
Happy hour was great and cheap here! The happy hour food and drink specials were so economical and the food portions are huge. A great time to spend with friends

I LOVED this place.  i went the first time by myself bc my hubby was working. walked from the Riviera where we currently where staying, first place i bumped into.  dont be deceived by the outside looks. it didnt look like much to me.  i was hungry so i just walked in to check it out.  it was PACKED.  i sat at the bar area immediately since those are first come first serve so it was nice and fast :).  the sizes are GIAGNORMEOUSSS!!!  (yes that's a word)  huge huge portions, if you share with a friend its best.  They are very friendly, great staff, great food, great work flow.  and my favorite is the sugar!!!!! ITS COLORFUL! i loved this place so much i came back the very next day with my hubby.  he loved it too.  we are coming here every time we are in vegas :)

Stopped by on a Sunday afternoon. Restaurant was pretty busy, but the lounge was not. Stopped by to visit and catch up on some family history and was not disappointed. Definitely old Vegas, definitely an awesome experience.
Drinks were great as was the service. I'd highly recommend making this a stop for a quick drink at the very least. You won't be let down.
Super fresh ingredients in their entrees and really cool bar area! The food wasn't delicious, but I did get extra star for all fresh veggies, etc. not frozen like most places serve. We'll be back.

This place is definitely unique. I haven't been here in a few years and I'm glad that I decided to re-visit today. 

The diner itself is different from your ordinary food spots.  It has great lights on the inside and I get that old diner vibe with the staff wearing their uniforms.

The food is great and comes in HUGE proportions.  I ordered breakfast and recieved enough food for the entire day. 

The staff are all extremely good looking which doesn't hurt either! 

Overall it was great :)

Consistently great every time we visit Vegas!  There always is a long line of people waiting to be seated at a table but we choose to bypass the line for a quick seat at the bar.
The portions are definitely large enough to split if you want to but not always necessary.  Love the yogurt parfait and the large over sized coffee!

My husband loves this place but then again he'll eat anything. Me on the other hand not a fan at all! I've given this place the benefit of the doubt multiple times since my husband is such a fan. Breakfast horrible, worst breakfast sausage I've ever had, lunch beef dip the thickest au ju terrible flavor, dinner there are no words.... Waiting for a table then the wait time for your food is outrageous! I'd rather have over priced McDonalds.

Went here to order some late night breakfast. Can't f____g believe they charge extra to sub out cottage cheese for hash browns. I've traveled all over the country, and this is the first place I have had that does this.

When you travel a lot, it's the little things that matter. I travel a lot, and while I can afford it, it's the spirit of the charge that befuddles me.

Very unique decor in both the restaurant and the Fireside Lounge.  Really loungy but in a cool way.

I had the omelet.  It was so huge, I probably only finished 1/4 of it.  But it was good.  I would like to go back some time and try the drinks and some of the other menu items.  I have a feeling I might add a star after my next visit.

Ahhh... The Peppermill and fireside lounge.  I think the Peppermill side is a bit like a Denny's restaurant but with better decor and slightly better food. I do however highly recommend checking out the fireside lounge. They have a pretty neat setup with a full bar and gaming and comfortable lounge style seating.  They also have a firepit with sofas surrounding it.  Very relaxing and nice to take a date or friends to share a "fishbowl" sized drink. 21 and over on the fireside section and only appetizers.  I always like to tell my friends "PM in the AM" as we seem to go to the Peppermill in the early mornings.

This is by far one of the strangest food joints I've been to. You can wait in the 'lounge' and have a drink and a smoke by the 'water firepits'? You have to take off your hat, but that's cool.  This place was anything but classy, but ya know what...I felt comfortable as hell.

The food and bloody mary was great. The service was good. Best breakfast on the strip...HANDS DOWN!

The minute you walk through the front door and see the slot machines and pink neon lights you just know that you are in for a classic Vegas experience. The Peppermill has been on the north end of the Vegas strip for over thirty years. Many a casino has come and gone in those years but the Peppermill and the adjacent Firseide Lounge has survived.  It is well known for its neon glow, its cute car hop uniformed waitresses and its huge food portions.
 You don't need to worry about the time of day because the Peppermill is open 24 hours and serves Breakfast,Lunch and Dinner anytime. This makes it a perfect late night stop or the place to cure your morning after hangover. For Simone and I, it was the hangover cure, and we arrived mid morning and were immediately seated.  After looking over the waitress, I mean menu, I decided to order the Reuben Sandwich and French Fries. Simone decided to go for the Breakfast menu and ordered a spinach, feta and tomato omelete with hash browns and a Bran Muffin. My Reuben arrived first and it was massive. In fact, it was a club sandwich with three grilled and buttery homemade slices of Rye bread. Between the first two slices of bread was a heaping mound of fresh sauerkraut with gooey melted Swiss and house made thousand island dressing. The kraut was marinated perfectly with the flavor of whole caraway seeds and was excellent as the bed for the thinly sliced pound or so of grilled pastrami which was piled high on the next layer of rye bread with more melted Swiss. This was the holy grail of sandwiches and I amazingly finished the entire thing. The fries were a little to thick cut for my taste but were still fried crisp and were a good side to my sandwich.  Simones omelet was almost equal in size to my sandwich . It was packed full of spinach , cheese and tomatoes and even had some surprise hash browns mixed in with it ( hopefully not left over on the grill from the day before). Simone was a light weight and only downed about 1/4 of her monster meal. The hash browns that came with the omelet were grated fresh and were grilled crispy on the outside and tender in the middle, just the way they should be and i gladly helped Simone finish them.  The bran muffin also had good flavor and was nice, fresh and moist.
The Peppermill is a great experience. Come hungry, because there is plenty to eat and you will want to finish it all.  A great Las Vegas landmark, it is not to be missed. 4 out of 5 for the Peppermill ****

Greasy late night diner food. They serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner all day. The Reuben is good and you can get it with fries or onion rings. You can see the cooks  making your food which I like in a diner. Friendly service and if you don't want to pay the cover for the lounge area entertainment, you can eat in the restaurant for free and the drunk folks are entertainment enough. Definitely a diner worth visiting at any time of day. 

P.s.

The onion rings are breaded not beer batter.

My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this place while walking the strip on our first morning in Vegas. Walking in, my first impression was that the place just screams 70s Vegas. Very cool. Our waitress - Jennifer - was so nice, and she let us know about the huge portion sizes (an omelette has 8-10 eggs!) and that there is no plate sharing charge. So we ordered a plate called Munch's breakfast...absolutely delicious and big enough to share, all for $13.95. Love it!!

This place has been around a long time and is a must eat at when in town. This restaurant has a great lounge in it and is also a must stop. With purple and pink decor and neon lighting and couches that surround a fire pit it is a blast from the past. So very comfortable to hang out and party or have a bloddy Mary while waiting for a breakfast table. That was my strategy anyway and it works for me. 

On to breakfast. I had the seafood omelet which had baby shrimp and lump crab meat in it. It was huge and very tasty. The only complaint is that it was a bit lite on the seafood and the hashbrowns that came with it. The egg to filling ratio was a bit off as a result and noticeable. There was also a variety of muffins besides the toast if you so choose. A nice option. My wife had the the taco omelet with hashbrowns. It was also very good. My daughter had the bacon and cheese omelet which she also said was very good. If it were not for the short on fillings in my omelet and the so-so service from our waitress this place would get 5 stars on this review. However this is a solid place and I will be back next time.

I love this place! I'm a local and every time I have friends in town I take them here. They all enjoy it!

When you walk in, that's the dinner area.. food is great. The happy hour menu is a steal! The wings on the happy hour menu is my favorite off the HH menu. Good deals on drinks too. 

Once you walk in if you keep walking straight past the restrooms that's the fire lounge area. It's a fun casual place to just have a drinks, food, and just chit chat! 

I'm a wine drinker so I just get the house cab. It's actually pretty good!

I had heard of this place from multiple people and then saw it on an episode of Drinking Made Easy. So when my wife and I were in Vegas, we decided to check out the Fireside Lounge. 

It's a dark little bar lit mostly with Neon, there is their signature fire pit, a pool of water with fire bubbling out of it. Instead of regular tables, they have cozy little couches you sit in either next to the fire (which was a little too warm for our tastes in July) or roomy booths you can sit in. The atmosphere reminded me of a mix between a Hollywood portrayal of old school Vegas and a strip club... but not in a bad way. We both found it very comfortable and relaxing. 

The service was fantastic! We never went without drinks, the waitress would check on us even if she could see that we were still working on our drinks. She answered questions, was very personable and polite. This was some of the best service we had in Vegas.

We wanted something light for lunch so we ordered the Crab cakes. WOW these were good! They where flaky, delicious and the sauce the drizzled on top complimented the crab flavor immensely! I would highly recommend giving them a try!

We had a couple of their specialty drinks. The Blue Hawaiian, which was our favorite. It was very good, and very blue! We also had the Scorpion, which is best described as a fishbowl filled with alcohol and ice cream, it was good, but it took the two of us almost an hour to finish it and it was very filling. After we were done, we were in a little bit of misery until we could walk it off. 

One of the neatest novelty things this bar has is the drink guns. They can push one button on the gun and it will automatically pour the drink. It gives consistency to their signature drinks so no matter who makes it; it will always be the same. It's just neat to watch it in action.

I LOVE YOU PEPPERMILL

Once again you made me so happy to be in Vegas. Had an early AM flight and probably couldn't check in and decided to grab some breakfast.
I got the 2 eggs and turkey sausage. Scrambled eggs were cooked perfectly and it came with 4 Turkey Sausage patties. I also had them melt shredded cheddar cheese on top of the hash browns. As the side I got the blueberry muffin...it was the most amazing muffin I've ever had. They also have whipped butter, so it didn't tear the muffin or toast if you got that. My friend got the corn beef hash. She really liked it. It was a GIANT portion. It comes with basted eggs, which means sunny side up and then finished under the salamander. Its still runny though.

The cocktail girls now wear black satin dresses instead of the awesome velvet ones.

Huge portions at decent prices. Love the fact that Peppermill is open 24 hours. Now the prices are probably based on its location on the strip, which makes it convenient for post-club hopping.

The interior is very retro like all diners should be but it could do without all the fake plants hovering over your food. It looked like it was regularly clean but let's hope it truly is.

The food was actually really good (I got the nachos). Giant portions, really delicious. I'm giving this place this rating because of the service. We were actually really nice to our waitress, however, she was very disinterested in assisting us. Whenever we'd look at her she'd be a little occupied in talking w/the kitchen staff, as were other waitresses . We tried to be forgiving and thought she must have had a lot on her plate *no pun intended* but anytime we did see her, she was just hanging outThis place could be a 5 Star but I would hope they'd work on employee attitudes, attentiveness, and productivity.
Good stuff on the strip. Affordable and world renowned. My local friends tipped me off to this place. Breakfast was so filling that it held me over till dinner!

I wanted so badly to like the Peppermill.

I mean, I LOVE Vegas. I LOVE diner food, and um yeah, I LOVE Anthony Bourdain. Three great things must equal excellence, right?

Wrong. I was so unimpressed. 

BFF and I drove into Vegas at 5am on a Thursday. So yes, we were stone cold sober, which I think was the problem. I can completely understand how, if you might have had one or nine cocktails, you would think the Peppermill was the shit. With bright neon lights, ginormous portions, and pretty quick service, it is a drinkers dream. I was charmed by the fake cherry trees and our friendly waitress.

Our food, however, was gross. I had the eggs benedict. The hollandaise sauce was not hollandaise sauce, simply put. It was gray and was more like gravy. My English muffin was burnt and I didn't quite understand why I had three poached eggs. BFF had the Joe's Special, which sounded really delicious. We fought over who would order it. It was a mix of scrambled eggs, sausage, some veggies, served over potato skins, with cheese sauce. Sounds delish, but wasn't. The potato skins were just boiled potato chunks and the cheese sauce was bright orange. There was nothing real about that cheese sauce. 

For our two meals and two sodas, it was $36. Way too much for such a lackluster meal. I gotta admit, it hurt my heart a lil to know that my Anthony and so many Yelpers could be occasionally wrong.

Very expensive for Diner Food, but the portions were huge.  They do not recommend you to share, but it is a good idea to share.  Their deserts looked magnificent, but we did not get a chance to try because we threw out too much food that we could not eat because of the portion sizes.

Again, if you do not live in Las Vegas and your staying in a hotel, share your food with one or two people.

Pretty long wait (with so many similar options around town).

But their service and food are excellent.

The portions are huge too.

Everything - pancakes, chicken fried steak, hash browns is spot on.

A little pricey.

If you can stand the smoke, Ellis Island is better tasting and half the price.

Finally was able to try this gem in Vegas. Came here with my family Halloween weekend for dinner. It's got that OG diner feel. The place is quite big, didn't need to wait too long to be seated. The biggest positive of Peppermill are the extremely generous portion sizes. Seemed like all the orders are big enough for 2. The service here was good as well. They have such a wide variety of items it hard to decide what you want. Personally, I ordered the Maserati Omelette! The pics on yelp are as advertised. Tasted great, it says it's 3 eggs but it felt more like 4-5 eggs! The food was definitely up to par. Peppermill is a spot that many people know of or rave about so definitely give it a try. Just make sure you're hungry or definitely get ready for a to go box. It's the perfect spot for late night dining and when you have the munchies!

Very good food at 5:30 in the morning!! Very good omelette's and super huge pancakes.  Open all night across the street from Circus Circus!!  All of the food ordered was very good and great for the price!!  Affordable and good!  What more can you ask for in a meal?

I've been coming to the Peppermill for over 10 years and its always good everytime... when you go inside it's lit up almost like you're in a strip club! LOL!  The service is great and so is the food!  I l love thier pastrami with the curly fries!  Moderate pricing... great quality and quantity and it always hits the spot!

Fantastic! Yummo!! The best pancakes I've ever tasted! Long wait, but worth it! Decor is old school Vegas. Classic! Neon accents, plush half-circle booths, huge coffee cups, friendly staff, who are all coordinated in cute uniforms.

Despite a long walk from where we were staying, Peppermill was quite the epic feast with Kathleen W. and the birthday girl Ina S. + bf Alex P.

When first entering, I could hear the "Awws" from the girls as they noted the neon lights, blossoming trees, and ambience inside. Definitely an old-school romantic diner type feel. Got seated at a booth and had a pretty hard time choosing between their menu ranging from Southern fried steak to breakfast foods to pasta. While deciding, we got our picture taken in the booth, whcih we got to keep - cute.

Ended up ordering the following and definitely had to split up to the ginormous portions:

-Seafood omelette: Even split two-ways between Kathleen W. and I wasn't enough to finish this. Filled with shrimp and crab, we wondered how many eggs went in this breakfast monster that could easily take up room in a cake box. Hashbrowns were not as great as I would have liked, but the taste of the omelette was just how I would have wanted it, with a good amount of hollandaise and cheese

-Nachos appetizer: Mound of beans, carne, jalapeno, nachos, and real cheese that you can dip in guac and salsa - basically a heart attack ready to happen, but quite tasty while warm
