Tonight I witnessed them kick out a gentlemen in a turban because of their "no hat" policy. I hope he sues them and shuts them down. Ignorant. #peppermilllounge

Ate breakfast here.  The place was busy but we were seated right away.  We sat in a U-shaped booth.  The restaurant is big and it is can get very loud.  I had the NY steak and eggs so the portions that everyone was talking about didn't correlate with my meal since my steak is weighed.  Though, the hash browns seam a bit stingy now that I think about it.  My wife ordered a San Fran scramble.  That portion was big.  We took it home in box.  Our waitress was fast to take our order and serve us.  She asked if I needed a coffee refill and said it would be refilled.  I did't know this was done by someone else as I finished my meal to stop the young man, who also sat us, to refill me.  I was irritated by not having my coffee refilled during my meal.  A lady gave us a complimentary photo.  Another lady came by and asked if we wanted cocktails.  So, two things are preventing me from giving this place 4 stars which are:  small portion of hash browns and the wait for a coffee refill.

This is by far my favorite restaurant for breakfast in Las Vegas.

I cant count how many times I've come stumbling in here whether its been sun up, sun down, middle of the night, etc. The San Francisco special and the crab cake benedict are my favorite. To top this off I usually go for orange juice or some sort of cocktail or beer if I'm in the mood for another drink. I'm a fan of diner type food and the food has that feel with a Vegas party atmosphere inside the restaurant. The prices are very fair also...great food at low price is always a good thing. 

What can I say, I'm a fan!

Breakfast 4/5/2014 - and previous visits

This was an excellent restaurant. My family and I went for breakfast. The portions were huge. The food was delicious. The prices were reasonable. The ambience is great too. Especially the lounge area.
Loved the chicken and red pepper pasta, got the fishbowl drink and the mushroom soup was yummy! Btw get there muffin not the toast if you order breakfast!!
Me and hubby always come here when we are Vegas, it's kind of a tradition and we loive it. Chill relaxi by lounge place

Neon Lights, Good Drinks, and a Old Atmosphere. I love it! 

Peppermill is located on the strip north of the Wynn. You really can't miss it with the big neon blue and pink sign. I feel like it's just a classic place. I mean my mom used to work there back in her day, its been in movies, and it still packed on the weekend. Peppermill is a unique place. It has been a while since I walked into a bar and was just in awe. I know it's an older place and it could use some updating but fuck it, this place is cool. 
You have two parts, the lounge and the restaurant. My friend made reservation for the lounge for his and my best friends birthday for 20 people or so. We walked in on Saturday around 8pm and got to our table and started to order drinks. I love their drink menu. The have some basic drinks and then some ice cream items and even the scorpion. This night I was the DD so I could only taste a little bit of everything. Everyone got something a little different. Alabama slammer, grasshopper, creamsicle, and mudslide to name a few. Everyone had a blast and their happy hour is awesome. They have 50% off well drinks, house wines, and domestic beers. Also their beer are in a bottle. We found that out when we ordered Irish car bombs. No biggie tho. 
Inside the lounge they have a fire pit surrounded by water. Every time I walked by the seats were all taken and there was a lot of canoodling. The decor reminded us of poison ivy's lair with all the leaves and plants and also a strip club. They also have TVs playing different concerts. It was interesting because music was playing but we could hear each other. We had a large area and a lot of people but we could all hear each other. We didn't have to yell across the table or yell in someones ear. Peppermill was a blast from the past and I want to go back.

A lounge for more drinks after nightclubs or gentlemen's clubs, did we even need that? I was pretty drunk already... But it's Vegas, let's just drink all day everyday! I usually don't go to a place that is not in a hotel in Vegas, oh well.... We were there already...

Just had a beer at lounge area while waiting for our food table, it was crowded at almost 5 in the morning. This place looks so old school Vegas, WTH.... The food wasn't so good, not a good place for Vegetarians or Pescetarians....:( service was extremely slow, but our waitress was friendly. 

This type of place is really not my thing, please let's just go back to our hotel to order room service like always.....;p

This is one of my favorite places in Vegas.  I love the feel inside the place, purple booths, neon lights, waitresses in horrible uniforms.  The food is average, but what it lacks in taste it makes up for in portion size.  The food is good,  just not spectacular.  A ton of variety, I've been there several times and don't think I have ever repeated a dish.  
The lounge attached to the restaurant is really cool.  Dark circular seating areas make it a great place for cocktails with friends or dates.  The fire pit near the front is cool too, with plasma TVs all around you shouldn't miss any of the game either.
There seems to be a good mix of tourist and locals here.  I think when you come across a spot locals keep going back to, you have found a special place that hasn't been totally destroyed by tourists.

Whether you are visiting Vegas or you are a local, the Peppermill is the best place for breakfast! The atmosphere is a little outdated but I love it. I always order the Eggs Benedict and I am never disappointed, you get three poached eggs with one order! The Bloody Marys are to die for, and the sparkling breakfast drinks are good too. I always like to go in the lounge and have a drink by the fire ring something about it feels unique and it's become a tradition for me. Do yourself a favor and come here for the best breakfast in town!

The Peppermill has maintained it 'a reputation for over 40 years as a reliable place to get a decent meal. I was there recently to check it out and had a good experience with the food. However, as tasty as the Bloody Mary was I would bet it had a minuscule if any vodka in it.  Waitress was friendly. Great tourist trap!
The peppermill in Las Vegas is a great place for any meal.  Its portions are a little huge.

Love the Fireside Lounge and having dinner at Peppermill. The sliders and potatoes along with their Chocolate Banana make me want to go back. Their Chicken and Red Pepper pasta is phenomenal, if you decide to eat at the restaurant side. The decoration is super cute and the staff outfits are as well. The graveyard manager is so sweet!!

We decided to try the breakfast yesterday, 1/7/18. We got there at around 10:30, there was no line at the front booth, we walked in at the same time as another couple. We were not greeted by the THREE people that were standing at the booth, talking among themselves. We stood there for a minute without them even acknowledging or the other couple that came after us. We told them we would like a table for two and they did not respond all they did is look down to see if there was a table for us and told us to follow one of the two young ladies .

Our server did not come to our table. We asked somebody else who was walking by for some drinks......at least 30 minutes past and our server still had not taken our order. There was a table next to us full of people who arrived at least 15 minutes after us and they had already received their food.

We told one of the servers that we were ready to order and they told us that they would get our server. They did. Her name was Amanda and she never smiled. We made our order and after that she only came back twice. One included her coming to give us the check.

We decided to pay at the front with the cashier. She also never smiled!!!! Didn't even tell us or any of the other people that paid before us to have a nice day. 

I think the morning staff needs customer service classes. Starting with those that are supposed to greet us, those who serve us and the cashier.

It was very disappointing. We will definitely not go back for breakfast..the late staff is much nicer. But we will be back for dinner and possibly drinks at the lounge.

I came back after getting specific instructions from my friend 'Don't worry about the dining portion, go straight back to the bar/lounge area".  So I came back and did just that and it felt like I went into a time warp!

They have the curved couches with pillows which are really comfy to enjoy a drink in that you might just fall asleep.  The main draw of the room is a water feature off to the side with a gas fire coming out of it.  

The lights change colors and all the TV's are playing music videos (when is the last time you've seen a music video?).  While it sounds like it's almost a tacky environment, it really is cool and not dirty at all.  

Experience wise, the waitresses have a tiny chair they come in sit down on to take your order.  They call you "doll" and a bunch of other retro names and then smoothly walk away their flowing black dress not far behind.

Our friend billed the lounge portion as the "place you go to seal the deal" and I could tell there were many couples here.  Maybe not as cool as the Mandarin Bar, but the drinks are way more reasonable.

This place is delicious!! My friend and I shared the Mediterranean omelette and an order of the small French toast and they were both to die for. We took the left over French toast home and it was even good served cold. The service is exceptional as well. They also have a cute little bar with a fire place which is perfect for a date night.

Man, this is the second time I've been to pepper mill and the first time was a blur since I was a bit hammered, but the second time was a bit amazing.

Now one thing with the peppermill, is you may have to wait, but don't worry, you can make the most of your time by either playing at the slots they have or just chilling and having a mimosa in their fireside lounge. The fireside lounge has this 70s strip club kind of feel with its decor of red and dim lights. They have a multitude of drinks to choose from and you can go old school and get a White Russian or zombie. 

Finally when you get seated, they have both a regular menu, but really is more famous is there breakfast menu. By the way, this is as good as any Vegas buffet, because their portions are insane and much tastier. Had the Maserati omelette and I was in heaven. How often can you have italian with breakfast? I wanted to eat more but I was so full. Sometimes wish I was a fatty so u could of eaten it all. Can't beat italian sausage with eggs covered with a tangy pasta red sauce. Delicious! Can't wait to go again!

Best place to eat in Vegas the morning after.  Enormous portions ("huge" doesn't do them justice, they're so big), decent prices and a cool 80s-ish lighting scheme plays up the Vegas experience while hungover.  Fireside lounge is pretty awesome; I'd suggest having a drink or two with a small group around the fire.  The ambiance is amazing.  It's different than what you'll find in the rest of sin city.  Everything from the food to the coffee to the rainbow sugar sprinkles are fantastic.  Check it out before you leave town for home; your friends will be impressed that you know of such a "local" spot and you won't be disappointed.  Been coming here for years and plan to continue!  Perfect way to wrap up a weekend in Vegas.  Also, be sure to order breakfast.  Always the best.

Omg ew. Lol this place gave me so much nausea and anxiety. It's full of tacky colors and old stained carpet (I understand the theme, I just don't agree with it). The place was PACKED. We stopped by prior to our departure to LA on a Sunday for brunch and we were quickly regretful. Service was extremely slow and none of the food was worth the wait. My eggs were inedible, I didn't eat much. I did, however, get my leftovers(all my food) to-go and gave it to a homeless outside. :) never again

I usually end up taking all my friends who are visiting from out of town, to this place. The Fireside Lounge is my favorite section of the Peppermill. If you want good eats 24/7, try the diner that is attached to the lounge. Prices are great, considering this restaurant is located on the Strip.

Still love it, even though they've now got enough flat-screen tvs in the Fireside Lounge to have, like,  a 1:1 ratio to customers when the place is packed. I still really enjoy that the waitress are in full-length black evening-type gowns at all hours. It make it feel special, even if it's only 4 in the afternoon.

They need to dust the forest of trees in the main dinging area.
A bit of a hidden gem. I have been to Vegas 20+ times and had never been here. The food is delicious, the portions are huge, and the staff is attentive.  Great vibe and well worth the trip.
This place is great. Great service and huge portions. Get the banana split. Its huge!!!

Loved the old school Vegas environment. Loved the indoor bonfire surrounded by water even more! Was not too pleased with the omelet. Tasted bland. I nicely complained. They took it off my bill. Without me even asking. That's great service! I would totally go back for drinks and the pancakes or waffles. Totally a throw-back to what Vegas used to be. I loved it!

I dig this joint. It has good food for a reasonable price. My friends I always come here after a night of dancing or walking the Las Vegas Strip late night since it's open 24/7 and the Fireplace is absolutely nice and cozy. My favorites here are the Nachos & the Sampler. "I always decide on those and I never go wrong with them!" I recently had the wings here. They're a little salty, but not too much as to where you can't enjoy them so it's safe to say that I'd still recommend them. The cocktails are good here too. My favorite cocktail is the Scorpion here.

This place as been a family staple for over 25 years. As a child I looked forward to coming here on our vacations to LV and now as an adult the I still look forward to coming here! The spinach salad is incredible and is definitely shareable. The breakfast menu has your standard items so you can't go wrong if you have kids!
It was just an average breakfast diner. Bug portions and ok service. Coffee was good and the toast was ok. Didn't like the choce of fruits, but hey whatcha gonna do?!

The peppermill is DELICIOUS! It is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas for many reasons. I love the atmosphere, the food, and the portions! The decor of the peppermill is so cute and is very vegas-like. The waitresses wear old school diner uniforms and work their butts off! They are definitely priced on the higher end, but it's expected considering they are on the strip, it's a tourist attraction, and the portions are humungous. The only downside- this place can get very very busy and you may wait a while! It's best to go during the week or late at night to avoid large crowds and waiting. Otherwise, this place is awesome! Definitely recommended!

I gotta say - the restaurant part sucks.  The Lounge - much better.  

Although the food is hit and miss, it can be good.  Then other times, it can be cold.  Wait staff isn't always the friendliest, and last time we were there, they totally messed up our order, leaving us with mostly cold food because of having to fix the order.  OK, AND ON TOP OF THAT - they charge you for EVERY REFILL.  EVERY. SINGLE. ONE.  I was even charged for a whole other cup of coffee when I just asked to top off my cup to make the coffee hot again. So, what... ? They put in less then a 1/4 of a pour and charge me for a whole cup of coffee?  I don't think so. I have no desire to go back there again.  But...

The Lounge - cool vibe, the food seems to be better when it served back there (still can't figure that out) and the drinks are REALLY REALLY good.  We like to go to the Lounge with friends, especially ones from out of town.  

Skip the restaurant, go to Denny's instead.  Seriously.  The restaurant isn't all it's cracked up to be.

Is it a strip club or a Denny's on psychedelics? 

Honestly, what can be said that hasn't already been written? The Peppermill has a great atmosphere, decent food, and hefty drinks. I brought an out-of-town friend here who, like me, has an appreciation for the ridiculous and the brightly colored, which this venue has many times over with tons of pink neon lights and 80's music videos playing on repeat. 

We grabbed a seat just above the fire and water sunken living set, and were greeted promptly by a server. We ordered a few drinks and went with classic mozzarella sticks and the Sriracha chicken bites. The food was pretty basic, but I would recommend the Sriracha chicken bites, especially if you're just going to sip and snack. 

Beyond the normal vodka soda and martinis, we opted for the Scorpion Bowl. This juggernaut of alcohol and sugar is best served over ice, but if so inclined, you can add ice cream into the mix for that creamy dreamy diabetes fueled coma. The Scorpion Bowl was ok, but insanely sweet and definitely needs to be shared with a fellow boozehound. The bowl is great as a one-time novelty drink, but I wont be ordering this on my next visit to the Peppermill. 

Cheesy music, velvet couches, and neon lights. I'm there.
Always a favorite.  Never in my twenty years of living here was there a problem.  The food is consistent and service is great.

Gross so ughhhh yucky:( once we walked in they ask us do u want something from the bar we said no thanks we live here... Servers was nice food was grossssssss!! I just ate my toast and my bf was looking at me because I'm the one who wanted to come here lol servers was nice decor cool I guess but never again..I feel like the people that think this place is good is because they're drunk and they have no tastebuds lol but we was sober and boy it was horrible

Was refused service because they don't allow hats even for those being worn by a female cancer patient - really sad they are so unbending even talked to management who said policy is policy.  I think they need to change policy.

Everytime we come to Vegas this is our spot!! We come for breakfast and sometimes even come back after hours!! We never ordered anything that wasn't good! Portions are soo huge big enough to share unless your a fatass!
One of the best restaurant "diner" lounge experiences.  Great food and service with a  velvety atmosphere.  French toast was amazing today!

Endearing.

You can't dislike Peppermill unless you're either 
1. a Grouchy McGrouchy Pants 
2. a rainbow and unicorn hater.

Who doesn't love neon rainbow signs? Who doesn't love indoor neon, old 70's dining table lamps, and rainbow sprinkles when eating? 

The basics: 
1. Affordable 24/7 diner with all-day breakfast
2. The menu is huge and overwhelming like Cheesecake Factory
3. While not fancy, this is just good, solid diner food done right. And big.
4. Happy Hour drink and app specials! Cocktail waitresses will take drink orders separate from servers
5. No split checks. Don't worry, someone invented Venmo for that.

Fun vibes and just a happy place to eat. Just a fantastic memory to add to any Vegas trip. Get the avocado BLT with the runny egg on top!
Had the Marco Polo omelet with hash browns and it was filling and delicious. Eggs, spinach, diced chicken, cheese and hollandaise on top, Awesome!! Friendly staff and fast service. Highly Recommend.

I can't give this place a 5-star review because I was pretty darn drunk when I went. The atmosphere is great at 4:30 in the morning. When you are slightly about to have  a hangover and are just stumbling out of some afterhours club and are not ready to see the sun yet...this place is perfect. Go, grab a delicious bloody mary, sit by the fire fountains, or get a table. Order yourself one of their great 10-egg omelets (I ordered one that had crab and avocado in it). It is a great place to go with your friends to fill up on pre-hangover food and sober up.

I can't believe that once you leave the very family styled eatery of the Peppermill you pass the double doors and you enter a lounge that all that is missing is the strippers.. We spent 3 hours here catching up with my little brother, enjoying the cocktails and watching the couple behind us get to 3rd base, each seating area is secluded so there is alot of privacy. I will be returning again.

This place is adorable! Its like Dennys meets Kawaii. Its greasy spoon food - very yummy. They have a separate restaurant and lounge. If you come on a Sunday or holiday, make sure to come early because they get a line out the door. Its worth it though with the decor and food. The lounge is cute with fire pits and comfy couches. Not really ADA accessible in the lounge, but the restaurant is fine. If you like ice cream, order the sunday - but be warned it about 5 lbs of ice cream!

Don't come here for brunch on Saturday between 9:30-12. We arrived for breakfast and they told us it was a 45 minute wait which is fine because it gave us the option to think whether or not we could wait or go somewhere else. We figured it would be 45-1hr and decided to wait. There were 4 of us plus an infant and the place was packed there's only 5 chairs to sit in and wait so you can imagine how there were people waiting everywhere. We stood against the wall for 55 minutes and I decided to go up to the host and ask how much longer. She told us it would be another 45 minutes. This is not ok. I told her we had already been waiting an hour and she explained she was sorry but there was a table of 20 waiting before us. That's fine however it's better to tell people ahead of time when they check in, that way we can make the decision of whether or not we want to wait. This is the second time this has happened to us. I saw the list she had written down it was one hour wait so I explained it was actually a 2 hour wait and she should inform people to give them a heads up. The only reason I gave two stars was because the times I have been here (about 4) the food has been great. The service is always ok, nothing awesome. I really like the tacky decor it's old school Vegas.
This place was amazing very huge portions and very nice staff I will be back again when I go back to Vegas! Great mimosas

Love every thing I order from here! I get small oatmeal and its delicious. Eggs benedict...freaking awesome. Pancakes...yeah, you know it. So, I usually eat breakfast but I am coming back to update as soon as I order something from main menu...just don't know when I will get over breakfast yet.  Oh, and a full bar for breakfast...I love the grown-up version of Rainforest Cafe.
Oh my!  HUGE portions.  Cool other side with fireplace and dark cool ambience.

We were looking to find some breakfast in Vegas and wanted to try out a new establishment.  I had heard that the Peppermill was worth a try.  We decided to take a gamble and a short Lyft ride down the strip.  To best describe this restaurant in a single sentence, I would say it is a double-priced Denny's with slot machines. 

We walk in and ask for a table.  There is a 25 minute wait for a table but decide to be sat immediately at the counter in front of the waitress station/kitchen.   Our waitress was very attentive and our drinks never went empty.

We came here for breakfast and their menu had plenty of options.  I couldn't decide on what to get so I asked the waitress what they were known for/what was popular.  She didn't have an exact idea but said people like to get the country fried steak.  I said hey why not and ordered it.  My wife ordered the blueberry pancakes with sausage and bacon.  The food arrived surprisingly fast.  My food looked and tasted average.  The country fried steak looked like a big battered pancake covered in sausage gravy.  It was just too much for me grease-wise.  Sitting right in front of the kitchen I could see all the other customer's food waiting to be delivered and instantly regretted not going with a lunch option.  My sunny side eggs were alright.  My hash browns appeared fresh cut but were soggy.   I tried a bite of my wife's blueberry pancakes and they tasted great.  Fresh blueberries and such.  For her sides, she ordered scrambled eggs with cheese and her meal also came with a side of bacon and sausage.  

Overall, the food was pretty average.  The prices were kind of ridiculous.  My cup of coffee was $4.  My country fried steak meal was about $20.  My wife's meal the same price.  Overall, we ended up spending over $50 for meal that might normally run in the $20s range at a similar diner.  I could have eaten at Hash House for cheaper.  Oh well I learned my lesson.

Maybe I missed something.  Maybe I should have ordered lunch.  I just didn't catch the charm that was supposed to make this place special.

Decent diner fare in ample portion, though desperately overpriced (e.g., $7.50 fruit cup).  My chorizo & eggs was delicious.  Best time to go is what anywhere besides the Las Vegas Strip would consider normal weekday breakfast hours (e.g.,Monday 7:30am).  Otherwise, can be quite a wait.
Large portions, breakfast and the rest, 24hrs. Nice service moderately expensive. A New Jersey Diner transplanted on LV Blvd, but this one's in better condition.

Of all the times I have been to Vegas I was missing something.....I needed something out of old time Vegas, something flashy, gawdy, and cool not dirty  and cheesy like Fremont street and over the top like the strip. Then I found my oasis....Peppermill! I went here because I saw it on Anthony Bourdain's No Reservations and I was in complete awe of the decor and the large drinks they had and what I thought to expect Peppermill gave more. 
It's a great place to have drinks with your friends away from all the typical Vegas stuff. The waitresses outfits are tasteful and classy  from what I have seen at Vegas which is a relief itself. 
First time goer and likes to drink get the Scorpion.

You definitely get the Las Vegas vibe when you walk into this place.  The blue neon lights every where is a tribute to the Las Vegas of yester-year.  We came here for breakfast and ordered a chicken fired steak, a classic Eggs Benedict and kids pancake for my four year old.  The chicken fried steak and the Eggs Benedict were good.  Quality you would expect from a good old fashioned diner.  The portions are pretty big even for american standards so come hungry.  Service was a little slow but all in all a great alternative to the overpriced resorts.

If you want that classic Vegas atmosphere while eating, this place is it.  Cherry blossom trees around the booths, mirrored ceiling, and crazy carpet make the whole experience great.  

Food-wise, it's not that bad.  It's typical breakfast food at any diner in Vegas.  Overall, a place to eat when you want that crazy scene while eating your meal.

I had their chicken Quesadilla, very cheap on their cheese :( hardly any...FYI to peppermill..Quesadillas are supposed to have cheese, I didn't return it because I was hungry and I didn't feel like waiting for a new one , but a quesadilla is pretty self explanatory ugh Cheese you cheap $@: duh...but plenty of sour cream and salsa, we had to ask for extra napkins, ketchup..

Wanted to like this classic Vegas late night joint, but sadly B & I went for breakfast.  Ordered the Greek style omelet (feta cheese, spinach, etc.) and had hash browns.  

The hash browns were undercooked and tasted like warm frozen nastiness...& the omelet was totally undercooked with 0 taste.  

Sent my meal back & didn't have the courage to order another meal.  

Anyhow, if desperate, I would do late night run in like I do when I'm LA at 'Mels'; but not a fan (maybe just a bad one time experience).  

Service was solid and other customer's meals looked decent, so again shall give Ol'Pep the benefit of the doubt and say maybe I was unlucky...

I would suggest keep it simple sin city & order basic stuff here - the bacon was good! lol
Solidly good quality food. One of the few things i truly miss about living in Vegas is the Peppermill.

Something happened to this place and I'm not quite sure what it is. The service has dropped, the food is not as good, and the prices have increased so that it's no longer a good value to leave my hotel. $7.90 for 2 coffees (not even Starbucks charges this). $17 for a turkey club sandwich with a sliver of avocado. Breakfast for 2 was $45 (no alcohol was ordered). When we mentioned our concerns to the manager, it was clear that she could have cared less. I've been coming since I was 14 yrs old. Guess what - I ain't comin' back until this ship turns around. What a shame; It used to be a cool local place and now it's just another tourist trap.
Good customer service, but my food was gross and tasted like dog food. I got the corn beef hash, my sisters and a friend got delicious meals, mine not so much.

Sigh... I love me some good diner food. We came in around 0130. We were seated right away. Around me there were a bunch of empty tables that needed to be cleaned off. Giving this place a messy/dirty feel despite what appears to be a recently renovated restaurant. 

The crowd is what you expect to see late night. The menu was pretty extensive with breakfast served 24 hours a day.

Our server was excellent. She was attentive and checked up on us appropriately. The food arrived very quickly. My husband got the sampler and I got the Lorraine omelet. The sampler was as nothing spectacular. The omelet was fluffy and not that flavorful. I subbed the home fries for French fries, but they came out so undercooked.

To sum it up... great service,  love that it is open 24 hrs... but the food was not good and I definitely found a long piece of hair cooked into my omelette. So grossed out. 

Will not be returning.

The place was very retro, for sure. We went out on a Wednesday night at about 9pm. My husband and I both had great meals. I had the pancakes and eggs and sausage. The portions were huge, but I ended up having breakfast for the next day. He had a sandwich (I can't remember which one) and he enjoyed it very much. Other than a couple of surround tables' drama, we had a pretty nice dinner. We will definitely go back.

We ate here on 12/10/11 around 6pm. Gave this place 4 stars because the prices for some of the dinner entrees are outrageous, in my opinion, but I realize the portions might make up for that. My husband got the gyro sandwich that came with onion rings (huge onion rings), I got the turkey burger which came with sweet potato fries (and lots of it!) and my son had the kids meal pancakes with sausage (the pancake was humongous).  The highlight of my meal was the turkey burger. I think that was the biggest,  juiciest, best tasting turkey patty I have ever had. Yes the decor is cheesy and out dated but my son was in love with all the neon lights and my husband was in love with all the short skirted waitresses and massive cleavage of the cocktail girl.

2/16/14

this place is always great! ive been coming here for YEARS and its always consistent- good food and lots of it!

i got the eggs benedict, which is my go to. it was delicious.

i go to vegas at least twice a year so i cant wait to be back in august.

The food that we had was amazing but the service ... not at all. 

First it was so slow, secondly the waitress looks like she's very tired. It was our God-sister's birthday on that day and when asked if there's anything special, she said we can get the cake & she or the rest will sing it. We rather sing to here ourselves. The food came about 50 mins later without the garlic bread that was supposed to be there together. When we called for the manager to at least feedback to her what had happened, she said "what will make us happy"? So I said, comp the birthday girl's food. She did not do that but gave us 20% off. Anyway, we will not be back there again. :-(.

We dined at the Peppermill on a recommendation while in town. Enjoyed seeing a part of old Vegas. Service was great and efficient. We ordered the Maserati omelette, chicken fried steak and eggs, and a pastrami cheese burger. Portions were huge and the food was great. Just as good as some of the high dollar, big name restaurants in town.
Enjoy a refreshing bloody mary while you wait to have breakfast! Pancakes, eggs, sausage and hash browns were great! Recommend to add to your morning while visiting vegas.

We stopped by while in town for a convention. We were so impressed!

The waitress and staff were so friendly. They offer breakfast and lunch options all day long.  We get our food and everything was fresh, huge portions, and tasted SO good!! We had hamburgers which were filled with wonderful toppings like pineapple, avacados ect. The breakfast was great with the French toast option, covered in fruit and hot syrup.

Great restaurant option and so glad we stopped by!

Went again for lunch and it didn't disappoint. 

I had the same thing as last time and it was just as good. I would have liked the omelette a little less watery but, it was egg whites and that can happen. My hash browns were cooked almost to perfection. Crisp and light. 
The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars was because the service was a tad lacking. It took well over 15 minutes just to have our order taken and then another 10 minutes for our waters to be brought out. Our waitress was busy though and our food came out fairly quick too so, this won't deter me from returning again and again.
I just think I need to try something new next time. I guess I can be a creature of habit, lol

Biggest omelette I've ever seen.  Seriously, what's the deal with this five-egg monstrosity?  Even sharing it took two people two days to take that thing down.  I appreciate a large meal, but jeez.  The hash browns were great, not amazing.

The decor is garish and horrible but very Vegas and endlessly fascinating, so I guess it gets a pass.  The place was packed, and it was a bit slow, but who knows if that's the norm.  Pretty traditional diner food.

I've been here twice: once at about 3am and once at about 6pm. Both times the place was busy... Different crowds though. The food was good, service  was better at 3 in the morning, the place looks like Miami Vice meets the Flamingo Hotel from 40 years ago and I'm not sure why. If Dennys partied a little too hard and had a kid that was raised in Vegas it would definitely be Peppermill.

It's one of the few classics that doesn't fade away. I just had the pastrami sandwich the other day and it was excellent! I have not had a good pastrami sandwich since Old Ebbitt's Grill in Washington, DC. This sandwich was pretty darn close. On top of the one of a kind decor, Elvis was having lunch at the same time! This place is still top notch!

***Just a warning*** Prepare to wait!!!
Came here on a Friday afternoon. The place was PACKED. We found a seat in the Fireside Lounge (luckily right in front of the fire). Service was slow and when the waitress did come around she would go MIA after the drink order was put in and when we asked for some of their honey peanuts (which we never got). I also had to flag down multiple people to ask why the waitress never brought back my debit card when I gave it to her 20 minutes prior. Only when they tracked the waitress down was my card processed. Also, I highly recommend paying with cash, as they placed a $34.50 hold on my card, for god knows whatever reason, that didn't fall off until the following WEDNESDAY (5 Days) after my initial visit. I can understand if I had asked to leave the tab open, but I had them close it out immediately. There was no notice or warning that they put holds on cards.
The drinks and food are good. Portions are HUGE. The waitress on the diner side was very nice and fast. 
Would I come back? Sure, but I'm going to bring cash.

After watching the much anticipated star wars the last Jedi on christmas we needed food. But where do you go? So thankful to find that the peppermill was open. The portion sizes were huge i could have split my club sandwich with 3 people depending on the hunger factor. The coffee was good, the herb chicken sandwich juicy and flavorful and the fries crisp to perfection. I was rather impressed because its a fairly average older establishment with allwalks of life coming in and out of its doors, but they even sold me on atmosphere. Each group was given their own little booth in this very bright blue and neon signed room. I will be back to try their colossal sized cocktails and larger the average banana split!

I go for breakfast on the weekends and it's always great, good service and big portions , also perfect after a long night on the strip try the Biscuits and gravy then home for
 some shut eye.

My favorite place to go after my night out!!! It is 24/7 and always crowded and cool interior. 
It is one of those place with huge portions and good food!! I come here every time when I'm visiting!

They will take a picture for you and your group as a souvenir! And of course you can buy the bigger print but they give you a small one for free!

My favorite has to be their hot chocolate with whipped!
I'm not sure why but something about their hot chocolate always warm up my night and wakes me up. 

Their breakfast food is a must here!! Hash brown and omelet! Huge portion ,amazing price and yummy too! Burger is also decent! Meat is juicy and comes with many sides. 

For those who are looking to grab some food after a night out or early morning brunch. This is def the place to go!

I'm hoping to try out more of their food when I go!! But will def come back!

This place brings back fond memories for me. When I was a kid, my dad and all his guy friends would meet for breakfast at the Peppermill the first or last Saturday of the month. It was my first experience of being out with the guys, feeling cool and I wish I could bring back those days. 

I'm here to say that it hasn't changed all that much. The waitresses are still wearing shiny nylons, but they are a lot younger than I remember, which is definitely a good thing. The food is good, the portion sizes are GIANT and you could easily order breakfast and share it with another friend or significant other. 

The service here was very good. Coffee cups were never empty, our waitress checked with us numerous times throughout the meal and they even had a cute gal come around and take your picture, which obviously means she comes back 12 minutes later while you have hash browns and eggs all over yourself asking "Wanna buy your photos? 2 for $29.99 or one for $14.50.") That's not such a bargain hun.

Peppermill is a much better option that the hotel buffet, which at the Wynn (where we always stay) would have been roughly $35 a piece.

Perfect brunch spot! A Bloody Mary in the lounge while you wait for your table is the ideal Vegas experience! I chose the biscuits and gravy and they were SO delicious. And the chicken fried steak rivals the best I've ever had. Can we go again tomorrow?

In Vegas for the weekend and tried this random place to eat . I have to say they have a lot of options to choose from. I got a Peppermill cheese and bacon burger with sourdough bread it was okay.. not the best the bread was way too hard and the food was cold. My boyfriend on the other hand got a country fried steak with hash browns and he said he would give it 3 stars. It was good because I was hungry but I wouldn't come back.
Must stop for breakfast while visiting Vegas ! It's usually our last bfast before heading home.

A very weird vibe here, but the food is awesome and reasonably priced, and the quirkiness just adds to the Vegas charm.

I came in on a random weekday evening to grab a quick dinner. The first thing I noticed was the low, neon lighting everywhere. My attention quickly moved onto the skimpy retro style diner attire all the waitresses were wearing. It kind of gave off a bizzaro "Hooters" feel. On top of all that, I had arrived at 6 pm, apparently the tail-end of the early bird hour, as the median age of the clientele appeared to be approximately 82. Ah, Vegas. Where else can you see a retro neon hooters full of octogenarians?

Onto the food: I opted for the Philly cheesesteak with onion rings, and it was tasty, freshly prepared, and HUGE. I downed everything on the plate, but I had no regrets. My sense of accomplishment was only enhanced when I got the check. This place is a winner, folks.

Usually a 24 hour restaurant, I usually think of Denny's. Mainly a little less then average place, just to have something to eat and not much to really look at, except the other booth of people around you. But Peppermill, proved me wrong about 24 hour restaurants, and looks more then an average place. Now this was an ideal 24 hour restaurants, that I wish it could take over Denny's. Then I would be coming there all the time. 

Located next to Riveria, its a very colorful restaurant on the strip. Of course I had my doubts about going here, but glad my wife twisted my arm and go. Outside, it may look a bit unsure on cause its close to downtown. But despite the fancy looks that you can see on the outside, inside, is a whole different story. The seating is not like no other picnic table booth, its basically a curved booth with nice, colorful seating. You don't have to worry about being smooshed against the wall anymore. Each booth is like curved like the letter "C", all over the restaurant. It has very nice lighting, and very wonderful arrangements, like your in the rainforest. Not like Rainforest Cafe, but a bit less elaborate then Rainforest Cafe. 

The staff was wonderful, we were seated right away, we were served drinks, once we were seated. Our waitress was very nice as well. They all wore colorful uniforms and made the place interesting. She always made sure that we were okay. 

Looking over the menu, the pricing was a bit more then I expected. But once I got my food, I can see why. The food was in big portions. I ordered the New York Steak, and ordered it well done. I was amazed that it came out well done. I mean, no pink what so ever on that meat. Usually when I order steak, it doesn't seem well done, but this time around, it was. Made me think about next time I come here, I should order medium. I don't mind pink, but I thought like any other place I had a well done steak, it had little pink. But I really did enjoy my New York steak. It did come with a salad, and it came big. Also came with Onion rings that were big. Mainly everything was big, even my wife's coffee cup was big. As much as I wanted to try to finish it, I couldn't. I came so close though. Finish the salad, the steak, but threw in the towel with 3 onion rings left. 

If your looking for a place to eat in the middle of the night. Peppermill will surely not disappoint. The pricing may be more then usual, but its well worth the price, especially when everything comes at you in big portions. Very well recommended 24 hour restaurant.

I don't do drugs. But if I did, this would be my restaurant of choice while in Vegas. It looks like a box of demented crayons teamed up with a glitter-pooping unicorn to stop the invasion of Barney the dinosaur.

Four stars.
2 visits in a week, it's that tasty! My 86 year old father loves this place- huge portions, fairly priced.

First off I wanna warn my fellow Yelpers NOT TO PARK ON NORTH LOT, tow zone not by peppermill. Now for my review: I'm HUNGRY!!!! As im waiting looking around, everyones food looks so good and hefty portions. The food is SOOO GOOD!!! I got egg Benedict and 1 pancake, my hubby had the corned beef and hash. 1 OJ and water. Service is spot on. Decor is very colorful, even sugar is colorful. Will be my place to come for breakfast in Vegas for sure.  Bill was $37 and have left overs.

In love with how retro this place.  I felt like I was in a fancy limo restaurant mixed Denny's with all the neon lights and the fake trees.  It's tacky but awesome at the same time.

They have a very extensive menu so they basically have everything to cover your needs.  The service here was pretty good.  Nothing to complain about.  

Southern Fried Steak and Eggs: Lots of gravy just the way I like it.  They cut the potatoes differently than other people but it was crispy.  
Gyro Sandwich: Maybe it was drunk me but it was probably the best gyro I've had at night.

I would totally come back here again.  Plus it's open 24/7.

Since, this place was the nearest and had the best ratings on yelp from the location where I was staying on the strip this is where I ended up eating my SATURDAY Breakfast. 

The wait time was 30-45 minutes for a group of five people. I believe we waited longer though. The bar inside the restaurant had no wait. But, you could only order appetizers as food entrees. The inside of the restaurant looks like a rave or a strip club.  The neon lighting is pretty epic. The staff was very friendly being that this place was super packed with people waiting inside and outdoors for a table. 

The Menu was a little overwhelming -- it had a big selection to choice from. So, what ever your probably craving after a long night of partying.. they probably have it on their menu. Everyone in my group had breakfast entrees... We all seemed to like there crispy hash browns. Oh... Did I mention the colorful sugar on the table? Yes, there sugar for coffee looks like confetti. Super cool and colorful, just like their dining area.

Only 4 stars because one of the waiters was not great I asked him what is the specialty here, since it was my first time! He said, "American" ummm really! then the buss boy said were you looking for mexican food? Umm no!! That did it for me!  The food is delicious and they serve huge portions...Coffee was always warm it could of being a little hotter in my opinion.

Take about beeing full. The line out the door. This place is pack with lot of people. The waitress was nice go are food rite and fast. Will be coming back agend. The good thing it's next to where I was staying.

love the food but the service here sucks 100% unless ur sitting at the bar the server don't really care about service ......our server sam never ever checked on us got our order wrong and when we let someone know she waited umtil the manger came and droped off the check to say sorry she didnt care at all ....the manger mary is a sweet heart she seem to be doing the server's job....wouldn't come back

The fireside lounge located inside the peppermill was one of our stops to go to on a bar hopping experience I had. We came around 10 which is happy hour on food and drinks. The lounge has one big fire pit in the middle of the room and everything is neon and blue velvet. It's a fun place for drinks and I would love to return here.

This is our go to spot since we don't have a huge appetite and don't want to splurge $40+ bucks on a pricey buffet.  This is the place to go if you want a good price, large portion & delicious meal.  Their omelettes have 10 eggs, so this gives you an idea as to how big a portion they serve.  My recommendation if you don't eat a lot, split it.  Also, if there's a waiting time go to the fireside lounge through the glass doors if you're 21+ as you can order cocktails while you wait and the waiting time won't seem so long.
The best hot wings and curly fries on this side of the Mississippi!!!! It was amazing grace!!!! I'm from TN and was visiting and I will be back next month!!!!!!

The pancakes have won again! The omelets will always conquer! 
The Peppermill is always a great place to eat, from 2pm to 2am! 
If you haven't been here before, make a stop here!
I had the BBQ cheddar burger and it was amazing, I asked for extra BBQ sauce and they brought out warn BBQ sauce .  Shoutout to our server Hiromi she was amazing.
Old Vegas style , great food we love to go late nights for a bite

There's really nothing exceptional about this place, but it does represent an anamoly smack dab in the middle of the otherwise sordid and overpriced strip.  Comfortable coffee shop vibe or an average but comfortable cocktail lounge is the gist of it.

So, I've been doing business in both these places since before most Yelpers were born (about '86) as well as at the Algiers restaurant and lounge which were immediately to the north.  I chuckle when I see people give this place less than 4 stars because someone didn't honor their existence or because Bobby Flay didn't prepare their meal on their one visit.  This place is remarkable not only for enduring as one of the last of the old Vegas but because the service, portions and quality have all remained consistently high throughout at least the last 30 years.  They've tweaked when conditions necessitate but haven't really changed what they do because what they do is provide great quality and value without caring what trends dictate at the moment.  Pretentious? Go somewhere else.  Got friends and wanna hang?  Try the bar or restaurant, you won't be disappointed.  Hope they stay around another 30+ years  ;-)

My husband and I split the ham & eggs. 
Ham was huge!!! Unfortunately we sent it back because it was dry and sour. We were afraid to eat it and get sick on vacation. The ham ended up being a country cured ham and our palettes are not used to the salty/sour notes of the ham. Peggy comped it and got us chicken fried steak instead which was excellent. The sausage gravy is flavorful. 
Hash browns-bland, needed salt and pepper. 
Soft scramble-they were good
Wheat toast-came pre buttered and was good 
Peggy gave us excellent customer service to make our meal right. Extra star for Peggy.

I was referred by a friend. Probably the best recommendation I've gotten for Vegas.

The place is awesome. It's all booths. All the staff is constantly moving. 

The food is beyond delicious. I got the biscuits and gravy. The best I've ever had. I couldn't stop eating.  I didn't need to add anything to it. Flavor was perfect. The biscuits were perfectly soft

The staff came back many times even though they were super busy. I will definitely be coming back on this trip and every trip in the future.


The wait wasn't bad, 15 minutes, honestly I'd wait as long as it took. Worth the wait for sure. They have slots and a lounge that you can hang out in until they call you.

Everyone talks about the Peppermill but I've avoided going because I don't really like diner food. My mom and I finally made the trip last night and although the food isn't anything special, the atmosphere and service was pretty awesome. On the outside it looks like a Sizzler. On the inside, it looks like a retro Vegas hotel bar. We decided to get drinks in the bar instead of being seated in the restaurant. As soon as we sat down a regular (I assume) told the bartender he would buy my mom and I drinks. I ordered a martini and the bartender asked everything from what type of vodka I wanted to shaken or stirred to what garnish I preferred. Stoli, shaken, olives. And I got 3 olives at that. We played video poker at the bar while 90s and 2000s music videos played on a TV at the center of the bar. It was relatively quiet on a Tuesday night but everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. The bar only serves appetizers so we ordered the sliders and 10 hot wings. Again our bartender asked us a series of questions about which condiments we wanted with our food. The sliders were standard, but with surprisingly cold patties for how slow it seemed in the restaurant. The chicken wings were better and the sauce was perfectly spicy. I wouldn't consider Peppermill a legitimate dining option but would definitely come back to the bar. It was a lot of fun listening to the waitress' drink orders for their tables. Some of the highlights: White Russian, Colorado Bulldog (White Russian with Coke), and Hawaiian Sunrise. The bartender knew his stuff and wasn't phased by any order coming at him. I'd do this experience again anytime.

A nice throw back to old vegas, with the mirrors neon lights and 'fire pit' tables.  
It's not associated with any casinos and while there are a few slots it's a pretty quiet spot open 24/7

The menu is large and the portions are huge, well worth the walk up the north strip (though maybe not at high noon on a 110 degree day - I almost died)

Get there between 3-6 and have at their insane food and drink specials in the lounge.

Very popular and big servings. We all split our omelets and pancake combo. It had 3 big pancakes, 3 eggs, sausage, and bacon. 
Food was good, service too and splurge on the picture a photographer takes at your table. One comes free and you can buy bigger versions.

This place is a local standard.  Back in the day it was the place where all of the topless dancers and all nighters went at the end of their day.  They have always had a good menu and the food is good as well.  It is no longer a locals place. I took 3 guys here for breakfast the other day and It cost me 60 bucks. I was a little surprised but I guess they have to keep the lights on.  Being on the strip is a big plus for the business but they are no longer the only place open all night  so I guess the locals have found a different hang out.  I will still go here when I am feeling nostalgic but the price will keep me from being a frequent visitor.

Every since I moved to Vegas I have been wanting to try The Peppermill Restaurant. Last night I finally got the chance to experience this place. Some of My friend couldn't make it to my wife's birthday dinner celebration so we decided to get together to make it up. 
I liked that The parking lot is huge, plenty of parking for sure. Once we walked in, it felt like I stepped right into the 1970's. There is a foyer where a hostess is there to seat you. If there is a wait you can always go to the fireside lounge that's located inside Peppermill to the left of the restaurant side. (It's open 24 hours ) unfortunately The place had a stuffy smell it almost smelled like throw up,  that was a very off putting smell to experience before your about to eat. Plus the restroom were very dirty and close to the foyer. 
Our booth  was directly behind the hostess podium on the other side of the glass so we kept getting random whiffs. 

Hiromi was our waitress she was very friendly. And understanding when We took our time  choosing our orders we started with mozzarella sticks. My wife ordered the California Burger, I ordered the BLT&A with curly fries, my friends ordered the Peppermill Burger, Peppermill Pastrami Burger And the Fresh Fruit Salad. 

Service was 100% amazing. the food was so good and generously portioned. My BLT&A was so big & packed with bacon and avocado. I got the mayo on the side but didn't use any, because the sandwich was great just the way it is. 

My three star review is based on the rank smell and dirty restrooms . plus we thought it was weird that we had to wait in line to pay for our meals . it took us even longer because we had to split the check. And to top it off we had drinks added to our check we never ordered. It wasn't an issue but the fact the our waitress had to be called over to verify took us even longer to pay for our meals.

Old school Vegas, 24-7 hours of operation, neon, 80's music blarin, and BTW, this is a diner.  Great breakfast, lunch menu with HUGE portions. Bonus=indoor fire pit and lounge seating in the back bar. LOVE this place. This makes hitting the dreaded Las Vegas strip (tourist trap hell) worth the meandering in. Think the movie "Casino" and you have a true mental image.

I've been to the Peppermill for breakfast and lunch multiple times now, and have enjoyed this casual place with a menu with something for everyone.    The item I've found myself getting repeatedly is their Cobb Salad......which is huge and delicious.

I like the diner type atmosphere as well.   In the past the wait hasn't been too bad, but when we went there for a Sunday lunch around noon the place was packed (45 minute wait?).

I don't give 5stars easily. This place was SO good!! My husband and I shared the fruit fantasia waffle & munch's breakfast. So delicious!! The waffle was covered in fresh fruit and came with a delicious sauce that wasn't too sweet. Munch's was equally as good. Totally recommend this place & worth the wait!!

They delayed our food order for some specious and unconvincing reason. I have a special-needs stepson who did nothing but moan and groan about not getting his food. I will never come back here, ever again.

My only issue with this place is the front hostess. Not customer service friendly. People in front of us put their name in then the girl walked away started talking to another employee who saw us but never said we'll be right with you or even tell the girl she had other people waiting to be seated. She finally came back to the desk, never made eye contact, continued talking with someone else then finally looked up and said very firmly, what's the name, with out even a hint of a smile almost annoyed that she's working here. Other than that, food is good and wait staff is friendly. Peppermill, you need to work on the friendliness and first impression of your front desk help.

hmmmmmm hmmmmmmmmmm
this place is always packed.
so either accept the 30 min wait time or leave!
clean bathroom.
pay-for-internet kiosk..
little tv sized gambling monitors.
nice staff.
open kitchen.
now i wouldnt necessarily call the decor vintage as in 1940s art deco, but yes, it is vintage vegas kitsch.
comfy spacious booths.
good coffee in big mugs (thank god)
& even though its not sugar free.... they have...
COFFEE MATE vanilla creamer!!!
full bar available..
eggs benedict & potatoes around $10
french toast under $10
(yes i ordered both. but i gave my taters to my bf)
i kinda sampled a bit here & there from everyone at our table, & everything was delish.
definitely coming here next vegas trip.
oh, this is at the north end of the strip. 
theres a Ross next door in case you forgot to pack your strapless bra..
we walked from the hilton over here w/o complaining

The Hubs and I went for breakfast this past Saturday morning for breakfast. The wait was about 30 minutes which was just fine for us because it allowed us to go to the bar for a Bloody Mary. The Bloody Mary's were very good and the bar is fun and eclectic.
We were seated in a booth in the middle of the restraunt and that made for some good people watching. Our server was prompt and friendly in taking our order and bringing water. There is a cocktail server walking around taking for your cocktail order. The menu had a lot of choices for breakfast,lunch and dinner. Food was good and atmosphere was fun and swanky. If you like fun and funky I recommend the Peppermill.

Cool atmosphere. The food was pretty good. My Mushroom & Swiss burger was a little greasy. For the price, it could've had more mushrooms. And the mushrooms tasted canned but they were still good. Hubby loved his burger. He got the Pastrami Burger. The onion rings were amazing and the fries were good too. 

The waiter seemed new. Was super friendly, maybe a little tooooo friendly lol but he was okay...

Food wasn't super hot/fresh when we got it, but nothing to really complain about, we were hungry! 
We would go again. 

You'll spend at least $11-$13/meal

Food: average. Service: slow. I don't understand the hype. I came on a Thursday around 5. It wasn't very full, but it took a while for the waiter to get to me and take my order. It took a while for the cocktail waitress to take my order. The salad tasted generic, the bread was good, the beer was cold. I ordered a medium ribeye, but it came half medium well and half well done, even dry. The potatoes and veggies were average. Even with all the waitresses walking past me and looking at my table, none of them got my empty plates or refilled my water. It took a while for them to cash me out because the machine kept malfunctioning. The couple ahead of me gave a $5 tip for a $60 meal. While I never give less than 15% unless services are terrible, I don't blame them for that low tip. It was really poor service.

Miniskirts and objectification are never out of style in Vegas.  Hooray!

One of our cabbies mentioned something like "Yeah.  Forget about eating on the strip anywhere other than Peppermill.  Everyone local eats there."

It's marginally better than the $15 slop you get in most of the dives on the strip and well worth the trip.

Open 24/7 like everything else, so feel free to drop in shitfaced.

An experience for sure! The portions are huge, the food is delicious, the drinks are strong, the scene and design are something to see. This is where both the "Average Joe" and the "Hollywood Celebrity" eat and are satisfied with all of the above mentioned.

We first came here ten years ago.  We haven't been in Las Vegas since then.   This is the only restaurant that we actually remembered.   That is how memorable the experience was.

The restaurant is conveniently located in Las Vegas Blvd.   There is plenty of parking that is free.

The restaurant is decorated in retro style.   It is surprisingly clean, although the carpet definitely could use updating.  I dogged the faux trees and flowers.

The food was very good.   My kids had a waffle, that was loaded with fresh fruit and delicious, and my eldest one had a tasty burger.   We were pretty disappointed with the $13 shrimp cocktail that had 5 shrimp.   That is over $2 a shrimp, probably the most expensive shrimp I had ever had.  I that is why I took one star off.

This is the place where i always take friends and family when they come to visit...and it WOW's them every time. Good food, great atmosphere, totally cool firepit bar. No other place like it in Vegas.

This restaurant is mostly for tourists but I still like to come here and battle the crowds since the food is really good. I like the atmosphere here and food is made pretty quickly. As a local it is one of the better restaurants around.

I came twice first service was horrible three ppl came to take my drink order which I didn't receive for an hr ppl being sat after me where getting there food first...just craziness when I first walked up to the hostess she yawn rite in my face eww...so later that day my sister wanted there crab cakes so we went back and a "MANAGER" named JOANNE came to tell me to cover myself because I was wearing a bathing suit and before I can be seated she ask three more times until I said give me a minute to sat down my belongings... As I was telling the hostess about my horrible service that morning she goes to tell me because I wasn't getting dressed fast enough and was complaining about the horrible service she refused us and didn't want to serve us...so I was being punished for there horrible service smh I'll never go back...My husband is part owner of the drais club and we'll be telling anyone who listens to never go there

I love this place. If you are visiting Vegas or a local this is a must. The environment is trendy and fun. Portions are huge so be prepare to share or take some left overs home. They also have this really cool fire-pit bar area where you can chill have drinks and appetizers while sitting in front of a water fire place. Another favorite thing about this place is their colorful sugar! So cute.

American Breakfast Rules!
Hint: split a biscuits and gravy since it comes with a half dozen biscuits and a cup or two of gravy
Crab Eggs Benedict was phenomenal
and so was my regular eggs over medium with breakfast sausage. We also split a side of bacon to make sure we could not be revived after our heart attacks. JK'
Be ready to wait an hour during peak times. If you don't have the patience go somewhere else. 
Watching all the lushes suck down morning booze was also entertaining.

Stopped here for breakfast before my bf & I drove back home.
I'd never heard of this place before, and never really seen it before even though it's so close to the Strip. My bf said he's been coming to this place for years so I guess for those that know about it, it's a legend. 

Why would anyone bother going to Denny's when you can go to the Peppermill?! 
Food was super fresh, I had a veggie omelette that was gigantic and perfectly fluffy. It seriously had to have been made with at least four or five eggs. Sadly I couldn't finish it, especially since it also came with toast and I got fruit instead of potatoes. Mind you, this was good fruit, not just some grapes and a slice of melon. It was more like a mini fruit salad along with all the other food! 

I must say, I have a special place in my heart for the kind of gaudy decor (fake plants and pink flamingo lamps) that awaits you at The Peppermill. The waitresses all wear cute little outfits and are super friendly, seemed like they've probably worked here since it opened.
Apparently there's also a nice fire pit in the other room, which I didn't get a chance to see. It's open 24-hours too so, of course, I am a fan. Can't wait to come back next time I'm in town and I'd love to see what they have for dinner...

I have been coming here for years. And this place has made me very upset. Apparently this place will cater to pimps, and hoes. And drunks waking in at 3am. But when you, a normal human being trip and fall one time this place won't want you back. Better not waste your time if your sober and fall. This is a terrible place to come. Don't spend your money. Find a better coffee shop to go to. This place has lost my business forever. And if they treat everyone like crap, I hope you all won't go back.

I'm averaging out my scores between service and everything else.

I have to say the food was good - I ordered a pulled pork sandwich with potato salad as the side.  The drinks were good as well and, although the one I ordered had no price listed, I found it reasonable.

The atmosphere was fun - lots of bright lights and funky uniforms for the servers.  With everything stated above, I could give the Peppermill 4 stars, HOWEVER....

The server took FOREVER!!!  We were there for dinner and, although seated immediately, were there for nearly two hours.  The server grabbed a box for me to take the remainder of my food home in, but didn't think to grab the check at the same time?  After that it took forever to flag her down... and even after she picked up the check it took her ages to swipe the credit card.

Although I enjoyed the food, the service absolutely killed it for me.  It was busy there, but by no means THAT busy.

This place is really cute and cozy. It is outside of the hotels and totally worth trying. The portions are pretty big so prepare to eat. The food is pretty good and the staff is friendly. We come here every time we visit Vegas.

The Peppermill is awesome! So my family came here last night in celebration of my mothers birthday. We asked her to choose any place she wanted to go eat for brunch and this is what she wanted. No five star fine dining steak house as we normally do this year. She wanted something much more casual and breakfast lol. What better place than the Peppermill. I was a bit caught off guard because I haven't been to this place in YEARS! I forgot how good it was. When we arrived it wasn't even busy and we were able to be seated immediately! The hostess was very friendly and helped us find a big enough table for 6 including a chair to sit my baby niece in. I also forgot how cool the ambiance of the place was with the neon lights and old school diner style tables. The outfits of the employee's are so cute it's so funny to see them walking around especially the cocktail or beverage girls. Not quite sure what they are called officially but either way it's cute! 

Like many have already raved about.. HUGE PORTIONS! I checked the pictures on Yelp prior to arrival and I had my taste buds fixed on one of these crazy big omelette's. It was more so in the evening dinner kind of time and I thought it was funny that my family all was in the mood for breakfast food. Except my nephew (teenager) just had to be different and get a sandwhich lol. Anyways let's get to this food! Yum! Since this was a family affair nobody ordered anything off the cocktail menu, and yes I know me of all people stayed sober and stuck with my water haha! Oh but believe me when I say I will return and take advantage of their daily happy hour! The drinks here look so fun and colorful. 

Entree's

Mediterranean Omelette w/ bagel and cream cheese

Marco Polo Omelette w/ blueberry muffin

Veggie Omelette w/ Lemon Cranberry muffin

Country Fried Steak w/ mashed potatoes and veggies

Conquest Sandwhich

Conclusion from the entire family was we all enjoyed ourselves to the max!

We didn't really eat dinner. After running an errand super early in the morning, we all decided to grab breakfast. We arrived on Friday, May 12th around 5:45pm. My party of five was seated right away.

*Bacon and Eggs: three farm fresh eggs (scrambled hard) served with four slices of bacon, hash browns and your choice of toast ($12.75) ×2
*Eggs Benedict: 3 poached eggs (poached medium) on grilled Canadian bacon and toasted English muffin, topped with hollandaise sauce, served with hash browns ($14.25)
*Joe's San Francisco Special: traditional classic of scrambled eggs with spinach, pork sausage, ground beef and onion, seasoned and served on crispy hash browns and smothered in a golden cheese sauce, served with wheat toast ($13.95)
*Maserati Omelet: a superb omelet bursting with sausage, jack and cheddar cheeses and mushrooms, smothered in a perfect italian meat sauce, sprinkled with parmesan cheese, served with hash browns and your choice of toast ($13.95)
*Side of Bacon: 5 pieces ($5.50)
*Coffee ($3.50) ×4
*Pepsi ($3.50)

I got the Joe's special. I always order this when I go out to breakfast, so it was nice having a Vegas twist on it. I liked the addition of the cheese sauce. I don't always like potatoes, so I kinda wished they didn't put the whole scramble on top of the hash browns. I was able to eat around it though. I tried my friends maserati omelet. I adore meat sauce, so I enjoyed this twist on an omelet. Tasted like spaghetti bolognese in breakfast form. I also got a side of bacon cuz I adore bacon. A good size as it came with five pieces.

I didn't know this until a friend told us, but apparently this diner has been featured in quite a few films, etc. I thought it was a cool little bit of trivia. I didn't recognize it, but one of the more prominent films mentioned was Casino.

Good place to go if you're super hungry as their breakfast portions are huge. I could only finish a quarter of my plate. They have a nice varied menu, so there's something for everyone. I heard there's a fireside lounge area of Peppermill as well. I'd love to come back and check that out.
Great food. Not too expensive. The best chicken parmesan I've ever had. Unusual lighting technique inside.

The place smells, also I went on my birthday and heard the manager talking to a guest about how his birthday was the day before and the manager gave them a free alcoholic drink. Cool until I showed her my I'd and said it was my bday on this day  n she didn't offer me anything!!  I felt so stupid!!!!! Whatever!! Will never go back here again!!  Alcohol Drinks tasted watered down! Terrible device!!
Very good food and huge portions-good for sharing. When we r in Vegas we always make a point to stop here. Come here when u are very hungry : )) Purple Rain colors inside decor...fun fun
Good classic old school diner.. nice big portions and the food was fresh. The restaurant had a nice style to it not to busy for being in Vegas on a Saturday morning.

Its a Vegas landmark. Everyone in the nightlife industry comes here after work, 5/6am for breakfast.
HUGE portions, but rather pricy for locals. But its a retro diner type, it has an intertesting decor andthe food is ok. 
Service is a little slow at times.

Come around 2/3 am and its full of drunken tourists :)
This place is no better then a Denny's and they charge twice as much. Food wasn't good at all.

Huge portions await you! Sadly for you but yummy deliciousness for me this was my second visit and second time devouring as much of the Country Fried Steak and Eggs as my belly would hold! The hand breaded steak topped with homemade sausage gravy truly makes you want to slap your mamma. Who would think a diner in Vegas could perfect the ultimate southern dish? This is served with 3 eggs, toast and hash browns for just $15.25 but be hungry, very hungry!!!!!!

The interior is so welcoming with bright neons yet trees, flowers and greenery throughout. The service both times has been excellent. Each time we had a 15 minute wait so be prepared and they did seat us in less which is a complement to a well run restaurant. Nothing is worse than a "hangry" guest being told 15 and it being 30!!!! That doesn't happen here... The menu is extensive and they are open 24 hours so take time from the casino and enjoy a great meal here.

VEGAS HEAVEN. The most giant nachos I've ever seen in my life. I wish I had known about this place much, much sooner. They also serve CoronaRitas because THEY CLASSY.

Servers are super nice to all the drunks (like me) and they have the patience of saints. I can't wait to stumble back in there in a state of total inebriation and starvation. Open 24 hours, of course. 

Love the Peppermill!

This place has lots of character and some killer deserts. 
the food is a little better than Denny's but nothing amazing. But really you go here for the experience of old Vegas. Mirrors on the ceilings and trees inside whats not to love

I've been here a half a dozen times over the years. Every visit was a pleasure.

The god is good and the drinks are excellent. You'll love the ambiance in the bar. It's the perfect place to take a date.

Our new favorite place in Vegas! Vintage Vegas ambiance, delicious food (huge portions), crazy 70s interior decor. And next door at the Fireside Lounge there's a liquid fire pit and either music videos or sports on dozens of TVs all around. Bonus trivia: Joe Pesci stabbed that dude in the neck with a pen here in "Casino".

This place was great. The staff was so nice. A photographer was there that took our photos and printed them out for us. The food was absolutely delicious and the portions were VERY generous. We didn't finish our meal but as soon as we got back to our hotel, we scarfed it down. The decor and atmosphere was very soothing with the blue tones and the seating is very comfortable because every seat is booth style. Open 24 hours and a great place to dine in LV.

This place. I had heard about it being a staple in the Vegas community when I lived here last year, and I'm glad I got to try it! The food was incredible and GREAT portions for the price. The decor is perfectly Vegas. The lounge was beautiful! The place was packed but I called ahead for.my Party of 14 and we were seated 20 minutes after arrival.

Our table's favorite dish next to the giant pancakes was the Sin City BLT that came with an overeasy egg and pesto sauce. Please try this place on your next trip!
The breakfast here is a definite must! The portions are huge! The 3 pancake breakfast was enormous and soooo delicious!!
Nice place to head after dinner or a night out. Music sometimes a little too loud, but decor is vintage and cool!

If you want a quick place to eat and not walk through an entire hotel this is a spot that you may like, i.e. Dennys quality.  Some gal on my SWA flight recommended this place for its steak. I should have put my headphones on and toned her ass out.

Everything looked OK, quick service, huge portions THEN A GIANT ROACH heading for our feet underneath the table.  Thank God my husband saw its huge antenas and he stomped it out.  No joke, the busboy paused to watch him do it and just kept walking on.  I am terrified of bugs, but this roach was a healthy sci fi thriller type roach who ate a whole rib eye in the back before coming out to the main floor for seconds.

Pay the extra $10 and go to Outback down the street!
Always enjoy my visits to Vegas with a stop at Peppermill. Food is always good and plentiful and service has always been good. We love the breakfast here.
It's cool if you want to eat breakfast in a place that looks like a strip joint. The food is pretty but not a place I would go out of my way for.

Not the experience we read about. Sat night at 7:00  there was no wait to the place was not nearly as busy as expected which would have been good but were in Vegas and expecting to sit fireside which we never even saw the fire. We order our food and 20 mins later are told the meal my husband ordered was sold out. A cocktail waitress which inconveniently is the only person you can order drinks from never came back with our drinks and when all was said and done they still charged us for my husbands meal that's was sold out and made us moss our Uber because they had to correct it and take the charge off. The menu is really not as impressive as most reviews say on top of that the prices are outrages for excessive food you don't need to take out on the town with you.

If you're staying in Vegas, or live here and are out on the town, forget everything you think you know about late night/early morning drunk breakfast. IHOP - haha, forget about it. Denny's - gross. Peppermill Lounge - perfect. When you walk in the lighting and decorations will make you happy, it's like an 80's night club with trees. Every member of the staff was friendly and patient. The food was perfect for the moment, yummy stuff. I got the Joes San Fran Special, which was filling and delicious. The prices are just right and the timing of the whole meal was on point. This should be the after after party spot for all club goers! Trust me , read my other reviews, I'm legit. ;) . Done

If you like neon lights, fake tropical plans, bright velour cushion sofas, a fireplace coming out of water and some damn strong and excellent frozen mudslides (this is coming from a guy who would rather drink bourbon!), THIS is your place to go, especially at 7:30 a.m. If not, go for the breakfast.  =)

Service kind of lags in the lounge in the morning, but the restaurant is jumping already with lots of patrons who've been gambling, going to strip clubs, doing what people do in Vegas.  In the late evening, the lounge is crowded and service is much better.

We went because of the high recommendations. I wish we would have walked out as soon as we saw the tacky decor. Each meal is large enough to feed an entire family if that family wants a low quality meal. They definitively stress quantity over quality.  I suggest passing on this one.

Came to Vegas to celebrate my brothers' birthday.  I was told you can't come to town and not come to the Peppermill.  This spot was everything and more!!! The drinks and food were beyond AMAZING !! The portions are out of control!! You better come hungry....but you will STILL take home a doggie bag!! We had mimosas and breakfast. Service was outstanding from the bar area to the dining  area. A must visit spot when in Vegas!! I will definitely be back!!!
Great place to grab food 24/7 when you are hungry for more then fast food  when in Vegas!!

Classic diner... Just more expensive. Food was just meh. The Fireside Lounge was nice, but they didn't serve full menu on that side so we went into the diner side. I would go back just because it is The Peppermill or for the Fireside Lounge part, but it isn't a place I would write home about. Service was definitely lacking. Our server was very strange and his mind was obviously not on work. Kind of felt bad for the guy.
