They had a TON of fake flowers all over the place. Even fake trees in the center. I really am not a fan of all that fake flower crap, the colors are usually off of real stuff. The fake stuff gets SO darned dusty, too, and that's just plain gross especially in a restaurant environment. The one fake ivy thing by me didn't feel dusty, but we were still thankful we weren't stuck under one of the trees.
They have a cocktail waitress, which kind of reminds you of old style Vegas. The cocktail we were handed didn't list Amy beer at all, so I had to wait for her to come to our table to find out what they had. 1 draft option, Stella, so I ordered it. Alas, they were out. So I ordered a bottles beer. Wouldn't it be the cocktail waitresses job to know that there's no Stella tonight?

Anyway...
The menu was what you'd expect in a diner, lots of choices and many fried.. And it was about the quality that you'd expect - we had cream cheese stuffed chicken with penne pasta and country fried steak with mashed potatoes. My hubby said the mashed potatoes were average and enjoyed the country fried steak. My cream cheese/herb stuffed chicken was fried and not too bad. LOADS of pasta, way more than one portion.

We also had dessert - a brownie Sunday for the hubs and strawberry shortcake for me. I asked for some fudge to be added to it and they accommodated (it's super yummy that way).

Awesome! Ambiance is great, decor is very vegas/casino...Bloody Mary's were ok, but eggs Benedict were great!! Their hash browns were so good. And they have a free photographer walking around to the tables...definitely recommend
Worth the wait to eat massive portions of consistently delicious food. My favorite omelet is the Maserati.

Wanted to try this place out because the pictures looked super cute. Came here after dinner specifically for dessert but they had some really yummy looking drinks that I wanted to try (maybe next time). The ambience was really nice they had a cute theme going on. I expected a fire pit because of the pictures but I guess that was the lounge which we didn't go to because they said they didn't have the full menu. Anyway, from the pictures, the banana split looked fantastic so I ordered that and my friend ordered the strawberry shortcake. When our food came we were in shock because they were massive! I mean I've never seen a banana split that big before. I guess I just wasn't expecting it. The waitress said it was big enough to share but dang it could feed a couple of people. Presentation wasn't too good. Couldn't even see the ice cream because of all the whipped cream but there was 2 scoops of ice cream for each flavor and you had to dig around for the banana. The strawberry shortcake was okay, not my cup of tea really. My banana split turned to soup because we couldn't finish it. Looking at the other tables all the plates were huge. All in all, it was a good experience. My tip would be to come here if you're really hungry. Will come back to try the rest of the food (to share ofcourse!)

PS. they gave a free souvenir photo of your table which I thought was really cute

Went around 10am on a Friday and the place was packed, wait was 30-45 minutes.  We went to the lounge and sat by the fire pit,  waitress came almost immediately for our drink order.  Me and my husband both order fruity drinks which were large and very good.  The lounge is nice to sit and take in the views of the all the neon lights and watch old rock videos that they play on the tvs.  When we went to get a second round we could not find a waitress.  When we got our table, service went quick.  I got Joes San Francisco special which is enough for 2 people and very good.  Husband got French toast ambrosia which was good and also a large portion.  Coffee was also good.

I want to start by saying the food is great and they give you alot!! My husband ordered a pastrami burger. We had a sampler for appetizer.  I had a gyro. Our 2 kids had chicken fingers.  Well the wait was long. There was. A "professional photographer " that wanted to take a pic of us so we did and she told us she be right back. We sat there for a lonnng time. She never came. Then our waitress bring 3 out of 4 orders and tells me she is gonna be right back. She took 7 minutes ( she was cleaning tables and what not) to finally bring my husbands food. Then took forever to get our bill. Finally get the bill and she charged us for 2 adult chicken fingers. We didnt want adult. Lady at counter claims waitress was new. But good side was great food. I ordered gyro and it came with 2 with lots of fries.
Vegas kitsch with great diner food!

My FAVORITE bar in Vegas! I insist on coming here EVERY time I come to Sin City for at least one Scorpion (always on the rocks) to help kick the party into high gear. 

Solid food here too!
Old school, big portions, ask for fresh jalepenos and if you want to see locals other than the staff, go in the middle of the night.

I have been to the Peppermill a few times but never eaten here. Normally I go with friends and watch them drink while I have tea or soft drink in the fireside area. Which is a great place for a couple (you will be pleasantly surprised I Promise). We were there to eat and eat we did. The waitress was nice and looked 16 which I kidded her about but she was a good sport and a very good server. I found it to be a good time and I loved the pastrami sandwich (so lean) just writing this review makes me want to go back. I have not had a good pastrami sandwich in a while. The servings were healthy and everything was quite good. I will be going back. Who wants to come?

Great food any time of the day!
love this spot
:)

YES YES YES!

If you're in Vegas and you don't go to Peppermill, shame on you. And your momma. I am THAT serious. I was in the hunt for a brunch type restaurant that serves good bloody marys and Peppermill did not disappoint. This review is for the Fireside Lounge.

Ambience: 
As other reviewers have mentioned, the pink and blue neon lights give it a divey, strip club-esque vibe which I totally loved. There's a firepit in the center of the lounge area, complete with comfy seating and overhead TVs. There are several other TVs throughout the lounge. It's quiet, yet not awkward, perfect for the invariable hangover headache. Another plus: they're open 24 hours, so you *really* have no excuse.

Staff: 
The bartender was great, I wish I could remember her name. Very friendly, sincere and prompt. 

Food: 
The Fireside Lounge only offers food from the appetizer menu. I ordered the shrimp cocktail ($12.95) and a bloody mary (~$7). The bloody mary was definitely tasty, came garnished with a cherry tomato, a cucumber slice and a celery stick. I asked for olives and the bartender obliged. The shrimp cocktail came with 6 large jumbo shrimp, cocktail sauce, and what appeared to be shredded cabbage buried beneath the cocktail sauce. While the shrimp tasted great, they were a bit chewy/tough and may have been frozen a little too long. Also, I don't know that I would pay $13 for shrimp cocktail again.

All in all, the Fireside Lounge was the start to a perfect Vegas morning (if 1:15PM counts as morning when you're hungover).

I do not know how this place has such good reviews on yelp except for the fact that I think a lot of people come here drunk at 5:00AM for a huge greasy breakfast, and when you are drunk, leaving the club, things taste a lot different.
I have been here twice, once for breakfast and once for lunch. Both times where exactly the same experience. 
The service was good, servers are attentive, food comes out quickly.
Thats where it goes all bad.......
The food is terrible. Greasy diner food that is equivalent to IHOP or Dennys.
I will say that the portions are huge. They give you a lot of food..... a lot of really really bad food!!!!!

This place is so good. The portions are so huge, especially the pancakes and ham. I have always had good service and food. I have never had to return my plate for any reason. They have been consistently good. The bloody mary's are so good, one of the best in Vegas.

So we arrived on friday night and we were wanting to eat and we weren't wanting a all you can eat place. So I looked on yelp and read your reviews and I figured yes we will eat here. Turned out it was close by and we walked over from the Hilton Resort. Turned out this place is like a Denny's but with tripple the price tag and the portions larger. We all ordered breakfast and I would say we all enjoyed our breakfast. The place had a few roudy people but it was a good place to hang-out. The only thing that I would recommend is to be able to move the table out a little because I felt I was in a tight booth.  

As we left the place I wanted to check out the pool of fire but that was in another section and it was cozy in there but there was way too much smoke in there.  maybe next time were in the hood we'll check out the lounge area and hang.

The food wasn't great but not bad either it reminded me of a Denny's. The staff was friendly but kind of ignored us for their regulars which it seemed like there were quite a few. It's a bit expensive but then again what isn't on the strip.
Good value for the being on the strip. Plenty of food for the money. A classic Vegas go too.

Tried this place for the first time the other day and let me just say, BEST DECISION EVER. I had the chicken and red pepper pasta, my boyfriend got the Maserati Omelette with hash browns and we ordered a side of fries with ranch. You ofcourse can't forget the drinks!! Blue Hawaiian was like a bay breeze and he got a beer which I can't remember the name. DEFINATELY GOING BACK SOON!!!

This is one of the oldest places on the strip but it doesn't look like it inside. Well, I mean, it's stuck in the 70's but it doesn't feel rundown at all. It's old Las Vegas. 

We hit the lounge and got some tiki drinks and it was totally bad ass. You need to check this place out if you want to say you went to Las Vegas.

Portion size would get 5 stars as they were huge. So if that's what you like, you'll be very happy here. We could easily have shared what we got. But flavor-wise, nothing was outstanding. We were there for breakfast and each had omelettes. Nothing stood out about them except the size. if you're hungry and you need somewhere to go that's open very early, this place will do (it's open 24 hours). It has the atmosphere of a 70s lounge, and you definitely know you're in Vegas (where else does a cocktail waitress come to take a bar order at 7 AM?). A little strange at that hour when you're ready for a trade show.

Everyone's eyes lit up when the food hit the table. Every plate was great. Drinks before in the lounge. Remember to take your hat off before entering lounge. The decor is right up there with the Madonna Inn.
We came to have drinks and happy hour.  The service is slow but the food is good.  Its smaller than i remember.   We got a new server .

I still love this place, and will continue to bring visiting guests here, but this particular visit was less than stellar.  

We came at 1:00...my first time for lunch, and they were packed.  We had to be put on a waiting list, but it only took about 5 minutes to seat us. However, after being seated, it took them at least 10 minutes to even come ask for our drinks...well, non-alcoholic...the cocktail waitress was right there. Gotta love Vegas. 

Anyway, I ordered the Conquest (no onions of course) at the waitresses' suggestion and it was just mediocre. The roast beef was bland and the sandwich needed more sauce. The bread was good though. Fries were ok, but a little greasy.  The ice tea was good. 

Next time I will just go with my own choice. LOL!
Delicious food, generous (!!!) portions, I got the burger my friend got the French Toast and we were both super happy! Decor is hilarious like an 80s porno.

Peppermill, how I wish there was one of you here in San Francisco after a drunken night. Thats ok, it's just one more thing I can look forward to when visiting Las Vegas. I love everything about Peppermill. The decor transports me to a magical tacky fairy forest. Perfect when you are drunk and looking for good eats. The waitresses are decked out in equally tacky but booty gazing outfits. Love it. They have plenty of personality too and you have to if you are wearing that fit. The food portions are huge so dont order multiple plates. If you are going with your significant other give the fireside lounge a try. Its really romantic sitting next to the fire with neon lights all around you sipping on a huge and delicious drink. They are open 24/7 so even if your late night turns into an early morning which tends to happen in Vegas stop in. Its not too far from all the major hotels and all the taxi drivers know whats up.

Good food if you're very hungry. Portions are huge. The ambience and decor are old and reminded me of an 80s movie. Nothing exceptional to brag about but does but the spot if you're looking a good quick bite.

What a cool place. Worked dropped me in Las Vegas and a co worker of mine wanted to get a quick dinner near his hotel. The Peppermill was across the street and I was game. 

I have stayed at the Peppermill Resort in Reno and there used to be a Peppermill Restaurant in San Jose, CA. that I visited that all share the same look at this joint. I do not know whether they are related . Anyways this place is like stepping into a time warp. It has an old feel and neon as far as the eye can see (my photos have a pinkish hue). We sat in the bar area of the restaurant called the Fireside Lounge. 

The drinks are cheap, the vibe is laid back and the nacho appetizer is a mountain of deliciousness. I dare you to finish it. The corn chips are layered with cheese, jalapeño, tomato, onion and black olive and came with a plate of ground beef and a plate of refried beans mixed with a nacho cheese. It is not fine dining but it is the perfect copilot for beer.

Between the vibe, beer and nachos I was one happy cat !!

Fantastic food, Super service, terrific atmosphere. I had the pineapple express burger with curly fries and I was not let down. The fruit salad was HUGE and presented very well all the fruit was perfectly ripe. 
This will be my go to place for a good dinner.

Rev up for some retro of Classic Vegas! The ambiance at the Peppermill is unique with the neon, indoor artificial trees, and high-def TVs. I love the banks of TVs (only time I will ever say this).  The entrancing scenes are filmed all over the world. By the end of your meal, you have viewed beautiful footage from Alaska, China, New Zealand, Japan, Italy, Hawaii, and Paris. The wait staff is friendly and there is usually a photographer willing to help you capture a special dinner with out-of-town guests. I'm a local,and this is a great place to meet up with people. The food is good with generous portions and well-presented for the diner set-up. This come-as-you-are establishment won't break your budget either.  Don't eat too much of your ten-egg omelet or delish reuben, or there will be not room for a specialty frou-frou drink at the cozy Fireside Lounge. Their drink menu offers concoctions of every color of the rainbow.
The Peppermill can get crazy-busy and they are a little stingy with their colorful napkins. 
Overall, a fun, unique place. Hope you're hungry!
Hehe! One of the best late night eats on my every 'business trip' to Vegas!! ;) awesome cocktails n great food!

. The best part of this restaurant was the ambience. When we walked up there was such a long line I swore it would be over an hr wait, however they seem to work very proficiently! Hasbrowns were gross, they tasted like cardboard. I ordered the tostada omelet, the meat inside tasted like chili.i was not a fan. Others in my party ordered a burgers which they said were good.

The scenery is peerless, neon-laced '70s kitsch. My enormo tomato-hollandaise chicken omelet didn't live up to its promise and the hash-browns were strangely subpar. Coffee: decent. Our waitress was stoned and the prices were a bit high too. Still, the convenience- (nice to be able to park right next to a decent eats on the strip) and cheese-factor make this a Vegas must.

The portions at this place are huge, no seriously, HUGE. I suggest sharing one entree with someone else, you'll definitely have more then enough food.

My coworker and I came here after working a trade show since it's super close and easy to get to from the convention center. I ordered the focaccia chicken sandwich along with curly fries. My only complaint was that the bread was a bit dry but the chicken was cooked perfectly and the curly fries were greet too. The ranch was sub par, but I'm somewhat of a ranch snob. 

The service was a little bit slow but eh it's on the strip technically so what do you expect. Overall the food is good and the old school Vegas feel is somewhat endearing as well. I'll for sure have to come back sometime for breakfast. Viva Las Vegas!
I always make it a point to eat at the Peppermill when I come to Vegas. You get great portions for the price and its always delicious!

I had an 6 AM flight out of Vegas and my hotel had no early morning options for food. I went here and I grabbed a counter seat. Service was slow, but that was fine because I wanted to see how big the portions were before ordering. Ordered eggs, bacon, home fries and coffee. No complaints on food or size of portions served. Next time I am back in city I would like to try something from the non breakfast portion of the menu rather than a bland buffet.
Food was amazing! Well worth the wait and the portions were generous. Hopefully it doesn't take me 12 more years to return!

Now, this is a true Las Vegas gem! I would try and describe the 70's throw-back swingers club vibe this place has to offer, but you'd truly have to see it for yourself. 

Great drinks, comfy lounge seating, music videos on the tvs, beautiful cocktail waitresses in long black gowns, fire pits, super-sized drinks, good bar food, and a truly unique atmosphere all combine to make this place one of my favorite bars in vegas. 

If you are visiting, you got to check it out. If you're local, you already know. :)

pretty decent for brunch, had the maserati omelet, not bad.  
$10-14 most plates, BIG shareable portions...

My wife and l don't get to vegas often. We ventured in and the interior and music playing is straight out the eighties. The eighties is my decade and i was hearing songs I've haven't in ages. The food was great the blueberry muffins that came with the munich omelette was hot and great. The portions were enough for 2 or 3 people. The wait staff was friendly and attentive. Eating at the peppermill was a great start to day

This is the cherry on top of all-night escapades in Vegas. Ginormous portions. Neon blue & pink lights. Faux cherry blossom trees. What's not to love?

I dug this place so much, I ate here twice. The vodka in my system always craves breakfast. So that's what I ordered. Big ass omelets. The largest omelets you can feast your eyeballs on. Ditto on the cobb salads. And most likely everything else on the menu for that matter. 

Know what that means? Extras for tomorrow! Scoreeee.

It was a great place for breakfast I was turned on couple years about this place every time I come to Vegas I have breakfast here so please try it it's out of this world the corn beef hash is the killer enjoy stop and see the girls are beautiful
Interesting decor.  Fireside lounge is cool concept. Huge portion of food, sliders was good but the chips were terrible

I've been coming here since the first time I ever visited Vegas. The vibe is mellow and cool. After a night of dancing, drinking, and walking the fire pits are great to relax by. The food hits the spot! We ordered standard breakfast (eggs, bacon, hash browns) and the Peppermill Burger. They did not disappoint. The service is always great. The owner/manager is so nice. This is a must-do whenever you're in Vegas!

So, have you ever been so hungry you needed two onions worth of onion rings? How about a salad the size of your head? Or for the finale, pancakes that hang off all edges of your plate? 

Peppermill is definitely for the Adam Richman (Man Vs. Food host) in all of us. One would think with quantity, quality suffers but Peppermill definitely proves that adage wrong. Me and my sis always order pancakes, bacon, and the fruit&granola bowl: all are fantastic. The fruit&granola bowl is about the size of 2 banana splits. Pancakes are HUGE, over 12" in diameter (at least) with a fluffy sweetness to them that beg for just a tiny amount of syrup when you dress them with the AWESOME "stripper" sugar sprinkles.

I definitely love this place. The blue neon and comfortable seating and long raised walkways turned into foliage.........somehow makes me believe Peppermill used to be a strip club in a former life.......but who knows ;-). 

Service is great here: quick, friendly, and very personable. It's reassuring to know that in a city built on transient party goers, at a place centered on the strip, people still remember your name.

Give this place a try.

This is an "Old Faithful"of Vegas that has stood the test of time. Menu is massive. Breakfast & sandwiches are their strong suit, Yummy & huge. Omelettes & pancakes are very good. I think they use a whole carton of eggs for an omelette, not kidding. There is a seperate bar (to the left of entry)that is quite unique..it has a circular sunken area that faces a crystal fire pit. There are also several tvs ,in case you dont find the array of characters (fellow patrons)entertaining. Their cocktail menu (extensive-frozen drinks,etc)& bar food menu is pretty good,  something for everyone, as well as virgin cocktails too.. This is a place to people watch as it is open 24 hours & anyone who knows Vegas, knows the Peppermill. Very good diner food for all ages.  Depending on time of day or night, there may be entertaining drunken party stragglers trying to sober up with a meal. It is a good size restaurant however, maintaining order & comfort for their patrons. Spend the extra $ & skip IHop & come here. You wont be disappointed.
Great atmosphere, large amount of good food, friendly staff, and multi-games at the bar!

I've eaten here a few times as it is a Vegas Staple...but the food and service are always "meh".  It isn't horrible, but isn't really good either.  Basically  Denny's with a really good interior designer.  The drinks at the Fireside lounge aren't bad, but a bit overpriced.

As always, it's all Vegas! As a local we enjoy it for breakfast anytime the strip isn't busy. Fantastic breakfast with huge portions.  Always crowded but their great service gets you in and out quickly without feeling rushed. Great menu choices.  I'm sure with the taste and quality of breakfast, their lunch and dinners are great too.

24Hr diner with decor of a strip club. It is however, a good place to stop if you're looking for a decent meal at late hours. 

The service is quite fast and there is quite a few options to choose from. At 3AM I opted for a cup of coffee and "Joe's San Francisco Special." Basically, thats a few eggs, spinach, onions, ground beef & sausage, and topped with cheese sauce. Originally it includes hash browns mixed in there but I asked for them to set that aside since I wasn't so sure I wanted to eat them. You do get an option of toast but I chose to try their warm blueberry muffin! I'm so glad I went with that because it was the best part of the entire meal.  

The prices for breakfast are along the lines as a typical diner such as Norms or Denny's but their plates are much much larger here. Honestly, if you were to split a plate with someone, I think you would be better off. 

The coffee was watered down but then again if they're making so much of it, I can imagine this is not their main concern.

Good place to get a bite to eat if you're not in the mood to be picky. I can see how this place gets crowded after-hours as the "meet up spot."

One of my absolute favorite places. It's old Vegas. It's fun, bright and cheery. The wait is usually long, but that's to be expected and not a deal breaker for me. We usually go for breakfast. The pancakes are to die for!

Have eaten for over 20 years, and enjoyed it everytime. Breakfast or lunch, weekdays or weekends, its great! I visit Vegas 5+ times a year and have to stop each and everytime. Jennifer Martin, our waitress is always professional and fun. She has a great laugh and smile. Ask for her if you can, you wont be dissappointed.

***Disclaimer*** Their portions are HUGE!!! Beware! 

LOL!

We were there for dinner: 

We had the Peppermill Breakfast... 3 eggs, bacon and sausage with 3 pancakes. Sooooo good! Couldn't finish the pancakes are about 1 only lol 

Hubby has a burger with onion rings... He loved it!

Everything was GREAT!
--------------------------------------------------------

Following day (morning) we both ordered breakfast: 

I ordered the French toast combo with 3 eggs, sausage and bacon with aside of hash browns. Loved it!!! The French toast was fluffy and not too eggy. Perfect! 

Hubby ordered the Peppermill Breakfast and same thing too much food. He was only able to eat 2 pancakes. Eggs were cooked perfect for him, he likes his eggs over hard and everywhere else he orders them like that he gets them with the yolk still runny. Not here, they cooked them well and perfect. 

This is our spot every time we are out here in Vegas! And will continue to be forever! 

The servers are very attentive every time we visit! That right there deserves 5 stars.

one of my favorite places to go...perfect to take someone from tinder when u want to make out with them while they are eating mozzarella sticks lol but no really i always have a good time here and its so relaxed.

First time here and will be coming back for sure. The portions are HUGE and staff is very attentive and friendly. The ambiance is very intimately-casual? it's cool to have TREES and lights while dining - there are even complimentary photos! (not sure if this is a daily thing or just on Friday when we went at like 3am)

I got the Peppermill Pastrami Burger and wow. Fresh, cooked well, and they had onion rings as a side option at no extra charge! Onion rings are my favorite kind of rings. They were crunchy and the onion did not slide out when you take a bite. That's a sign of a good ring! The burger was tasty and not overly salty. Pastrami tends to be salty and I was afraid it would be too much, but it was seasoned well and really good. Would eat again!

My partner got the french dip and I only to try one bite because he devoured it. Very flavorful au jus and if my love for onion rings wasn't so strong - I would get the potato salad. Flavorful and fresh tasting. It wasn't heavy like some potato salad can be. It was a cool contrast to the hot sandwich. 

Overall, great dining experience and will be here time and time again for late night eats. But might share a plate next time - the portions are very generous. They also have a cool lounge attached to the restaurant. Poked my head in and it looked like a chill place to hang out.

We saw this place on one of those food network shows .thought it would be amazing was very very disappointed.Hello I had some staple food Philly cheesesteak 'Subway has a better one '
My wife had pastrami it was like sandwich meat from prepackaged foods Sorry but I do not recommend !!!!!

This place screamed the bird cage (movie) and the lounge looked like it had once been a strip club with it's vintage Vegas ambiance which made it all that more fun for us tourists.

We enjoyed breakfast here on our way outta town this week after it came HIGHLY recommended by our hotel's front desk.

We got there before most of Vegas woke up (10am) and therefore missed a massive line but still had to wait about 15 minutes. 

We choose to hang in the lounge for a bit where we sat on plush, fuzzy couches and some of the best honey roasted peanuts I've ever had!?!

Breakfast was decently priced, the portions were HUGE and the service was friendly and our someone difficult orders were 100% accurate.

If it weren't for the $15 RT cab ride from our hotel, this place would be our usual go to from now on.

After a very long night, Elizabeth D. and i wake up and crawl into a cab. its about 3:30pm and we ask the cabbie where we can get a good breakfast. he says "the Peppermill is pretty good"

PRETTY GOOD?! This place is amazing. We didnt know what hit us, it was like our dreamland come true, except for all the smoke. yuck.

anyhoo, we shared the Fantasia waffle with sour cream (definitely the way to go) and the best biscuits and gravy that we had ever encountered in our entire lives.

The bloody mary would have been delicious if the celery stick wasnt monstrous and made every sip taste like i was actually taking a bite.

sooooo, after our meal we decided to check out the fireside lounge.  The fire pits in a hot tub? could this get any better?

the next day we dragged our tired asses and our friends back to our found treasure for our last meal in town. too bad i was hung over and threw up everything i ate on the way home : (  soooo worth it
The wait is definitely worth it here! Had the Chorizo and eggs and I DO NOT regret it! Lovveeeee it!

We literally come here every chance we get when we are in town. The food is so good and consistent and the atmosphere is amazing. Jame the bartender in the lounge was so friendly and made the best drinks we had all weekend!! We can't wait to go back :)
Awesum mushroom burger!!  We ate here 4 times in 12 days. Very comfortable inside!! Nachos are enormous!
Great place for a drink, especially on a cold night! Cozy bar area, but has a decent dining area as well. Love it here!

21 years I've been here and finally checked this place out. Wasn't disappointed. Great lounge for relaxed conversating. Nice mood set by the neon. Fire pits were a nice touch. Drink prices were good. Friendly waitress. Will have to check out the food next time.

Wasn't my first choice, just became the most convenient option before beginning the long drive home.

Have to admit, I was quite pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food.  We had 2 sandwiches and both were huge portions (if anyone knows me, they know if I say they are huge...they are) and delicious.  we had a hot pastrami sandwich and a french dip with straight horseradish.  Home made onion rings and a delicious red potato salad completed the meal....wasn't exactly ready for a 5 hour drive after we finished...a nap would have been preferred...but i was due at work in 6 hours haha

Service was friendly and efficient refilling my coffee about a zillion times in preparation for the drive

Very old school feel not glitzy and new. Expect to wait for a table, and they are open 24 hours. Food is good with large portion sizes. Service was decent. Love the tree in the middle of the restaurant. Menu has plenty of tasty choices. Check it out at least once. I would return.

I seriously had high hopes for this place. Everyone and their momma's baby's daddy's first cousin kept saying how good the food was; like toe curling good(allegedly). So my traveling buddy and I decided to get a early breakfast here after a night of debauchery on the strip. The restaurant had a late 80's Magnum PI type vibe going with the decor. I could dig it. It was cute. We were seated and promptly given menus. I ordered a typical breakfast(scrambled eggs and pancakes, hash browns). My traveling partner ordered  steak, eggs, and hash browns. Our food came out in a timely manner and the portions were more than sufficient, but when I say those were the gummiest eggs I have ever tasted..... babeee, terrible. I really don't want to believe they were powered but those couldn't have been fresh or the hen was past her prime. The pancakes were equally eek and they felt like bricks hitting the bottom of my stomach, just heavy and tasteless no matter how mud I tried to make them edible, I just gave up.

My buddy was a little indisposed( i.e a little hammered), so she actually didn't eat her steak until the next day, but she said it was delicious!. I don't know, maybe I just had a one off night and maybe if I got back, I will give Peppermill another try, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go there.
The food here was excellent and so was the ambience. The waiting staff was excellent as well. Keep up the good work!

This is an excellent place for meals in vegas. Breakfast all the time but the place is upbeat and alive with great food that comes out fast and is good to eat. The portions are enormous so come hungry. Bagels don't expect New York but the rest is top of the line. Love the sour dough myself. Ambience is adult but fun.

DO NOT USE YOU DEBIT CARD HERE!!!! The food was ok. My daughter and I had cheeseburgers. They were just ok. They came out on plain toasted bread. After the first bite the bread fell apart. They were not work $15 each! My husband had the $20 chicken fried steak dinner. The vegetables were bland as hell.  Sooooo not work the money. We went here the first day we arrived in Las Vegas. We stayed and played for 4 days. THREE WEEKS LATER OUR DEBIT CARD WAS CHARGED FROM THIS RESTAURANT!!!! Seriously....three weeks later! I will never eat here again. The food was mediocre, the service was ok and it took three weeks to charge our card! We went here because they were on the Food Network. We were very disappointed. We ended up spending $65 for food, drinks and taxes

This was our first time at the Peppermill and we were NOT disappointed. The service was excellent, Elisha was our server and she was very nice and quick. We were a group of 8 with a 10 month old baby and all the orders were correct and brought out very quickly. 
They have a big selection of breakfast plates and ALL the food that we ordered was excellent. It was also very well priced. 

I will definitely go back to eat there when I'm in Las Vegas and I would gladly reccomend it to anybody!
Very good but a little pricey though. The fire in the bar area is very cool though. The food is good. Very nice place

First off, please know that the Peppermill will almost always be packed when you visit. You will probably always have a wait if you want to sit down and dine. Lucky for you, there is an actual LOUNGE (with actual FIRE) off to the side of the host's kiosk. Go in there after you give your name, and enjoy a drink while you wait. Otherwise you'll be crammed up against Martha from Sheboygan and her husband, Herb, who lost a little too much at the penny slots and are throwing elbows and creating their own line for the counter spots (they're first come, first serve).

Portions are ginromous. Food is All-American. Haute cuisine, this is not, but satisfying to the American palate, it is.

Decor is fun, and this place is just kind of a fun gimmick. If you've got a tourist friend (or you are a tourist), looking for a "gosh, that's fun" kind of dining experience, then this is it. Think of it as an electric carnival 80s neon Denny's on acid.

A throwback to another time, this bar is a blast! The sunken fire pit and mirrored walls are straight from the 60's/70's. Food is great, good service. get off the strip and try this place with your friends!

What a fun place!! Cool decor and great food! Would be 5 stars but -1 for the service at the front area.  Had an hour wait on a Saturday but took longer because the receptionist forgot to call out our name.... Not sure why.

We hung out in the bar area for drinks and enjoyed the inside fire place.

When we finally got to the food, we ordered an omelette and steak/eggs.  Everything was really well seasoned and huge portions for the price.  5 stars for all of the food.  Must go! Highly recommended!
Good food and customer service! Come hungry as the portions are huge! The restaurant had that old Vegas feel,
Portions here are crazy and the food was amazing great price you might want to call ahead and see how busy it is though you might have to wait around a bit other than that the food was amazing
This place is the best.  Spectacular old school beverages and an very relaxing atmosphere.
Great menu with lots of variety and backed up with good quality food and service. A great place to stop at any time of the day or night in Sin City.

The experience was amazing.. food was great.. portions were big.. service was good.. had a very cool vibe from the time we walked in.. was amused by the fact there's 3 different people serving you, one guy for regular drinks, one girl for food, and a cocktail waitress.. will for sure be back..

This rating is on the Lounge only as we did not eat.  It does not look like much from the outside, but the inside of the lounge is WAY cool!  Quiet, dark, not smoky, great service, cool fire pit.  Very nice place to escape from the strip.
We stumbled across this place while staying at the hilton grand vacations. Who knew it was a top breakfast spot!!! The line can get crazy so get here early. Huge portions and great service

"Fireside Lounge"

I absolutely love this place and no visit to Vegas is complete without it. Obviously, I can't give it higher than three stars because it's so cheesy, but I still love it. You enter through a standard diner (with pretty good cholesterol-heavy food) into a pink-and-blue-neon low-ceilinged room with a fire pit in the center. It's like passing from "Alice" into "Fantasy Island" to complete the '80s feel. I will give them points for the place always seeming very clean even though it's cluttered and hasn't been updated in an age (which is sort of the point). The plastic flower garland hanging everywhere isn't dusty and the cocktail servers in long black skirts slit up to the ying-yang are busy polishing the brass railings and plumping the cushions when not bringing drinks. The drinks aren't very good and tend to the sweet side on the cocktail menu. Hilariously, when I was last there, my buddy ordered a gin & tonic and the waitress asked, "Would you like olives with that?" He was a bit taken aback, but said, "No, typically it comes with a twist. Gin and tonic, right?" The waitress acknowledged the order and when she went to the bar, he turned to me and said, "I will bet you money I'm about to get a gin martini." Sure enough, he got a giant glass of gin with a twist of lemon it in. Thus was born the new drink, a Gin & Tonic-Hold the Tonic. This was a pretty basic fail, but it only makes you love the place more. It's kind of like your slightly mentally-challenged child--you can't help but have affection despite its issues.

Sour note: Since smoking is allowed, when there are various trolls puffing away at the bar, the low ceilings can make the smoke pretty oppressive.

My wife and I were staying at the Palazzo and wanted to get lunch away from the busiest part of the Strip. We heard that the Peppermill was a great place to go, so we decided to check it out.

There was about a twenty minute wait, so we went outside and walked around for a while. When we got back, there was only one table ahead of us and we were seated shortly after. 

The decor of the restaurant is truly unique. It felt like we were at a special event. That feeling was supported by the fact that someone was walking around taking commemorative pictures for each table. 

The menu was quite extensive and everything looked enticing. To help with our decision making, we looked around the restaurant at what order people had ordered. This did not help in the slightest as all of the food looked delicious and the portions were colossal. 

We ultimately chose an order of buffalo wings, gyros, onions rings, and three fried eggs. All of the food was really tasty. The wings were gigantic and had the perfect amount of heat to them. The gyro meat was flavorful and the pita bread was nicely toasted. The onion rings were piping hot and not greasy. Even though we were really hungry, we were still unable to eat all of our food due to the large portion size. 

While the food, service, and ambience were top notch, I am going to deduct a star for not accepting credit cards. Las Vegas isn't some small town in the middle of nowhere. There is no excuse to be cash only in 2017. We would have ordered drinks too if I wasn't capped by the cash in my wallet. 

Overall though, the Peppermill is a great place to eat and is well worth the trip to the north of the Strip.
I love the ambiance and decor of this place. It reminds me of times past. The food is sometimes not great and service can be slow but overall it's not bad.

Awesome retro decor!  We ordered the Lorraine omelet, hash browns, blueberry muffin,  French toast, side of scrambled eggs & bacon.  Huge portions enough for two adults & two kids.  Everything was served hot and quick!  We are coming here again!

If you're primary concern if value for money, look no further. Portions are huge, prices are not. The food is delicious. I had the Peppermill Omelet with extra avocado and a bagel with cream cheese and jam. All of it was very good. My fiancé had the Pancake Combo and liked it a lot. Pancakes are enormous. Great place for cheap and good traditional breakfast. The atmosphere is also pretty cool. Service is great.

Love the Peppermill! 

I love the old school vibe of the Fireside lounge, it is not a pounding music blaring nightclub, its a place to hang out enjoy a drink in a comfy booth and still have a conversation or cuddle!

Hubby and I enjoyed a cocktail and appetizer platter was way more food then we could eat as a midnight snack!

Loved the Watatini (watermelon martini) very yummy! can't wait to go back and try all the rest!

Yes for the 20 something set it may seem old or not the "in" thing but we think its a great place for a date or a nice evening with your sweetie!

i came here for the brunch...the place was quite unique...i like their fireside lounge because of the design and i have never seen before..the food was average..i ordered the egg bennedict and the joe special something....

CONCLUSION = RECOMMENDED!!

The Peppermill is my favorite breakfast spot in Vegas. Diner style seating and neon lights almost feels like you're at a strip club while I'm killing the biscuits & gravy. Whether it's up early because I'm at a work conference in Vegas or because I just got done on the strip, I love me some Peppermill!

We love the food and the portions are huge but it can get pretty busy which has lead to slow service... still a great 24/7 breakfast place and very convenient. There is counter seating which may be first come, first serve but the retro round booths are pretty cool.

hugest portions of food i have ever ever seen.

my ger-ger and i are big eaters
we ordered nachos for appetizer and 2 margaritas.
we barely finished the nachos.  being korean and jewish, we feel too guilty wasting food.  they were delicious!

we were too full to order dinner or dessert.

we'll have to come back for our intended dinner entrees next time in vegas!

A large group of us dined at the Peppermill for brunch while we were in town celebrating my husband's 50th birthday. We had an issue with one of our orders and the manager, Peggy, was very accommodating. She went above and beyond to enhance our experience and make sure we were satisfied. Our group truly appreciated her efforts. Peggy is awesome! We also had a fantastic waitress, but unfortunately can't recall her name. She was very sweet, helpful and got all of our complicated orders correct! We'll definitely be back during our future visits to Vegas. Thanks Peggy! We appreciate you

I've been wanting to go here since I was a child, and was pretty disappointed. The atmosphere and decor is very cool and retro! But, there were drunk people passed out in the booth next to me(kick them out?) and I was served coffee in a mug with red lipstick all around the rim. The food was good, kind of like a Dennys to be honest. It took almost 30 minutes to get my check when asking for it multiple times. All in all it was okay but I see no reason to come back.

We stopped here before we headed back home and we are glad we did as the restaurant holds up to its reputation.  My husband had fish and chips and I had the Reuben.  Both were excellent and huge servings.  Our server was very friendly and attentive.  The restaurant was built in the early 70s and has a retro disco like atmosphere that includes stained glass chandeliers with flamingos on them .  Be sure to check out the bar too, which has comfy sofas and fire pits to sip drinks around.  We loved this place and will be sure to make it our Vegas tradition.

This is a great place to go after everywhere else has closed down, sit around the indoor fires, and get weird with some random people sharing the booth with you.  Don't be fooled by going into the diner side, go to the bar side.  A Vegas classic that exemplifies what Vegas was like before $22 martinis and hipsters.  Long live the Peppermill.

You know if the lounge had someone in a sequin dress doing coke off one of the tables the feel of a 70's disco would have been dead on and that's not a bad thing. I loved the decor  it was clean we had one issue with a very confused server and the waitress went above and beyond to resolve it. 

The food was good and cooked as ordered and there was plenty of it, good service which is to be expected everywhere else, but this is Vegas where people go to dieThe Peppermill however is staffed by vibrant attentive staff. 

If you go spend some time in the lounge if you're too young see why the 70's were so strange if you're old enough you can revisit what you forgot in the booze coked filled era and relish that you made it out alive.

As a group sales manager from a neighboring hotel property who would often refer my guest to what I would describe as hidden Las Vegas gem, I am disgusted by the way I was treated by the manager Marie. She was rude and not customer service oriented when I had brought visiting family members in for dinner this evening. After spending a hefty bill bringing in a party of 8. To start one meal was about 20 min late to the table after everyone else had received their entree. Which was fine when the waitress returned several times and insisted the meal would be right out. At the conclusion of dinner the bill was presented at a certain amount. When at the cash registered the total amount then jumped significantly. They explained the late meal was never added to the check and that was the increase in price (indicating the meal was never sent to the kitchen, if that was the case the server should have honestly communicated and we would have canceled the meal.) nonetheless Marie the manager was a total bitch and insisted we pay which we did. With the way we were treated management at the Peppermill can count on never getting another referral from myself of my staff in the future! #somuchforalasvegasgem 
#managmentneedstraining 
#peppermilllasvegasnotcustomeroriented 
#nickelanddimeyou
#badboss
#badbusiness

Gotta love this place.

Where else at 4am after a night of drunken debauchery can you go and eat onion rings and/or pancakes? The food is what you would expect, diner style. I love the retro neon decor and the service is always good, in particular the waitress Dallas. For some reason I always seemed to end up in her section, which is awesome. Ive never been to the lounge side but Ive never really had a need to... perhaps one day.

Great place, I hope it continues to run strong for several more decades and not give in to the corporate sprawl of the strip.

Horrible service. Our waiter took forever to come to our table upon being seated. The picture girl took our picture, edited and brought it back to us to purchase and the waiter still hadn't showed up. Once he finally showed up, we ordered and we were very disappointed. The food was very mediocre, but I must say, the cocktails were pretty good. This place needs a serious makeover from the staff, to the decor, on down to the menu.
Lots of people in line but we were seated within a good time the food was great the service was excellent
Excellent breakfast - crowded but got a table in the time they said - wonderful waitress and the omelette and scrambles were good portions and reasonable in price!

I LOVE THIS PLACE. It was my first time visiting this restaurant and I was pleasantly surprised :) the atmosphere was retro and cool . When you walk in he hostess takes your name down and invites you to wait in a lounge (where I enjoyed a mimosa ) which has a really cool water/fire pit and music videos playing on flat screens above it ... so freaking cool!! We were called to our table shortly after and he restaurant was just as amazing , the ceiling and parts of the walls are lined with neon , the ceiling appears to be made of like disco ball material , there are these really  cool trees in areas of the restaurant , rainbow sugar , bomb food ... I can go on and on this place is a must try if your ever in the area. Food and ambiance was on point , loved this place ! 
I had the pepermill pancake combo, it's a large dish by you won't be disappointed, it comes
With a side of eggs ( in a separate dish , loved !)  two sausage links and two pieces of bacon and of course a stack of three fluffy delicious pancakes with a side of maple  syrup. It was sooo good! I will come again for sure !

Big portions of delicious food, 24 hours, awesome throw-back ambiance... what more do you want?  It's always busy so be prepared to wait.  I try not to leave without having the mud pie... bring a friend or two!

I was lucky that my new local friends pointed me to this spot.

This is old Las Vegas.. tacky to the max with the neon colors in the napkins, décor, etc.  I loved it.  There is a cocktail waitress who served good Bloody Mary's (heard the mimosas weren't that good).. and the food was large in portion but in my opinion.. not as good as Hash A Go Go.  Hash Browns were incredibly crispy and delicious.

The most amazing part is the fireside lounge where it's a round lounge around a fire that's on water.  It's truly amazing and reminds me of what a backroom of a strip club would look like if I were to go to those in Vegas (I haven't although I tried to once.. I swear!)

Great spot to visit... 3.5 stars.  Free parking and gladly it is not on the Strip with all the terrible parking and traffic.

Um, yuck. First, let me say that I don't like diner food, I detest "breakfast" foods (pancakes, waffles, maple syrup, sausages, etc.: OMG vom) and "traditional" "American" food barely qualifies as food IMO. (Pizza, burgers and chow mein: now THAT's American! Meatloaf and steak & eggs: ICK!) So to say that this is not the place for me is an understatement. It IS, however, open 24/7 and near-ish my hotel.

First trip: I ordered fettucine alfredo with shrimp. The portion size was not as big as a lot of places, but that's OK because it was gross. The sauce was gummy and didn't taste fresh, the few shrimp were large, but a little tough, and the noodles were not what you'd call al dente. The garlic bread with "cheese" on it was revolting.
My mum ordered the Chicken & Red Pepper Pasta. Hers was better than mine, though her penne was also overcooked. The sauce was pretty good, the red pepper strips were, I swear, Mezetta brand right out of the jar (but I like those), and they were right on the money when they described it as chicken stuffed with herbs and cream cheese; it tasted just like Philadelphia Cooking Creme Italian Cheese & Herb flavour.
Second trip: I ordered New York steak and Shrimp Scampi. I ordered it cooked medium, it was definitely well done. The shrimp were, too. My mother ordered some icky breakfast foods, so I didn't taste them, but she said they were OK.
I think if you like breakfast foods (served all day) and diner food, you'll like this place, but I will avoid it. The waitresses were cute and helpful, though. And the decor is amusing.

if you want large portions, this is your place!  The neon was about as cheesy as it gets, which I loved!  

If you have a hard time making decisions (like me), this place can be overwhelming because the menu is HUGE.

The hash browns....wow! yum!
Love this place! The food is great. The portions are Hugh! The service is the best.

This is apparently part of Vegas history.  It is retro meets Rainforest Cafe except the food is really good.  I had the crab cake Benedict's with hash browns.  It was surprisingly good! I would definitely go back.
Haven't been here yet but if it would be like the one in Reno Nevada it's got to be great I'll let you know sometime soon

I have been here about three times with friends and my child and then I have been here with a film crew the desert portions are a gigantic I think everything is gigantic but it's definitely a mix of a tourist trap and locals who like to sit by the fire in the separate room the service is very good parking is never a problem and this place has a good reputation since it's been there for
A really long time it's a Vegas favourite
It is open 24 hours and I have tried multiple things at multiple times so I can't remember much of anything particular I have some pictures that I can upload
But I would have to dig for them I know there's many film crews that's that by this place so don't be surprised if you see a camera someplace

Meh is the best way I can think of to describe this place. Had breakfast here last Sunday because I wanted to reminisce early visits to Vegas when I would stay on the north end of the strip and ate here.

Now I remember why I only ate at Peppermill a couple of times. WAAAAYYY!!! overpriced. Food was so so, service was ok but none of it was worth the money. I only went here to avoid stuffing myself at the buffets!

The wife and I went here in the recommendation of a friend. Loved the retro decor. Food was good and portions were very generous. Cups of coffee were much larger than your average diner and better quality too. Heard the servers sing happy birthday in an interesting way a couple of times. Neat place that I'm sure I'd come back to.
This is one of those places that are busy just because it's 24hrs, the food is very bland my sister and I had two different dishes and neither had any flavor I probably won't go back
It's a romantic timewarp!  The firey pits (see photo) are really cool and the decor is 70's all the way.  It's a nice change of pace from the rest of the strip.

When my friends and I went to Las Vegas, we were told we had to go the Peppermill for the best breakfast in Las Vegas. I couldn't agree more. We went for breakfast and had only a 20 minute wait, which we enjoyed by sipping Bloody Marys in the Fireside Lounge. 

Vegas is the place for excess and the Peppermill abides by that spirit. The menu sports 10-egg omelettes and a 22-oz milkshake. I thought the Peppermill had an excellent selection of food. While not unique, the menu was extensive and has all the staples. The food was good and the prices were quite reasonable for Las Vegas. It's definitely a Vegas must-do.
Absolutely loved this place. The food was amazing, can't wait to come again. And my Bloody Mary was yummy!
Always awesome no matter what time of day or night. Perfect old fashion favorite. Hope it always stays the same. But it is Vegas

Ok, so the food is a 3 to be honest. A solid 3 though. The kind you aren't going to remember per se but it hit the spot. That being said the experience and fun that screams old world Vegas makes it a 5. I feel like I've transcended time and get a taste of how my favorite city felt back in its glory days. I highly recommend!

Wow,  five stars all the way.  Hint if its just two of you,  it's first come first serve at the counter.   We saved  45 min of waiting. The food is amazing,  at least the French Toast ambrosia.  You think okay french toast with fruit and whipped cream,  no big deal,  but then you add bosenberry syrup,  OMG you have heaven in your mouth.   The servings are huge if you order most bread products,  french toast, pancakes, you are going to want to share those or take home half. We will be back for the fireside lounge too.

The Peppermill feels like a truly Las Vegas experience! Anyplace else in the world and this place would be quite out of place but in LV, it's freaking perfect! Neon all over the place and kitschy as hell! (In a good way) I know all the reviews talk about this but I can't stress this enough: the portions are huge!! If you're like me and like to have leftovers, by all means get a plate just for yourself and unless you're Joey Chestnut or Adam Richman, you can expect more than enough for another full meal at home. If you're a tourist though and won't be taking a doggie bag, please do yourself a favor and share a plate with your partner so there won't be so much food wasted. The only reason I gave 4/5 is because the waitress, although friendly, just wasn't super attentive. That being said, I'd definitely come back and would most likely bring a date because this restaurant/lounge is just too kitschy/glitzy/vegasy (is that a word?) not to love.

We went here for breakfast our first day in Vegas and were VERY happy. The portions are large, the food was very good, and the prices aren't too bad. If I return to Vegas, I definitely want to come back and try dinner / drinks.

Perfect diner for a late night snack. Great huge portions right on the Strip. Saw one guy eat a chicken fried mozzarella steak hero sandwich with onion rings tooth picked into the top. Five minutes into it, his eyeballs turned white with 3 sevens across them. He fell out of the booth and yelled, "I just paid off!" That's a late night Vegas diner, baby.

If I could leave this place no stars, I would.

For starters, the "greeters" were gossiping when we walked in, and halfway acknowledged us as they led us to our table. I realize they frequently have drunk people coming in after bars let out (2am-6am ish) but it's midnight and we are sober.

Our waitress was friendly, but couldn't tell me what percentage of fat was in the ground beef they use for the burgers. The cook went to the back and read the box, and said it was 75% fat. Haha, ok. That doesn't exist in real life, so I asked the waitress if she could please check, even though I correctly suspected they meant 25% fat. The kitchen staff appeared to be overly annoyed that I even asked, let alone requested a second look. Excuse me for caring about what I put into my body. At any rate, 75/25 chuck? Not exactly what I was expecting based on their trumped-up description on their menu.

I ordered the buffalo chicken wrap and sweet potato fries. It was good, until a large glob of what appeared to be someone's spit dripped out of the bottom of my wrap. My stomach turned and I couldn't eat another bite. I felt like vomiting as I used the wooden skewer to inspect the substance on the edge of my plate, which clearly was not a food product. Yep, definitely spit. Thankfully I spotted it before I bit into that area of the wrap!!!

I told the waitress, and she tried her best to act surprised. She told the manager, who came over to defend her staff, and tell me over and over "they don't do that" there. Right. Angry employees spit in food everyday in all types of restaurants. The manager offered something else (no thanks, don't need more spat-upon dishes). But, she didn't seem apologetic, nor was she able to explain what it was, if not spit. What ingredient in a grilled buffalo chicken wrap is the consistency and color of someone's nasal drip? None.

Nothing more was said, they just removed it from the bill. I will absolutely never return, and I will vehemently steer friends away from this place.

If you are starving and this is the only thing open, just go to bed hungry.

Today was the first time I have ever been to the Peppermill and unfortunately I was very disappointed. Especially because my friends talked so highly of this place.

First we checked out the Fireside Lounge and it was happy hour. My friends and I ordered the famous Scorpion drink and MAN it was super strong! For our appetizers we ordered crab cakes, shrimp cocktail and chips and salsa.  The crab cakes could have been better. To me there was really no flavor to them. 

After hanging out in the Fireside lounge we went over to grab something to eat for dinner. We got fettuccine Alfredo, shrimp scampi Acapulco, and pork loin and eggs. My boyfriend and I were very disappointed with our food. My shrimp scampi wasn't good at all. So bland.

All in all, I don't think I'll ever come back for the food but definitely for drinks and appetizers.

The Fireside Lounge is a cool place to hang out. I was craving a Bloody Mary so we stopped in for some drinks. Their Bloody Mary's were pretty good! Definitely enjoyed the atmosphere to go with it. Watching 90's music videos by the fireside was pretty sweet too! 

We came back the next day for some more drinks (it is Vegas afterall!) and some food. The Hawaiian Mimosas were amazing! Not sure if they were worth $10, considering you don't get much. After we got our drinks we waited for a table for about 30 minutes. Once we sat down we were greeted by our waitress, who started off very attentive and then soon disappeared until our check was delivered. I ordered the eggs benedict which were very mediocre. My friend ordered a corned beef egg dish that was also relatively bland. 

Overall, food was nothing special, drinks were pretty good, and atmosphere is great!

Came here during mid August during the weekend and it was packed. Even though it was completely packed they say you down quickly and the service was faster than in other places with a fifth of the people. Food was also good and portions were very generous.
Amazing!!! Go!!! We were quoted 1.5 hour wait. Took an hour, but time fly by eating tasty appetizers and drinking great drinks in the lounge. Service was top notch and the food was great!

My husband and I are still talking about our Valentine's Day breakfast . . . not only was the service great, but the food was delicious! 

Approximately 8:30am we went to have a celebratory breakfast. When you walk in, the lights are dimmed, lots of teal/pink/purple colors. Cool vibe. 
And I have to add, the music selection was fantastic!!

I ordered the Eggs Benedict: 3 eggs over two English muffins, Canadian bacon, and smothered with a flavorful, rich, hollandaise sauce. Golden brown, crispy hash browns served on the side. 

My husband ordered the New York Steak and eggs: 3 eggs (he ordered over-easy), perfectly charred Med-Rare steak grilled with hash browns on the side. He chose a toasted English muffin on the side. 

To drink, I had a spicy dbl Bloody Mary, and my hubby had a dbl vodka soda. Good pours and yummy

The bill came to $65.81. Certainly not the cheapest breakfast in town, but the large portions, ambiance, and great service was without a doubt worth it!

Overall, it exceeded our expectations and we can't wait to try lunch and dinner next.

Decor: Neon lights made me feel like I was dining in a disco bar. 

I had great memories of the muffins and the Rueben at peppermill that I had to come back. We arrived around 11 and were seated right away. This lady jacked us for $10 saying she would give us a free postcard photo. The photo on the postcard was hella small, so we had to buy the bigger version for $10. Mom and I split a Rueben (salty and too much bread) and bran muffins which were most excellent. Dad said the egg Benedict sucked, and bf said his omelette was really heavy and just ok. Maybe I will just picked up some muffins to go next time. By the time we left there was a line out the door!

The bus ladies were super nice and one lady kept checking if everything was okay. Our server though didnt seem to care about us but only that we got our food and she got her money. The girl serving our drinks was always coming around asking if we wanted more. Theyre hawaiian sunset mimosas are delicious, but pricey. For 6 drinks it came out to about $60. The servings are big and satisfying. I loved my steak and eggs but couldnt finish them so I took it to go. The retro, old school Vegas theme is cool. I dont mind it. They were super busy during lunch but we didnt mind it as long as the drinks came coming in. The bathrooms were super clean and there was always someone there cleaning it. I would give it a 5 if it wasnt for our server.

Don't understand the rating for this place. Food was OK. Had the Crab cake benedict - a bit fishy, english muffin could be more crispy, hollandaise sauce was good. Bacon on the side - love mine extra crispy but the ones I had did not reach level of crispiness that I like.

Pastrami with hash browns... That is all. But really, everything here is amazing. Bomb diner food with that Vegas feel. You can't go wrong with whatever you order here. Please enjoy as its my favorite.
The " Munchie's" breakfast was really delicious and the pancakes are good as well, but beware because the pancakes are huge!! Sharing is definitely par for the course.

Love Neon lights while your dining?  Then you've come to the right spot.  First of all the portion size is big.  Sharing a meal would be a good idea or you'll need a wheel barrel out this place. 

I've only been here for breakfast whenever in Vegas.  It should be on your to go list-dining if your an out of towner.
The menu ha everything for everyone and the food is great.  
If you walk in and there's no wait then your lucky.  Otherwise expect to wait for a while.  
Ambience is unique and something Vegas offers no where else.  Polyester uniforms and shimmering tights for servers bring you back to 80's flashback.  
Nothing fancy just great grub. You won't regret it.  Enjoy!
Off to the next meal adventure my friend...

I kind of felt like I was in an old mobster movie in Las Vegas. I loved the fire pit, experiencing that and being able to take pictures, I felt like a tourist attraction. The food was ok, not really what I expected. But it was tasty enough. The seating was a bit squashy, but we made do and the service was pretty good.

As Trump would put it, the peppermill portions are "HUGE". I got their corn beef and hash. It certainly hit the spot after a night of adult beverage consumption. But sadly, I could only finish less than half in one seating. 

Hubs got the ham plate and a side of pancakes. Even he could not finish half of his plate. The rest of the ham is sitting in my fridge as a leftovers. 

I love the ambiance of this place. It's quirky and fun. The wait goes fairly quickly so don't get discouraged of the waiting list.

I'm a big fan of "old time Vegas"....and old time is 60's and 70's. I remember Las Vegas when it was an adult place to play and people dressed decently to go out for a special night. So I try to search for places that have been around for a while to get the same feel of what it was back then. They are there but you got to look hard to find them. 

The Peppermill is one of them...Great ambiance, good food, ample portions and very comfortable. The decor is flashy Vegas but really Kool.

If you are tired of the same old thing and eating at soulless hotel restaurants, coffee shops, Mickey d's and the like.....go here. It's fun, different and the food is good. And...Don't forget to visit the lounge!!

This is a long overdue review since I've gone here 3 out of the 6 times I've been to Vegas in the past few years. It's a popular spot after partying for diner faire. Not much else to say. The service has always been friendly and fairly attentive, even when it's packed at 1-2 in the morning. Waters get filled. Missing silverware is replenished if need be. I get my Tabasco before my meal arrives. Seating isn't too big of an issue either. Parking seemed not be much of a challenge on the weekends either. Don't let the pricing scare you, if the menu said it's $12 for an omelette, you really do get $12 worth of omelette and sides. Not a bargain compared to some other deals around the strip, but it's okay. If I had a choice to skip out on this place late at night and go elsewhere, I wouldn't mind. A change of pace from "tradition" or a routine wouldn't hurt anyone, especially in Vegas. If my friends want to go here, I still don't mind.

As for the food you get, it's not bad. It hits the spot at that time of the night. Always good times to crowd around a booth with a bunch of your buddies just to recap your night of partying and tell stories over a meal. LIke I said, the portions are huge. Unfortunately, having left overs in the middle of a Vegas trip isn't such a great thing since most hotel rooms don't have a fridge, let alone a microwave to reheat your food. If you're a normal eater, sharing your plate with someone else might be a good idea. Or if you're drunk and starving, perfect! I like the fact that a bran muffin is a choice as far as toast/muffin/biscuit options go with your breakfast. I usually save the muffin for the next morning for those really slow starts to the day. You know how it is when you party in Vegas. Sleep late, wake up late. Eat a ....bran muffin with your complimentary hotel coffee?

I love this place so much! Every time we go down to the strip I look forward to stopping by the Peppermill. This place has a nice, intimate, and relaxing atmosphere. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the parking could be better. Hey, it is downtown Vegas though what do I expect?! Hope you have a good time and good memories like I do if you decide to go here.

Ambiance is neat, but food was bland, cocktail waitress was pretty rude when we told her our Bloody Mary tasted like it had no alcohol in it.  Wouldn't advise getting any drinks with vodka in it. Our extra shot was cheap quality well liquor and didn't even help the drink.

You know what. There's really only one way to describe this place.

"Upper class Denny's, good looking servers, and humungous portions"

Seriously that is all that you need to know. The food portions here are so big that there is no way you cannot get full. You thought Denny's was good? Denny's can't even touch this. I'm not saying that it's the MOST delicious breakfast food I've eaten. What I am saying is that they will fill you until your gut explodes.

Oh one more thing. If you are hung over, go here for breakfast. Yup.

The ambiance is what I envision old Las Vegas to be - very casual/relaxed! We had the focaccia sandwich and the peppermill burger, and both were great! I highly recommend either. We also came a bit later in the evening so that we could enjoy their 9-11 happy hour, which has many options for food and drinks.

The staff was very friendly and helpful! I highly recommend stopping by if you're in the Las Vegas area.

Great place to eat and drink late night on the strip. We hit the restaurants around 10PM and service fairly prompt given how busy the place was. We ordered the Eggs Benedict and roast beef sandwich. Both tasted great! I'd compare this place to an upscale Denny's with atmosphere and look (like many have already said) of a cruise liner. 

We did order a couple of drinks (which you must order from the cocktail waitress instead of your server for some reason) and they tasted great as well. (We ordered the 64 ounce monster drink) Overall a great place to stop by for some decent late night food. Parking was easy to find also.

On the day of us leaving Vegas, our friend really loved his breakfast at the Peppermill before we took off. Since I haven't been to the restaurant yet, I was pretty excited to go check it out. 

The restaurant was decorated like a strip club without the poles. It was colorful and packed with people. I ordered steak and eggs and also crab cake, slave girl got the crab cake benny. 

The benny was OK. I actually didn't try it but slave girl said it wasn't bad. 

I asked my steak cooked to medium rare and it actually came out right! My only issue was part of the steak tasted bitter. Don't ask me how, but it did and I had no idea why. The only thing that really pissed me off was, I asked for over easy on eggs and it came out scrambled.

The crab cake was actually forgotten, well, not by the kitchen, but by our waitress. It came with 3 pieces and it was actually very tasty.

The service was shit. We got no water even after we asked for water. Our server never checked on us and we had to wave her over like in a Chinese restaurant. She forgot my crab cake and screwed up my egg order. When we were ready to leave, I couldn't get a box to pack my food since she was no where to be found. When I finally got up to get the box myself, our sever saw me and stopped me. She told me to return to my seat and would bring one to the table. THEN she came to the table empty handed, wtf? That was when she told me she wanted to pack it for me. At that point I didn't want to have extra stuff in my leftover so I asked for the box, again.

Peppermill, just because you were in couple of movies didn't make you god. Count me out for life.

This restaurant was the first dinner spot of Mink's first trip to Vegas. We met Sheila G., Mel C. and Terri R. there. They were great company and gave us some awesome recommendations of new restaurants to check out while visiting. Our lively conversation definitely matched the lively ambiance of the restaurant. Imagine waking into a strip club but instead of strippers, you have diners. Even the sugar here is very colorful. 

Mink doesn't eat much so she found something on the menu that was just her portion size. Unfortunately our server told us that it's only available for kids and seniors. I felt that he could have made an exception but he didn't. Mink ended up ordering from the available menu and threw away 80% of her plate. What a waste. Positive note is portions are generous here. Mel C said they use 10 eggs for their omelette. 

I ordered their French Dip with a Hot Tea. There is no photo because they took forever to bring my order out. Everyone was eating already and I was hungry so I dug right in. Sandwich was decent and onion rings weren't too greasy. The au ju it came with was average. Meal was a little greasier than I'm accustomed to so my stomach was definitely not a fan. 

Customer service was decent but lack of professionalism when we asked to have a group photo taken. One of the workers kept pushing our photographer while she was trying to take our photo. We ended up with some blurry photos. That concluded the evening so it left a negative impression of this establishment. 5 star company but unfortunately that can't be said about this restaurant.

You need to chill and have drinks but you're hungry..., this is your spot. The wings are freakn bomb, the drinks Freakn Delicious, and the atmosphere Supa chill. Big group or just with yr 'date' it will start or end the night right. Love the pit style seats in the bar, nice comfy sofas and the hostesses are very nice always checking in with their guests. They have TV screens in all areas.

This place is extraordinary! The setting is beautiful! They have a dim botanical garden kind of theam. I ordered the Mediterranean omelet and a the sin city.  The portions and huge so me and my sunificant other were able to share.  Prices are reasonable and it was busy but the food came really quick. Everything was beautiful.  Only thing I didn't like was the mimosa comes with ice. The restaurant is part of Las Vegas history and the have a beautiful lounge as well.

Las Vegas is an inbreed hick town.  Just look at the UNLV masott, he looks Wiley Coyotte or a  confederate slaver.  Somebody recommended this place to me because of the night life. I was hesitant about any place named the Peppermill, Buttery or Cupake factory.  It sounds  Leave it to Beaver white.  Well, my suspicions were confirmed this weekend.  An African-American women wearing Hijab was asked to remove her hijab because it was gang-releated. Later it was deemed a miscommunication. Sure, we know what is going on.  If you are not a Trump supporter, boycott this racist business.  If fact, I suggest you boycott the whole state unless you go into a business that is minority owned and run.

BELIEVE THE HYPE!!!  The portions are BIG! Old Skool Vegas at its best. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner! I like the fact you can get a cocktail anytime it seems. My breakfast was delicious. My scramble eggs with cheese were cooked to my liking and the pancakes were really tasty. YesI had a cocktail with my breakfast! Hey it is Vegas!

We visited The Peppermill for breakfast with my family. We wanted a place that was centrally located, and had good food at decent prices. We were not disappointed!

None of us had been there before, so we made the mistake of ordering an entree each. Their servings are really big! I fill up fast, so I ended up taking more than half of my meal home. My aunt and I both ordered the Spinach and Feta omelette and I really enjoyed it. It had a good amount of feta cheese, which is a big deal to me. They serve it with potatoes and bread. I chose the blueberry muffin which was served warm. Yum!  

My mom ordered the fruit plate and it was enormous. It included strawberries, grapes, honeydew, banana, cantaloupe, pineapple and watermelon. They also give you a small banana nut loaf with marshmallow cream. It was so good!  

My grandma ordered the Pancake combo. It came with three large pancakes, three eggs, two bacon strips and two sausage links. It was a very large entree. I should also mention that I really enjoyed the coffee here. 

All in all, it was a great and very filling meal. The service was really good as well. I'm sure we'll go back.

Was really excited to try this place. My pastrami burger was brought to the table and after the first bite I found a hair in the burger. They said they would make me a second d burger which took another 20 minutes. The food quality just didn't hit the spot for me. Even after the remake. Was willing to give it a second try but not a single manager came up to the table or was able to talk. Oh well, I had high hopes for this place. At least the interior and our waitresses were nice.
Great service, big plates of great food ..love the atmosphere of allowance but it's a restaurant.

I ordered Philly and fries = horrible.  Philly was dry chip beef.... and I mean dry!  My husband ordered Giro w/onion rings.  He thought Giro was ok but would rather have my uncooked fries (even thou I ordered them well) over his onion rings.
Can honestly say we will not be back.  The cab driver brought us there  after 10 pm... maybe the A squad wasn't there cooking anymore.

I ate here and it was great! Very chaotic but the food was delicious. I tried to place a pick up order with Candy, and she said they cannot do pickup orders. Only in person orders which is super inconvenient. They will forever loose money this way. 3 stars for the inconvenience.

Back again for the 2nd night in a row. & no let downs again - staff was awesome food was huge & good . This time I had chicken fried steak meal. & she got breakfast , & we had the half order of nachos which is enough for 4 - not the cheapest grub on the strip  but  quality & portion make it well worth it . Try it & you will see why it is still standing after so many others have fallen away.

Funky Fabulous! 

After reading these reviews I simply had to see the Fireside Lounge and it did not disappoint. 

The decor is Disco Pink meets a 1980's Cocaine Party and throw in LOTS of fake trees. 

Drink prices reasonable too!

Saw on a Vegas forum about this place and the rave reivews. I wanted to try new places out in Vegas. Went with my brother and sister. It was ok. I split a omelette with my brother and my sister tried the French Dip and said it was ok/good. The portions are huge!
